loans.name: Mina

texts.en: Mina is married and has 7 children.  She sells footwear in Aburasa, which she has done for 3 years. Mina uses her income to support her husband's income in the general upkeep of their home. She will use the loan to purchase footwear. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mina plans to invest.

loans.use: to purchase footwear to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has 4 children. She sells footwear in the town of Aburasa, near Elmina. She has sold footwear for 6 years. Her husband is a tailor. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility and housing bills.  Ekua will use the loan to purchase more footwear to sell. With the new profits, Ekua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more footwear to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has 5 children. She is a food vendor: she cooks rice vegetable stew for sale in the town of Aburasa, near Elmina. She has done this for 3 years. Her husband is a farmer. Ama uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase bags of rice and vegetables to cook her stew for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to build a better stall for the sale of her cooked food.

loans.use: to purchase rice and vegetables to make food for sale

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 56 years old and from San Miguel, Bohol. For 25 years, she has been a rice farmer in her town to earn a living for her family. Elisa and her husband, who is also a farmer, have three children. 

Elisa is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, insecticides and a sprayer for her crops. Elisa hopes to achieve an abundant harvest in the coming months so she can provide for her family a healthy diet, a house renovation, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, insecticides and a sprayer.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 48-year-old single woman, owner of a grocery store since 2002. She used to sell women clothes but she turned to a more profitable income business. 

Alia's store is located in a dense region which requires a lot of care and always keeps it full with everything her customers need. Her products are of a high quality, and her prices are affordable.  Because of this she has highly loyal customers.

Alia is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to start a new business and increase her store's merchandise based on her customers' needs.

She will open an internet cafe, that will attract almost all of the region's kids and teenagers, and will help her to increase her income, improve her quality of living and help her save for her elderly living.

She aims to expand her business from a small grocery store into a wide supermarket.

loans.use: to start a new business and increase her grocery store's merchandise

loans.name: Emerito

texts.en:
Emerito is a 43-year-old married man and a father of three children from Talibon, Bohol.

Emerito has had an ice-cream making business for almost 10 years now. He works hard to support his family, especially for the schooling of his children.

He wants a loan to buy more milk, sugar and other ingredients for making ice cream. Emerito hopes to expand his business and save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more milk, sugar and other ingredients for making ice cream.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married with six children. Lorna is 44 years old and lives in Punta, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Lorna buys and sells charcoal to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell on a retail basis.

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Lorna hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell on a retail basis.

loans.name: Hannah Waruguru

texts.en:
Hannah used her previous loan well in that she bought rabbits and rabbit feeds and both business are doing so well. Hannah has another child and now she has four children who are all going to school.

She has been in the farming business for three years, with a monthly income of KES.12,000, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Hannah will use the loan to buy a dairy cow. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her dairy farming and improve her family living standard.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lillian is 42 years old. She is a mixed crop farmer, and she is married to Rufus, who is a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been in the farming business for the past 15 years with the monthly income of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings), which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD. after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Lillian will use the loan to buy a water tank. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will buy a dairy cow and venture into zero-grazing farming. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children up to the university level and improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: To buy a water tank.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is married and has one child. Gregorio is 49 years old and lives in Molos, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.  Gregorio is a farmer and operates a rubber farm to earn a living. He has been doing this for 5 years. He has requested a loan of 5000PHP to purchase fertilizers for his rubber farm.
Gregorio is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Gregorio hopes to buy another area for his rubber farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his rubber farm

loans.name: Hyra

texts.en:
Hyra is thirty years old. She lives in Kosovo and is a mother of four. She has two boys and two girls between the ages of twenty-three and twenty-five. Three of her children go to school. Hyra is very hardworking women.
 
The family's main income comes from her husband who works as a guard. Hyra’s family has had a problem with their bathroom for a long time and don't have the money for repairs.  The money that her husband earns through his work is not enough to pay for the repairs.    

Hyra is requesting a 300 EUR loan to buy bathroom tiles and repair their toilet. Hyra and her family thank Kiva lenders for their help and for helping them improve their family’s living conditions. She hopes for her children a good education because she believes that they are the future and should be very well educated.

loans.use: To buy the tiles and repair their toilet.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is a 53-year-old farmer from the community of Trinidad, Bohol.  She has been growing rice for a living for 15 years now. This is her way of helping her husband who works as a driver to provide for the needs of their family. She and her husband have five children: four are adults and the youngest is 19 years old and still in school. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pay the tuition fees of her child. She hopes that with the loan, her farming will become sustainable and will produce a better yield. She is also optimistic that her child will finish their education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for her child's tuition fees.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia is 58 years old and lives in Silucap, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has six children.  Artemia has a shoe repair shop business and earns approximately 4000PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase materials for her shoe repair shop.
Artemia has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Artemia hopes to expand her shoe repair shop.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her shoe repair shop

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 33-year-old farmer from Litein County in Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for six years, producing tea and milk.  He sells these products to the people around his local area.

He is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES, to purchase a dairy cow, which will help to increase his milk production.  This will mean more income, which will improve his standard of living and will take care of his family's needs and wants.  Wilson aspires to increase the number of his dairy cows, which he hopes will be able to produce fifteen litres of milk daily, each.

Lack of enough feed and water for his dairy cows are his major challenges.

Wilson thanks Juhudi Kilimo for giving him the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
For over five years in Poblacion, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Leah, a 30-year-old single woman, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 2,800 PHP a month for these activities.

Recently, Leah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc., to sell in her store.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc., to sell in her store.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is a 22-year-old woman who runs a convenience store business known as a sari-sari store for more than a year now. This is the source of her income.

Elna dreams of expanding her business but lacks the capital to do so. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks such as canned goods, noodles, snack food and others to sell in her store.

Elna hopes of making her business a success and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks such as canned goods, noodles, snack food and others to sell in her store

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah's group is comprised of 6 hard-working women. Sarah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Makidye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and paying her house rent and buying food for her famiy. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to own another salon. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale,

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is married and has six children. She is 42 years old and lives in Goaw, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte 
.
Estrella is a farmer and grows vegetables to sell. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP, to purchase fertilizers.

Estrella has been a member of PMPC for three years. Estrella hopes to expand her garden to plant other vegetables, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Eutiquiano

texts.en:
Eutiquiano is a 58 year old married man and a father of three school-age children from Talibon, Bohol. He has been in the tailoring business for more than 25 years now.

Eutiquiano is asking for a loan to buy additional materials such as cloth, thread, needles and other items. He  believes that this loan could help him improve his livelihood and income.

In the future, Eutiquiano dreams of expanding his business to augment his income and save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy additional materials such as cloth, thread, needles and other items.

loans.name: Ruth Rina

texts.es: La Sra. Ruth  tiene 41 años y tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de 12 y 9 años, ella se dedica a la  venta de peluches en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en una de las calles más concurridas de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ruth va a usar este préstamo para compra de peluches por fardo y juguetes para surtir su  negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es crecimiento de su negocio, la Sra. Ruth enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la misma calle donde vende existen varias personas que se dedican a la misma actividad, va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar sus productos y su calidad de vida. Su deseo  para su negocio es montar una tienda propia y poder exponer la variedad de peluches que tiene para la venta
texts.en: Ruth, 41, has two children whose ages are 12 and 9.  She sells stuffed toys in her stand located in one of Cochabamba’s busiest streets.  This loan is her third sequence in the institution and Ruth will use it to buy stuffed toys by the bundle and to buy toys to stock her business.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to expand the business.  The business challenge Ruth faces is competition because there are many others selling the same things on the street where she’s located.  She will use profits to improve her products and her quality of life.  Her wish for the business is to open a store of her own to display the variety of stuffed toys she has for sale.

loans.use: to buy stuffed toys by the bundle and to buy toys.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is 33 years old. She is married and lives in Telavi District, East Georgia, with her parents-in-law and children. 

Natela works as a nurse locally and earns a small monthly income. Her parents-in-law are provided with a retirement pension. The family can be esteemed to belong to the vulnerable poor category. Natela used to have a small poultry farm, but the hens died of fowl plague. 

Now she has requested a loan for re-starting the farm. She received the loan in the framework of a start-up loan program, initiated jointly by Credo and Kiva. This program aims at provision of business start-up or business re-start credits to Georgian rural poor who do not have access to regular credit products, as they live in poverty and are regarded as “borrowers with high risk of default”. 

With the requested credit, Natela will purchase chickens and raise them. The other part of the loan will be used for purchasing feed for chickens.  After 4-5 months, she will start the sale of hens. The hens will be sold on the local open market. 

She will reinvest the profit for further expansion of the farm. Also, part of the profit will be used for purchasing necessary household goods, to improve her living conditions, and finance the education of her children. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and chicken feed for starting a poultry farm.

loans.name: Sonrisas Frente Al Mar Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “ Sonrisas frente al mar” está conformado por 20 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de yerbas, almacén, fabricación de papas al vacio, tejidos, venta de empanadas, venta chocolates artesanales, venta de ropa, venta de completos , servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Juan, tesorero del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentado en última fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, su cabello lo usa corto y su tez es de color trigueña.
El se dedica al rubro de pastelería y panadería, desde hace 5 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa, donde habilito un taller, trabaja de lunes a domingo y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad. Realiza alfajores, trufas, queques, kuchen, pie de limón, pan, empanadas, donde vende en su domicilio y otras veces es el quien se desplaza hacia su clientela para la entrega de pastelería y panadería.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en las ciudades de Valparaíso y Villa Alemana en locales donde encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará sacos de harina, bandejas plásticas, coco rayado, azúcar flor, chocolates de cobertura, mermeladas, huevos, mostacilla, manjar.
Una de las metas de Juan es instalar un local establecidos con la documentación al dia, y atender a toda su clientela y seguir recibiendo a mas para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Juan vive junto a su hermano quien también pertenece al Banco Comunal. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener su local para ofrecer su mercadería a su clientela, y a nivel personal tener buena salud para seguir trabajando.
El se encuentra muy contento y agradecido de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le ha servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Sonrisas Frente al Mar” (Smiles Before the Sea) and it has 20 members who carry out a variety of lines of work among which are: herb sales, store, vacuum packed potatoes, knitting, turnover sales, artisanal chocolate sales, clothing sales, hot-dog with salad sales and services, among others.  All are from the city of Valparaíso.

Juan is communal bank treasurer and in the photo he’s seated in the last row, second from left to right.  His hair is short and he has a swarthy complexion.  He’s been a baker and pastry chef for the last five years.   He comments that he works from home where he set up his workshop.  He works Monday to Sunday and he arranges his schedule according to availability.  He makes ‘alfajores’ [filled sesame seed pastries], truffles, cakes, Bundt cakes, lemon pies, bread, and turnovers that he sells at home and sometimes he delivers the pastries and baked goods to his customers.  He buys merchandise and ingredients as needed in Valparaíso and Villa Alemana in stores where he gets the merchandise at low cost which is economically advantageous for him.

He will use the loan to buy sacks of flour, plastic trays, shredded coconut, powdered sugar, glazing chocolate, marmalade, eggs, sugar beads and condensed milk.  One of Juan’s goals is to open a locale with all proper, up-to-date documentation to tend to all his clientele and continue receiving even more to generate higher income that will lead to improved quality of life.

Juan lives with his brother who is also a member of the communal bank.  His dream on a work level is to have his own locale to sell his merchandise in and on a personal level to stay in good health to continue working.

He is very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza is giving him because it will allow him to invest in his business.  He comments that there is very good communication among the communal bank members and on the other hand, the training has been very useful to learn new sales and bookkeeping strategies.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago. It’s the regional capital and also the seat of the country’s legislative branch of government.  It’s the nation’s main port and it has a variety of beautiful, picturesque places, like Nobel Laureate Pablo Neruda’s house, for example.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, plastic trays, shredded coconut, sugar, chocolate, marmalate, eggs, beads and condensed milk.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Fortaleza” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de pan, tejido, comida rápida, venta de ropa, verdulería, venta de frutas, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Gabriela, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en última fila, ocupando el segundo el lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste un poleron de color lila, pantalón buzo de color negro con franjas blancas. Su cabello es de color castaño oscuro  y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de comida rápida desde hace 1 mes. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a sábado, en local establecido cerca de su casa, trabaja sola y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad. Se dedica a vender churrascos, completos y papas fritas.
La mercadería e ingredientes que va utilizando los compra en supermercados, carnicerías, y distribuidoras de papas a bajo costo por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará bebidas, paltas, mayonesa, queso.
Una de las metas de Gabriela, es continuar con el negocio, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Gabriela vive sola. Sus sueños a nivel personal es tener su casa propia y a nivel laboral crecer con su negocio y captar más clientela.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Fortaleza" and is comprised of 18 entrepreneurs who are engaged in different areas, among which there are: selling bread, weaving, fast food, selling clothes, groceries, selling fruit, services, and others. All of them belong to the ciy of Temuco. 

Gabriela is a member of this communal bank group. In the picture, she is standing in the back row, in the second place from left to right. She is wearing a purple sweatshirt and black sweat pants with white stripes. Her hair is dark brown and wears it tied up. 

She is engaged in fast food for one month. She says she works Monday through Saturday in an establishment near her home. She works alone and her schedule is distributed according to her availability. She sells steaks, hot dogs and French fries. She buys merchandise and ingredients she uses in supermarkets, butcher shops, and low cost potatoes distributors, therefore economically convenient. 

With the loan she will buy beverages, avocados, mayonnaise, and cheese. One of Gabriela's goals is to continue with the business to generate more income, and with this achieve a better quality of life. 

Gabriela lives alone. Her dreams on a personal level are to have her own home, and on a work level to grow with her business and attract more customers. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza, because it will allow her to invest in her business. For the group of the communal bank which she is a member, she says it has very good communication. Furthermore, the training has helped her to learn new sales strategies and accounting.     

Temuco is the capital of the region of Araucanía. The city is located 670 km south of Santiago (capital of Chile). In the surroundings, there are a number of lake spas (Pucón, Villarrica) and native flora and fauna very striking, concentrated in nearby natural parks. It's worth to mention that in this region lives 50% of the Mapuche, indigenous people of our country.

loans.use: to buy beverages, avocados, mayonnaise, cheese.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar el cual está integrado por su  compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella se dedica  a la agricultura, principalmente a la siembra de maíz. Esta actividad la realiza  junto a su esposo y es así como logran llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.  Es una mujer increíble ya que se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora, carismática y responsable.  Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que  conoce muy bien la manera de hacer esta actividad. Cada año la realiza, vende una parte de su cosecha y la otra la deja para consumo. Es así como poco a poco va saliendo adelante y dando a su familia el alimento básico. Vive en condiciones muy humildes junto con su familia, esto la hace tomar mas fuerzas para seguir luchando por un futuro diferente. Es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito  para invertir en los insumos agrícolas como semillas para cosechar, abonos, insecticidas y otros.  Además desea comprar una vaca y sacarle provecho a la venta que de leche realice, a buen precio. Es así como  se gana la vida y lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar. Espera que  este año la cosecha sea favorable y logre cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
María lives in her own house with her family, made up of her life partner and her children.  She makes a living in agriculture, mainly growing corn.  She does this job along with her husband and this way they support their household.

She's an incredible woman known for being hardworking, charismatic, and responsible.  She has made a living in agriculture for a long time, so she's very familiar with how to do this job.  She does it every year, selling part of her harvest and leaving the rest for home consumption.  This way she's getting her family ahead little by little and providing them with basic food.  She and her family live in very humble conditions.  This makes her work harder to continue striving for a different future.

This is why she's asking Integral for a loan to buy seeds to plant, fertilizer, insecticide, and other agricultural supplies.  She also wants to buy a cow and benefit from selling the milk at a good price.

This is how she earns a living and supports her household every day.  She hopes that this year's harvest is good and that she manages to realize her dream.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and a cow

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina has been selling gari and yams near Aburasa for 4 years. She is married and is responsible for helping to support her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Her loan will be used to buy gari, yams and other food stuff to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand.

loans.use: to buy gari (cassava), yams, and other food stuffs to sell.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en: Apolonia is a 58-year-old married woman with two adult children. She and her family reside in San Miguel, Bohol. To earn an income she is engaged a transportation business transporting passengers with her multi-cab. She is asking for a loan to buy tires, machine lubricants, bolts and nuts. She hopes that with these needed parts, her business will earn a better income daily through non-stop operation of her multi-cab. Apolonia dreams of having more business someday so she can uplift the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy tires, machine lubricants, bolts and nuts

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a 24-year-old farmer in Litein County in Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for two years, producing tea and milk, which he sells to the people in his local area.

He is requesting a 30,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds, which will help him to improve his standard of living and be able to provide for his family's needs in the future. 

He aspires to have built a dairy unit for his dairy cows in the next five years and also to venture into business when his income increases.

Animal diseases are his major challenge in farming.

He is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Union Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Unión y Esperanza” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran; vendedores ambulantes, feriantes, bazar, almacén, venta de verdura, venta de pan, venta de articulos para el hogar, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca.
Marjorie, integrante del grupo de Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en la última fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, su cabello lo usa suelto y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de vendedor ambulante desde hace 10 años. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a sábado, a veces trabaja en las ferias y otras veces en colegios y jardines ofreciendo su mercadería a grandes y chicos.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la ciudad de Santiago donde encuentra articulos al por mayor y gran variedad de productos a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará articulos de bazar como aros, anillo, cintillos y además ropa como calzas, ropa interior.
Una de las metas de Marjorie es colocar un bazar en su casa, para atender a su clientela más tranquila y mostrar toda su mercadería, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Marjorie vive junto a su marido y sus cuatro hijos de 12, 10, 5, y 3 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal y laboral sacar su bazar y a nivel familiar que sus hijos tengan un buen pasar y un buen futuro para los estudios para que obtengan una buena profesión.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
The Unión y Esperanza community bank is made up of 17 entrepreneurs who work in different areas including: street vendor, sales at a market stall, sales at a bazaar, department store, vegetable sales, bread sales, household goods sales, services, and others.  They all live in the city of Talca.  

Marjorie is a member of the group.  In the photo, she is standing in the back row in the first spot from right to left.  Her dark brown hair is worn down.  She has worked as a street vendor for ten years.  She works from Monday to Saturday and sometimes works during festivals and other times at high schools and gardens offering her merchandise to adults and children.  She purchases her merchandise in the city of Santiago where there she can purchase items at wholesale and find a large variety of products at low cost, which is convenient economically.  She will use the loan to purchase bazaar items such as earrings, rings, headbands, and clothing such as hosiery and underwear.  One of Marjorie's goals is to have a bazaar in her home so that she can attend to her customers more calmly and show all of her merchandise and generate more income so that she can have a better quality of life.

Marjorie lives with her husband and their four children who are 3, 5, 10, and 12 years old.  Her dream for her business is to have her bazaar, and her dreams for her family are that her children do well and have a good future so that they can get a good job after their studies.  She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has provided since it has allowed her to invest in her business.  She feels very comfortable with the company of the other entrepreneurs in her community bank since they share different activities and interests which have served as a moment of distraction.  She has learned how to administer her business better in the trainings provided at meetings.  

Talca is part of the Maule region, which is located in the central part of the country.  It is the administrative, economic, and culture center of the region and the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley.  In Chile there is a curious reference to Talca in the phrase "Talca, Paris, and London". Some say this is a derivation of the original phrase spoken by an Englishman, "Talca seems like London" because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city in the winter, similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to purchase articles to sell such as earrings, rings, headbands, and clothing such as hosiery and underwear.

loans.name: Faleh

texts.en:
Faleh is a 33-year-old married man, the father of three children. He has worked in agriculture since 2000. He specializes in irrigating and plowing lands, since he owns a tractor for this business. Faleh deals with everything that has to do with agriculture. He specializes in the agricultural business, and he has to always be ready for any sudden request.

Faleh is very happy with his children's education, and hopes to keep on providing them with the best education. Therefore, he has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to pay their tuition fees. 

This is Faleh's first cycle as a Al Majmoua borrower, and he is very optimistic about it. 
 
He is also working hard on expanding and improving his business by buying more equipment in the future.

loans.use: to pay his children's tuition fees.

loans.name: Tsengel

texts.en: Mrs.Tsengel is a 55-year-old widow who lives with her two daughters and her nephew in a Ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her two daughters work in a private company. Her older daughter is widow. Her nephew goes to secondary school. She started her pelt trading business in 2006. She buys pelts from herders and supply them to factories for a higher price. She moved to the capital city for sometime with her daughters and temporarily stopped her business. She has now moved back to Uvurhangai and is planning to restart her business again. She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy raw pelts from herders and supply to factories as she used to. She is modest, hard-working, and tough woman. She says "Everyone in my family doing something in order to increase family income to improve our lives."

loans.use: To buy raw pelts from herders and supply to factories

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Ahanit is still running her business. Thanks to her trading income, Anahit helps her husband to keep their family and has paid for her son’s education. She shares that her son has already graduated from the Institute and now he is serving in the Armenian Army. 
Anahit spent her previous Kiva loan on a winter assortment of clothes and boots for her business. Now she is asking for a $2,000 loan to buy a large lot of sweaters, jeans, coats, winter shoes and also children’s clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of sweaters, jeans, coats, winter shoes and also children’s clothes to resell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica operates a grocery shop at Eguafo near Elmina. This she has done for 21 years now. 

The items in her grocery shop are milk, Milo (malted milk), sugar, soups, different kinds of soft drinks, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, etc.  

Monica is married with three children. She uses her income to support the husband to pay the utility bills. 

She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Monica plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Betrice

texts.en:
Betrice is a married lady, aged 40.  She is blessed with four children that she supports, as well as her aged parents. She operates a boutique shop in the Lower Melili area. She has been running the business for 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES. 45,000.

She has requested a seventh loan of KES. 100,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to purchase more cultural clothing for the diversification of her business. 

The anticipated profit will be used to pay the school fees for her school-going children. 

Her dreams is to improve her living standards, and own her residential plot.

loans.use: to buy cultural clothing for resale

loans.name: Suyapa Esperanza

texts.es:
Doña Suyapa tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos con los cuales vive en una aldea de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Doña Suyapa se dedica desde hace 4 años a atender su negocio de pulperia,  ofrece productos de la canasta básica como pan, azúcar, arroz, manteca, salsina, etc.  Dice que este negocio le ha resultado bastante bien ya que allí provee para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Ella ha solicitado su quinto préstamo de 10,000 lempiras para surtir su negocio comprando productos como carnes, café de bolsa, jabón, y toda clase de golosinas.
Doña Suyapa piensa que al surtir más su negocio sus ventas aumentaran y por lo tanto sus ingresos mejoraran favorablemente.
texts.en:
Doña Suyapa is 42 years old, married, and has five children. They live in a neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Doña Suyapa has been managing a convenience store for four years. She offers basic household products such as bread, sugar, rice, lard, sauces, and other items. Suyapa says that her business has achieved good results and has enabled her to help her husband with the household expenses.

She is requesting her fifth loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that she can restock her business by purchasing products such as meat, bags of coffee, soap, and all types of candies. Doña Suyapa believes that restocking her business with more inventory will increase her sales, thus resulting in a favorable improvement in her income.

loans.use: to buy meat, bags of coffee, soap, and all types of candies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantuya, 38 years old, lives with her family. She has three daugthers ages 14, 11 and 9, who are studying in a secondary school. They live in their own wooden house in Kherlen, the largest city of eastern Mongolia. 

Altantuya is a cleaner in the hotel. Her husband is an invalid, but he is running a taxi business to increase the family income.  They built their house by themselves. This old house is in incredibly bad condition, especially the roof part.  When it is raining outside, rain water enters the house through the roof. For that reason, Altantuya is asking for a 1.000.000 MNT loan. By doing this, her family will be able to live in a comfortable condition.

loans.use: to fix the roof of her house.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna, 28 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Tagodalo, Bayabas, Aurora.  She has one child, and is earning income from her transport service business. It was started almost two years ago now, and she earns PHP 4,000 a month. 

To improve business, she is borrowing the amount of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC micro credit, which she just joined in 2011, to obtain accessories and tires.   Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es: La Sra. Fidelia  tiene 42 años y es casada con 2 hijos que se encuentran ene edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos como  dulces, galletas y refrescos en su puesto de venta que se encuentran ubicada en la zona de Alto Lima,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Fidelia va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería por mayor como dulces y chocolate para surtir su puesto de  venta,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su  capital de trabajo, la Sra. Fidelia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia.
texts.en: Fidelia is 42 years old, married, and has two school aged children.  She works selling products such as candy, cookies, and drinks at her sales post in the area of Alto Lima.  This loan is her first with the institution.  She plans to use the loan to purchase merchandise at wholesale prices such as candy and chocolate to stock her business.  She requested this loan so that she could increase her working capital.  Fidelia encounters challenges in her business as she tries to leave poverty, and she will use the benefits to continue purchasing merchandise and increase her income so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase candy at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Maria Modesta

texts.es:
Maria Modesta tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y vive en una aldea rural del Municipio de Lepaera, Departamento de Lempira.
Ella tiene 5 años de haber establecido su negocio de pulperia donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como maíz, Frijoles, arroz, manteca, golosinas etc. Ella se levanta desde muy temprano para atenderlo. 
Esta solicitando un tercer préstamo de 15,000 lempiras, el cual piensa invertir en compra de productos como maíz, arroz, Frijoles, refrescos, golosinas etc. Con esta inversión tendrá más que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Su meta es seguir mejorando obteniendo mas ayuda con los préstamos para que su negocio pueda estar estable.
texts.en:
Maria Modesta is 30 years old, married, and has a son. She lives in a rural village in Lepaera municipality, in Lempira department. Five years ago she established her small grocery store business, where she sells basic household necessities such as corn, beans, rice, lard, candy, etc. 

She gets up very early to run it. She's applying for a third loan of 15,000 lempiras, which she intends to use to buy products such as corn, rice, beans, soft drinks, candy, etc. 

With this investment she will have more to offer her customers. Her goal is to continue improving by obtaining more loan assistance, so that her business can be stable.

loans.use: To buy products such as corn, rice, beans, soft drinks, candy, etc. for stocking her store.

loans.name: Taifa

texts.en:
Taifa is a married woman living in the town of Samburu. She has two children, one in primary school and the other in college.
She has professional training in early childhood education and she has several years of teaching experience. Three years ago, she decided to open her preparatory school to serve her area.
This loan she is applying for will be used to purchase stationery and benches for the little children to have a comfortable learning environment.

loans.use: to purchase stationery and benches

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is a petty trader who sells tomatoes, peppers, onions, salt, cassava, plantains and other items. Akosua has been in this business for five years now. She is married to a farmer and has three children. She uses her income to help pay her children’s school fees. Akosua needs this loan to purchase more tomatoes, peppers, onions, salt, cassava, plantains and other food items. With the new profit, Akosua will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more tomatoes, peppers, onions, salt, cassava, plantains and other food items for sale.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Arlene works hard to support her family.  She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Arlene is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts to maintain her motorcycle for her transport business.  Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to maintain her motorcycle.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta cooks banku for sale.  She serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce in Eguafo, near Elmina. She is  a widow and has three children.  Benedicta has been in this business for 20 years now.   As a single parent, she uses her income for the gerneral upkeep of her family. Her loan will be used to purchase fish and bags of maize, which she uses in preparing her banku, for her business. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to create a better stall for the sale of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: to purchase fish and  bags of maize, which she uses in preparing her banku, for her business.

loans.name: Willma Nelly

texts.es: La Sra.  Wilma tiene 52 años casada con tres  hijos mayores de 25 años, ya independientes, La Sra. Wilma se dedica  a la   fabricación de variedad de Calzados, tiene su taller en la zona de Obispo Bosque de la  ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia  dentro de la institución, la Sra. Wilma  va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de materiales como cuero por mayor  para la fabricación de sus calzados  y así de esta manera ofrecer variedad de calzados a su clientela, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Wilma va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de material, la Sra. Wilma es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
Wilma is 52 years old, married, and has three children over 25 years old, who are already independent. Wilma makes a variety of shoes and has a workshop in the Obispo Bosque area of the city of La Paz.

This is her first loan with the institution, and Wilma is going to use this loan to buy materials such as leather at wholesale, so that she can make her shoes and this way offer a variety of footwear to her clientele.

Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. Wilma is going to use the profits to continue buying a variety of material. Wilma is a very hard-working person, and feels happy for the opportunity offered to her and to her fellow group members, as in some cases they are the sole support of their families.

loans.use: To buy materials such as leather, for making shoes.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en: Afua produces and sells kenkey, an African dish made out of maize.  Afua has been in this business for some time now. Afua is a widow who lives with her three children in Eguafo near Elmina. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children. Afua will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for the production of kenkey. With the new profit, Afua  plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of  maize for the production of kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a fish monger in Eguafo near Elmina. She also sells fried fish and kenkey, an African dish made from maize. Ama has been in this business for five years now. She is married to a farmer and has six dependents. Ama uses her income to help her husband pay their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for the preparation of her kenkey and to buy fish to fry and sell. With the new profit Ama wish to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for making kenkey and to buy fish to fry and sell.

loans.name: Delgermaa

texts.en: Mrs. Delgermaa is 45 years old and lives with her son in a rental apartment in Dornogobi province, Mongolia. Her son is a college student. She used to work in a felt manufacturing company as a felt manufacturer and now she is starting her own business of producing felt souvenirs and felt shoes, mainly handmade. She needs inventory and a machine to handle the sewing process. She needs 500,000 MNT to purchase inventory and a second-hand sewing machine for her business. She is a modest and hardworking woman.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and a second-hand sewing machine for her new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina produces and sells kenkey, an African dish made from maize. Georgina covers the dough with banana leaves as a form of packaging. She is married to a farmer and has seven dependents. She uses her income to help her husband with the general upkeep of the family. Georgina needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production. With the new profit, Georgina will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production.

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Cerelina is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been running a sari-sari or convenience store for more than 23 years now. She sells various goods to the people in the community.

Cerelina is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as noodles, canned goods, candies, snack foods and others. 

In the future, Cerelina wants to expand her venture and augment her income necessary for their needs and expenses.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as noodles, canned goods, candies, snack foods and others

loans.name: Juana Marta

texts.es: Juana Marta de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, la tierra de cultivo tiene un alto potencial agrícola y un suelo muy fértil además esta cercano a su vivienda, todo lo producido lo comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el servicio excelente; Juana es una mujer amable, emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, todos los días se esfuerza al máximo porque sabe que asi alcanzara cada una de las metas que se proponga, en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse, necesita invertir por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Juana Marta tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Juana Marta is 55 years old and lives with her life partner and their children in their own home. She is engaged to cultivate corn and beans. She has worked in agriculture for several years, and that has given her a lot of experience. That allows her to obtain the best crops. The farmland has high agricultural potential and the soil is very fertile, as well as close to her home. 

She sells everything she produces in the surrounding area of the community, because she has a lot of customers who prefer her for the quality, good prices and above all, for the excellent service. Juana is a kind woman, entrepreneur, dedicated to her work, and eager to succeed. Every day she tries her best because she knows that's the way to reach each of the goals set. 

In the last planting season, she had some losses and she wants to recover, so she needs to invest on it. That's why she is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL so she can buy corn seeds, beans, insecticide, herbicide, etc. 

Juana Marta has good payment references from those who know her. She is very responsible and assures she can pay off the debt within the established periods. At the same time, she is confident to achieve economic security for her household.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, beans, insecticide, and herbicide.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn, 29, is married and a mother of three young children.  She is from Talibon, Bohol. 

Genalyn has engaged in the rice farming business for more than five years now.   She is also in the hog raising business to add to her income.  Genalyn works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially the schooling of her children.   It is her goal to send them to school and to provide a healthy home for her family. 

Genalyn wants to obtain a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers, piglets and feed.  In the future, Genalyn wants to make her business successful.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers, piglets and feed.

loans.name: Santa Eleuteria

texts.es:
Santa vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, es una ciudad en la cual se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de uva, esparrago, entre otros. Santa es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde joven aprendió lo que es ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente ya que sus padres eran muy humildes. Santa se esfuerza mucho cada día, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de comida el cual logro tener con mucho ahorro y sobre todo esfuerzo, cada día Santa le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muy buen sazón.

Santa esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un pequeño toldo para su negocio y así poder brindar comodidad a sus clientes ya que podrá cubrirlos del sol, de está manera sus ingresos mejoraran y podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener un gran restaurante”.
texts.en:
Santa lives in the city of Ica, which is characterized by having a very warm and welcoming climate. It is a city where farming is practiced, especially grape and asparagus cultivation, among others. Santa is a very hardworking woman. From the time she was young she learned to earn her living by the sweat of her brow, since her parents were very humble. Santa works hard every day. She has a small food stall, which she was able to get with a lot of saving and above all effort. Every day Santa devotes about 9 hours to her business and may wait on up to 10 customers per day. She believes that she is doing well in her business because she is very friendly to the customers and above all because her seasoning is very good.

Santa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have given her, she will be able to buy a small awning for her business and thus provide comfort to her customers, since it will cover them from the sun. In this way her earnings will improve and she will be able to continue fighting in order to make her biggest dream a reality: to have a great restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase an awning

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Phuong was born in 1981. She has three children, who are learning at kindergarten and primary school. Her husband is a farmer, and he earns 3,000,000 VND from his job. Phuong cooks food in the market for a living. She earns 3,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. She began participating in SEDA's credit program in 2012. In this first loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy dishes, tables and chairs for her food stall. Her dream is to support her children's going to school until higher education.
	
Other members of Phuong's group include the following.
 
Thoa is 49 years old. She has two children. She sells noodles to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to cook food and sell it in the market. 
 
Hai is 30 years old. She has two children. She raises pigs to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise pigs for selling.
 
Huong is 25 years old. She has a child. She raises pigs and chickens for a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise more chickens for selling.
 
Thuy is 20 years old. She has a child. She has a grocery store to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise pigs for selling.

Dien is 53 years old. She has two children. She raises pigs to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise more pigs for selling.

loans.use: to buy dishes, tables and chairs for her food stall.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai was born in 1976. She has two daughters and one son. The son is studying at secondary school and the two girls are at primary school and kindergarten. Her husband makes aluminum frames for a living. Mai has a grocery store to earn a living. She has done her job for 8 years. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 14,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2006. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to sell noodles, candies and biscuits in her grocery store. She always wants to let all her children go to school till higher education and to enlarge her store.

loans.use: to sell noodles, candies and biscuits in her grocery store.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 29 years old, a single gentleman who supports his siblings. He has been running a retail shop for the last five years, getting a monthly income of KES 25,000. 


He has applied for  a business loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to restock his shop with a variety of products, e.g., tea leaves, more bread, and cooking fat of different sizes for sale.


The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into the business for expansion. His future dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tea leaves, more bread, and cooking fat of different sizes for sale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a peddler. She sells second-hand clothes at Eguafo, which is near Elmina. She has been doing this for eight years. She is married to a farmer and has 2 children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying the utility bills. Monica needs this loan to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Monia will acquire a shop for the selling of her second-hand clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
When Richard first used a Fresh Life toilet, he realized it was something revolutionary; it was far cleaner than other toilet options in the Mukuru informal settlement of Nairobi.  He realized that if he bought one, its cleanliness could reduce the transmission of diseases such as cholera for his family and his neighbors. Furthermore, Richard wants to operate a Fresh Life toilet as a business because it is affordable and it occupies a small space. 

Originally from the western part of Kenya, Richard moved with his family to Nairobi in 2008 because a drought devastated his maize and millet farms. Now Richard and his wife, Grace, run a small shop that sells fresh produce and hot lunch to support their children--ages 9 and 5--through school.  

Richard’s hope is that with this business, he will be able to provide a good life for his children. He dreams of starting other businesses with the profits from his Fresh Life toilet, and one day buying a plot of land to run as a landlord.

loans.use: To purchase and run a Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua operates a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold). she has done this for 2 years. The food she serves is typical Ghanaian fare--ga-kenkey, fufu, banku and rice balls.  Ekua is preparing the Ga–kenkey int the photo. She is married with 5 children. Ekua uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale. With the new profit, Ekua plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and other ingredients to use to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline describes herself as a "teacher by talent, not by training." She single-handedly started the Jaombi Foundation School four years ago to give back to her community. As a young orphan, Jackline received a sponsorship for her education, a life-changing event she cites often as the source of her ambition. Wanting other orphaned and single-parent children to have access to an education just like she did, Jackline rented a small room and began to take on students. Today, the Jaombi Foundation employs seven teachers and has 155 students from ages 5 to 14.

In addition to being a teacher and school principal, Jackline is an advocate for the environment. She wants a Fresh Life toilet close by her school so the area will be cleaner and her students will live healthier lives.

Jackline hopes to expand the school to cater to more students, offer technical training beyond the secondary level, and offer a lunch program, since many of her students come to school hungry. Ultimately, Jackline would like to return to college to finally be "officially" trained as an educator - but Sanergy suspects she'll be the one teaching the course.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 34 years old and the mother of two children. She resides in the rural section of the town of Samburu.

She has been planting and producing cereals like corn, beans, peas, etc for three years. At the moment, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 KES to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and the payment of labor for clearing her farmland and cultivation. She believes the loan will help her increase production and take full advantage of all she produces.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay labor for clearing her farmland and cultivation.

loans.name: Rita Araba

texts.en: Rita Araba cooks kenkey to sell. She is married to a farmer and has 10 dependents. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of the family. Rita needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production. With the new profit, Rita will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline a very busy woman. She is a Community Health Worker, tending to those with illnesses of all kinds in the Mukuru informal settlement of Nairobi. She is the chairwoman of Community Conversation, an organization that brings together community members to discuss problems they face and formulate ways to solve them. And on top of that, she is the mother of six children, ages ranging from 5 to 18.

When Jackline first found out about Fresh Life toilets, she thought they were a great business opportunity and understood their health benefits, but did not have enough capital to purchase one of her own. However, in March of this year, Jackline joined a loans and savings group with 20 of her friends. She explained to the group three advantages of a Fresh Life toilet: it is clean, it is a profitable business opportunity, and it will improve sanitation in the community. With Jackline’s leadership, the group has decided to make their first investment the operation of a Fresh Life toilet. 

Jackline’s group dreams of being able to purchase a Fresh Life toilet for every part of their neighborhood and eventually making enough profit so that the members can buy plots of land of their own. Personally, Jackline would like to be able to pay for all of her children’s educations and one day retire to the countryside as an old woman.

loans.use: To purchase and run a Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Magaly Esther

texts.es: Magaly con su anterior credikiva compró mercancía variada, como ropa, calzado y productos de tocados, con lo cual aumentó sus utilidades y el número de sus clientes. ahora planea acceder a un nuevo financiamiento con Kiva, para invertir en ropa exclusivamente, pues es el producto que mas vende durante el último trimestre del año. Su inversión proyecta tener un gran éxito, porque comprará productos adaptados a la temporada, que presentan mucha calidad y tiene una muy buena relación con su clientela, lo que garantiza una pronta recuperación de su cartera de cuentas. “gracias y que sigan teniendo en cuenta a las mujeres cabezas de hogar para alcanzar los objetivos.“
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan Magaly bought a variety of merchandise such as clothing, footwear, and hair accessories, with which she increased her profits and her clientele.  Now she plans to get another Kiva loan to invest exclusively in clothing, the product she sells most in the last trimester of the year.

Her investment is projected to be very successful because she'll buy high-quality seasonal products and she has a very good relationship with her customers, guaranteeing a quick recouping of her accounts receivable.

"Thank you, and continue keeping in mind the women heads of household so they can realize their goals."

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi cooks Ga-kenkey, a traditional Ghanaian dish, for sale at Eguafo near Elmina. She has done this for 4 years now. Esi is married with 4 children. She uses her income to help her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Esi will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and fish to prepare her kenkey  for sale.  With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish to prepare her kenkey for sale

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: People are always looking for a way to overcome their struggles and this client is a good example of this. Martha has great abilities like honesty, an entrepreneurial nature, and a hardworking mentality. She lives with her family, which is the main source of her inspiration. For some time she has had a small grocery store in her home. Thanks to her customer service many clients are loyal. She also sells cereals. She hopes to buy more supplies like foodstuffs, fruits and vegetables. This is why she applied for a loan from Yehu. She is thankful for the support that is being offered.

loans.use: to buy more supplies like foodstuffs, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a peddler. She has been selling second hand clothing at Eguafo, near Elmina. for 8 years. She is married to a farmer and has 5 children. She uses her income to help her husband to pay the utility bills. Efua needs this loan to purchase more second hand clothes for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Efua will acquire a shop for the sale of her secondhand clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es: Rosalba de 63 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad y se dedica ala venta de mercancía y productos que promociona mediante guías especializadas o catálogos, pues está vinculada a una empresa que se los provee. En su negocio vende cremas, productos capilares, perfumería, vestuario y calzado, desde hace 12 años cuando inició su negocio en el año 2000, decidida a  generar ingresos para apoyar el sostenimiento de su familia. Sus ventas las realiza de contado diariamente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche y sus clientes son vecinos y referidos, que trabajan en diversas empresas como empleados. Rosalba ha realizado 5 financiamientos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; su credikiva es el sexto y con el planea comprar, ropa exterior e interior, calzado y productos de belleza, que llegaron en sus catálogos con preciso especiales y necesita  impactar a su clientela con una buena oferta. Con sus financiamientos anteriores ha logrado, aumentar su capital de trabajo, y a cobertura de su clientela hoy su inversión será exitosa porque cumplirá a su clientela con los pedidos que le han hecho y con ello su capital rotará mucho más obteniendo nuevas ganancias.
texts.en: 63-year-old Rosalba lives in the southern area of her town. She sells merchandise and products through directories and catalogs, because she works with a company that provides them. In her business she has been selling lotions, haircare products, perfumes, garments and shoes for the past 12 years. She started her business in the year 2000, because she decided to get an income in order to help support her family. She sells for cash and on a daily basis, from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. Her customers are friends and neighbors who work as employees of various companies. Rosalba has had five loans with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; this is her sixth loan, and she plans to use it to purchase garments and undergarments, shoes and beauty products. These products have appeared in her catalogs at special prices, and she needs to make an impact on her customers with good offers. With her previous loans she has succeeded in increasing her working capital and expanding her clientele. Her current investment will be successful because she'll meet all the orders her customers have made. With that, she'll get her capital to rotate much more and she'll increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase garments, undergarments, shoes and beauty products.

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua is a 39-year-old widow who lives with her three children in her own house. She makes a living cultivating corn, tomatoes, kale, and beans. She has been working in agriculture for a number of years, which has given her valuable experience and allows her to grow the best crops. The land she cultivates is located in an area with a lot of agricultural activity and is close to where she lives. Everything she produces she sells in various parts of the community, and she already has a lot of clients who prefer her produce because of the quality, good prices, and above all, the excellent service.

Nadzua is a very enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work. She works hard every day in hopes of a more prosperous future, and she knows that only with love and perseverance can she achieve the success she desires.

In the previous planting season, she suffered several losses that she wishes to recoup. For this reason, she is asking Yehu for a loan that will allow her to buy corn seeds, beans, insecticide, and herbicide. It will also help her pay for cultivation costs. She wants to take advantage of the optimal planting time, now that the winter season has already begun.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, beans, insecticide, and herbicide, and to pay for cultivation costs.

loans.name: Esmeralda Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Esmeralda de 48 años de edad se desempeña como comerciante en venta de cosméticos por catalogo, trabaja desde los 19 años, es viuda madre de 5 hijos con los que ha salido adelante sola y con muchos deseos de superación está estudiando la carrera de licenciatura en derecho por el cual ha pasado varios obstáculos como el tener que ir con sus hijos a recibir clases porque no tenía quien se los cuide, pero gracias a Dios ya está en la última etapa de su carrera por el cual solicita el apoyo de crédito para poder pagar su curso de titulación, ya que con sus ingresos le es muy difícil cubrir ese gasto de una sola vez, con este logro espera ayudar a personas que necesitan de asesoramiento legal que por la falta de recursos económicos no se pueden defender.
texts.en: Esmeralda is 48 years old. She's a retailer who sells cosmetics by order from catalogs. She's been in the workforce ever since she was 19 years old. She's a widow and has five children, whom she has gotten ahead all by herself. With a lot of drive to succeed, she's been studying for a career in law. For that she has faced many obstacles, such as having to take her children to class with her because she didn't have anyone to watch them. Thankfully, she's in the final stages of her career. That's why she requests the help of a loan so she can pay for fees that are needed to validate her diploma. With her income it's very difficult for her to afford this expense in a single installment. With this achievement she hopes to help people who need legal counseling but can't defend themselves due to the lack of financial resources.

loans.use: to pay for fees in order to validate her diploma.

loans.name: Batzorig

texts.en:
Batzorig is 25 years old and lives with his wife and a three year-old child in his parent’s house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His parent’s house locates in a boundary area of the city with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity. Batzorig has been renting a cell phone repair counter and sells phone spare parts in the downtown area of the city for 7 years. Every six months, he goes to China’s nearest border to buy phone spare parts. 

His wife is a student, but this year she is not studying because she is pregnant and will give birth in November. As he and his wife are expecting a baby, Batzorig has been building a new house on the land of his parents for his family and the house is 80% complete. The loan Batzorig is taking will be used to buy radiators and insulate the roof, floor, and walls with energy saving materials in order to stop the heat loss. If his new house will be warmer, less energy will be burnt. By doing this he and his family will improve their living condition and can cut the usage of coal to warm his house.

loans.use: To buy radiators and insulate the roof, floor, and walls with energy saving materials

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells maize at Eguafo near Elmina. She is married to a farmer and has 5 dependents.  She uses her income  to  support her husband in feeding, clothing and paying for her  children’s school fees. Esi needs this loan to purchase bages of maize to resell. With the new profit,  Esi  wishes to aquire larger quantities of maize to distribut to other retailers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame has operated a grocery shop at Eguafo, near Elmina, for 2 years. The items in her grocery shop are milk, milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft  drinks, tin tomatoes, tin fish, cookies, toffees, powdered milk, etc. She is married with 2 children. Maame uses her income to help her husband pay the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell. With the new profit, Maame plans to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a resident of Maribojoc, Bohol, Philippines and has been engaged in a food vending business for several years now. This is the source of her income. 
Flora is asking for a loan worth 3,000 PHP to buy additional ingredients for her cooking business such as flour, sugar, milk, etc. She believes that through this loan she could cook more snack foods to sell to the people in her community.
Flora dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her cooking business such as flour, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 32 years old and has a son. She has worked for over 3 years; she began by doing household chores and then later learned to manage the business of her brothers' store. She is single and she needs to work extra hard to support her son's education.She currently has a small kiosk in her home.

She will use the loan to buy lotions, medicines, drinks, soap, and basic food and home-furnishing items for the kiosk. 

She hopes her income will improve so that her son will not lack food, housing, and health. Her goal is to constantly improve her business in order to receive a better income.

loans.use: to buy lotions, medicines, drinks, soap, basic food, and home-furnishing items

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children; she is from Talibon, Bohol. She has run a sari-sari (convenience) store business for several years. She is also in the seaweed farming business. Seaweed farming is a lucrative venture in the country.

Guillerma is asking for a loan to buy more stock of products to sell in her store, such as soda, biscuits, snack food, and others. She will also purchase materials for seaweed farming, such as straw and nylon.

In the future, Guillerma wants to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock of products to sell in her store, such as soda, biscuits, and snack food, and to purchase materials for seaweed farming.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
El Sr. Jose tiene 43 años de edad, vive en una aldea del municipio de taulabe junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos. Santos siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura a la producción de granos básicos. Tiene 15 años de tener su finca de café y también produce caña de azúcar. La producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. 
El ha mantenido su finca mediante varios ciclos de préstamos, el que solicita actualmente es el decimo préstamo y es por 9,000 lempiras, el cual lo utilizara para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos, pago de mano de obra para mantenimiento y siembra de vivero de café. La decisión de seguir trabajando con préstamos es para mejorar el cultivo y tener mejores cosechas. Su plan es generar mayores ingresos para mejorar su nivel de vida familiar
texts.en:
José, 43, lives in a village in the municipality of Taulabe with his wife and two children.  Santos has always worked in agriculture growing basic grains.  He’s had his coffee farm for 15 years and he also produces sugarcane.  He sells his production in the local market.

He’s maintained his farm through several loan cycles and the one he’s requesting now is his 10th.  It’s for 9,000 Lempiras that he’ll use to buy fertilizer and manure and to pay labor costs for crop maintenance and to plant seedlings in the coffee nursery.  The decision to continue working with loans is in order to improve the crops and have better harvests.  His plan is to generate higher income to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay labor costs for coffee crop maintenance.

loans.name: Marvin Johel

texts.es:
Marvin, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y vive en una aldea de Taulabe. Anteriormente estudiaba y realizaba trabajos de jornalero.
Hace 5 años que Marvin cultivo su propia finca de café. La zona donde vive es apta para este cultivo, y la producción la vende en el mercado local. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 22,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y abonos y pago de mano de obra para siembra de dos manzanas de café. Dándole una buena asistencia al terreno va lograr mejores cosechas. Su meta es seguir con los préstamos para mejorar los cultivos y tener una mejor vida.
texts.en: Marvin, 24, is single living in a village in Taulabe.  He used to attend school and work as a day laborer.  Five years ago Marvin started with his own coffee farm.  The zone he lives in is apt for this crop and he sells his production in the local market.
