The loan he’s requested is for 22,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizer and manure and to pay labor costs to plant two manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of coffee.  By providing good maintenance to the field he’ll attain better crop yields.  His goal is to continue with loans to improve his crops and to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure and to pay labor costs for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Turgunbubu

texts.ru: Тургунбубу состоит в группе "Жакшылык" и является её лидером. Тургунбубу 44 года, муж Тургунбубу скоропостижно скончался  2008 году. Тургунбубу воспитала 4 детей.  Сейчас Тургунбубу заботится о двоих детей школьного возраста. Старший сын женат  и работает в России. Заёмщик имеет среднее образование. После окончаний школы вышла замуж. После распада колхоза, получив свой участок земли она начала заниматься полеводством. В данный момент семья продолжает заниматься полеводством и животноводством, они обрабатывает 1,85 га земли. Дополнительным источником дохода Тургунбубу является реализация молока с дома.  По характеру Тургунбубу очень активный и трудолюбивый человек. После смерти мужа оставшись один на один  со всеми проблемами,  Тургунбубу благодаря её целеустремленности и спокойствию смогла все пережить.  Тургунбубу обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для приобретения скота. В будущем Тургунбубу собирается увеличить поголовье скота и улучшить условия жизни. Её цель в жизни, это вырастить  и воспитать детей и внуков. Дать детям хорошее образование в школе и в дальнейшем иметь возможность обучить их в университете.
texts.en: Turgungbubu is a member of the “Zakshylyk” group and is the group’s leader. Turgungubu is 44 years old; her husband died prematurely in 2008. Turgungubu has brought up four children. Now she has two school-age children in her care. Her eldest son is married and works in Russia. Turgungbubu has received secondary education. After finishing high school, she got married.  When the collective farm system was dissolved and she received a land plot, she started growing produce. At present the family continues to grow produce and raise livestock; they work 1,85 ha [about 4,5 acres] of land. Turgunbubu is a very active and hard-working person by nature. Having to face many challenges on her own after her husband’s death, Turgunbubu  persevered thanks to remaining goal-oriented and calm. Turgunbubu has turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS intended to buy livestock. In the future, Turgunbubu plans to expand her livestock and improve her family’s live conditions. Her goal in life is to raise children and grandchildren, making sure her children receive a good secondary education and later on have an opportunity for university studies.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow so as to increase milk sales, and some sheep for breeding and resale.

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru: Чолпон 40 лет, замужем. Мать 4-х детей. Муж и её брат помогают Чолпон в ведении бизнеса. Сейчас Чолпон занимается торговлей фруктами на местном рынке. Свой бизнес она начала с 10,000 сом в 2006 году. Ежемесячный доход Чолпон составляет около 15,000- 20,000 сом. По характеру человек очень честный и целеустремленный. Все что она добилась, она добилась благодаря её трудолюбию. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на закуп фруктов в связи с осенним спадом цен на фрукты с целью последующей реализации. На вырученные средства Чолпон собирается улучшить свои жилищные условия. В своих планах она рассказала, что хотела бы увеличить товарооборот и в будущем купить себе дом городе Токмок.
texts.en:
Cholpon is 40 years old and married. She is the mother of four children. Her husband and her brother help her in managing her business. 

Currently Cholpon is engaged in trade of fruit at the local market. She started her business in 2006 with 10,000 som (KGS). Cholpon's monthly income is around 15,000 - 20,000 som (KGS). She is a person of very honest and purposeful character. Everything she has achieved has been due to her hard work. 

With an aim to further expand her business, Cholpon turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of fruit for reselling, seeing the fruit prices are lower in the fall. With the proceeds, Cholpon is going to improve her living conditions. She told us that she would like to increase her turnover and in the future purchase a house in the city of Tokmok.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for reselling and thereby increase turnover

loans.name: Murtazo

texts.ru:
Муртазо житель Пянджского района. Он 28 - летний женатый мужчина. Муртазо является отцом четверых детей. 
Муртазо берет кредит для закупа несколько голов крупного рогатого скота. Он хочет заняться свои бизнесом. Муртазо построил коровник и создал условия для разведения скот и начало своей деятельности (животноводство).
texts.en:
Murtazo is a resident of the Pyandj region. He is 28 years old and has been a married man for a year. Murtazo is the father of four children. 

Murtazo takes a loan for the purchase of some heads of cattle. He wants do business. Murtazo built a barn and created conditions for breeding cattle and starting his own business (cattle breeding).

loans.use: to purchase some bulls and one cow

loans.name: Sojidamo

texts.ru: Сожидамо проживает в Пянджском районе. Ей 30 лет. Она вдова. Сожидамо живет с родителями. Она на протяжении четырех лет занимается животноводством. Сожидамо зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Она берет кредит для закупа двух телят.
texts.en:
Sojidamo lives in the Pyandj region. She is 30 years old, and a widow. Sojidamo lives with her parents. She has been engaged in livestock breeding for four years. 

Sojidamo earns money by breeding cattle. She takes a loan for the purchase of two calves.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Makhfiratkhon

texts.ru:
Махфиратхон три года как занимается растениеводством. У нее при доме имеется небольшой земельный участок, где она в основном выращивает овощи. Часть полученного урожая Махфиратхон оставляет своей семье, а оставшуюся часть продает оптом. 
Махфиратхон замужем. Ей 31 год. Детей у нее нет. Махфиратхон берет кредит для закупа семян, топлива и минеральных удобрений. Она намерена посеять и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Makhfiratkhon has been engaged in crop production for three years. She has a small piece of land in front of her house, where she mainly grows vegetables. Makhfiratkhon leaves part of the harvest for her family, and the rest she sells in bulk. 

Makhfiratkhon is married. She is 31 years old and has no children. Makhfiratkhon takes a loan for the purchase of seeds, fuel and fertilizers. She intends to spread it in order to get a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fuel and fertilizer

loans.name: El Eden Group

texts.es:
Este  grupo se llama el Edén que esta a media hora del centro de copaínala, y se integra de tres señoras quien cada una se dedica su respectiva actividad y vive en un lugar bonito fuera del pueblo en la que para llegar se entra caminando 

    La señora María Cristina es quien se le tomo la entrevista, ella tiene cincuenta y un años de edad, y es ama de casa, es casada con el señor  Julio Juan con quien procreo cinco hijos, quienes ya todos están casados y viven fuera de la comunidad.

   Ella ha estado trabajando en la compra de mercancía como son: azúcar, frijol, aceité, huevo, entre otros para surtir su negocio de abarrotes en donde lleva trabajando dos años y comenta que le va bien ya que con esto saca ingresos para su hogar.

  Es una señora muy alegres que de cariño le dicen doña (Cristi) y en su comunidad comenta que es una señora muy buena en laque también dicen que es la mama del barrio ya que ya que con ello  acuden a todo.
 
  Lo que desea es que con el préstamo  y su negocio  ella pueda seguir trabajando  hasta que Dios le preste vida, como también  poder comprar estantes para exhibir su mercancía.

   Quienes integran en el grupo son la señora: María del Carmen quien invertirá en la compra de mercancía como son artículos de fuller y jafra y la señora Romelia invertirá en la compra de mercancía para su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
This group is called “Edén” (Eden) and it’s located half an hour from downtown Copainalá.  It has three women members each with her own activity.  They live in a pretty place outside of town that one must reach on foot.

María Cristina was interviewed.  She’s 51-years-old and is a housewife married to Julio with whom she has five children who are all now married living outside of the community.  She’s been working buying merchandise like sugar, beans, oil and eggs, among others to stock her grocery store where she’s been working for two years.  She comments that she does well because she earns household income this way.  She’s a very cheerful woman who is affectionately called “Doña Cristi” and it’s said in her community that she’s a very good woman who they also say is the neighborhood’s mother because they come to her for everything.

What she wants is that with this loan and her business she will be able to continue working as long as God gives her life as well as to be able to buy shelving to display her merchandise.  

The other group members are María del Carmen who will buy Fuller and Jafra products and Romelia who will also buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: После окончания средней школы, Нигора поставила себе цель стать известным медиком как ее мать. С этой целью она поступила в Худжандский  Государственный Университет факультет Химии и биологии по специальности врач - лаборанта. Нигора студентка 1 курса. Она очень умная и трудолюбивая девушка. Учиться отлично и активно участвует на всех мероприятиях университета. Родители Нигоры простые рабочие и они не в состоянии оплатить за учебу своего ребенка. Нигора обратилась в Имон Интернешенл с целью получения займа для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
After finishing high school, Nigora set herself the goal to become a famous physician, like her mother. With this aim she started at the Khujand State University, at the faculty of Chemistry and Biology, specializing to become a Medical Doctor and analyst. 

Nigora is a student in the first year. She is a very smart and hard working girl. Nigora's parents are regular workers and they are not in a position to pay for their child's studies. Nigora turned to "Imon International" with an aim to receive a loan for paying for the studies at the university. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Abejitas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es: Cristina tiene 35 años de edad y es parte del grupo llamado Abejitas Trabajadoras, comenta que a su grupo le pusieron ese nombre porque las abejas se le hacen animalitos muy inteligentes y trabajadores y es por eso que le pusieron así a su grupo. Ella está casada con el señor Edgar el cual es carpintero y tienen 3 niños los cuales dice que son su adoración y su motor para salir adelante. Platica que ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de muebles como recamaras, mesas, sillas, comedores, cajoneras, roperos y muchas más creaciones que realiza y vende, platica que  su esposo fue el que le ha enseñado a como cortar la madera, lijarlos, pintarlos, y venderlos en un local que tiene cerca a una carretera, dice que tiene con este negocio aproximadamente más de 8 años y que su negocio ha podido ayudarla a salir adelante ella y su familia. Dice que la madera con la que hace los muebles se la llevan hasta su taller y que la que mas maneja es la madera de pino y aglomerado (aserrín compactado), dice que ella y su esposo venden los muebles en un local y abeces sale a venderlos a comunidades aledañas a su población en pagos para que no se les haga pesado pagar a los clientes. Dice que está pidiendo un crédito a Visión Fund para la compra de material que es el barniz que le ponen a los muebles que es lo que más le hace falta ahorita ya que ahorita tiene varios muebles sin barnizar por falta de capital ya que abeces los clientes le quedan mal en los pagos y no tiene para la compra de material. La meta que tiene doña Cristina es poder hacer crecer su negocio ella dice “me gustaría que mi negocio creciera para que el día que yo falte dejarles un negocio estable a mis hijos”. Los otros once integrantes del grupo se llaman Elizabeth, Rosa, Mariana, Jorge, María de Jesús, Adriana de Jesús, Teresa, Georgina, Nubia, María del Carmen y Jaime ellos invertirán sus créditos en surtir insumos para elaborar antojitos mexicanos, en la compra de material como hilos, agujas, cuadrille, para elaborar prendas artesanales, en la compra de materia prima para elaborar pan, en la compra de globos papel de diferentes diseños para fiestas, bolsas de regalo para adornar regalos y venderlos, en la compra de insumos para elaborar tamales y atoles y para surtir ropa para dama y caballeros para su venta.
texts.en:
Cristina, 35, is part of a group called “Abejitas Trabajadoras” (Little Worker Bees).  She comments that they named their group thus because they feel bees are very intelligent, hardworking little animals and that’s why they chose that name for their group.  

She’s married to Edgar who is a carpenter and they have three children who she says are her joy and the reason to move forward.  She relates that she has a business manufacturing furniture like bedroom sets, tables, chairs, dining room sets, chests of drawers, armoires and many other things she makes and sells.  She relates that her husband taught her how to cut, sand and paint the wood and to sell them in a locale they have alongside a highway.  She says that she’s had the business about 8 years and thanks to it she and her family have been able to get ahead.

She says that the wood she uses to make the furniture is delivered to her workshop and the wood she uses the most is pine and conglomerate (pressed sawdust).  She says that she and her husband sell the furniture in a locale and sometimes she goes out to sell it in communities adjacent to her town on credit so that customers can afford to make the payments.

She says that she’s asking Vision Fund for a loan to buy varnish they apply to the furniture which is what they most need right now because she currently has several pieces of furniture still unvarnished for lack of capital because sometimes her customers don’t follow through with their payments and she does not have the wherewithal to buy supplies.

Cristina’s goal is to make her business grow.  She says that she’d like her business to grow so that when she’s no longer here she can leave her children a stable business.  

The other eleven group members are called Elizabeth, Rosa, Mariana, Jorge, María de Jesús, Adriana de Jesús, Teresa, Georgina, Nubia, María del Carmen and Jaime.  They will use their loans to stock up on fast-food ingredients, to buy supplies like thread, needles and cross-stitch fabric to make artisanal clothing, to buy raw materials to make bread, to buy paper balloons in various designs for parties, to buy gift bags to decorate gifts to sell, to buy ingredients to make tamales and atole [drink made of corn flour] and to stock up on clothes for women and men to sell.

loans.use: to buy varnish for the furniture she sells.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Thanks to the efforts Charles has shown since he started his goat meat business, he has learned a lot and above all, he has been able to save money to expand his lines of operation. He is so grateful for the trust Kiva and Yehu have in him. Charles tells us that the previous loans have had a positive impact on his living standards. He is taking out a new loan to start a new business; selling fresh water. He needs to buy water pipes and pay for installation costs.

loans.use: to buy water pipes and pay for installation costs.

loans.name: Diversidades Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Diversidades” está conformado por 15 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; feriantes, gimnasia, artesanía, venta de huevos, confitería, confección de fundas, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Independencia, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Cynthia, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una chaqueta de color café, una polera de color salmón, lleva puesto una cartera cruzada de color negro, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la veterinaria desde hace 10 años. Comenta que trabaja en comunidad con 20 personas que se encargan de vacunar, esterilizar y desparasitar animales tanto domésticos como los de las calles, trabaja de lunes a sábado, donde en la semana se encarga de realizar esterilización y revisión a los anímales, y los sábados realiza vacunaciones, dentro de su hogar vive con 30 perros, que son sus mascotas, su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, ya que a veces se dirige a los domicilios de sus clientelas.
La mercadería  e insumos que va necesitando en la veterinaria los compra en diferentes distribuidoras a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará una maquina ultrasonido de limpieza dental para mascotas.
Una de las metas de Cynthia es instalar una clínica veterinaria junto con sus trabajadores, así generar mayores ingresos  para crecer e instalar un hospital veterinario.
Cynthia vive junto a su madre. Sus sueños a nivel personal y laboral colocar una clínica veterinaria.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgió a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional de la ciudad. Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Diversidades" ("Diversities") and it's comprised of 15 entrepreneurs who are in various lines of work. Among them are owning a sales stall, owning a gym, making crafts, selling eggs, making pastries, manufacturing covers, providing services, etc. All of them belong to the township of Independencia, located in the city of Santiago.
Cynthia is the president of the communal bank. In the photo she's pictured standing up in the front row, the third one from right to left. She's wearing a coffee-colored jacket and a salmon-colored shirt, and she carries a black purse with a shoulder strap. Her hair is dark brown and she wears it down.
She's been a veterinarian for the past 10 years. She reports that she works alongside 20 people who provide vaccines, neutering and worming for both domestic and stray animals. She works Monday through Saturday; on weekdays she neuters and examines the animals, and on Saturdays she provides vaccines. At her home she has 30 dogs as pets. She organizes her working hours according to her availability, since she occasionally visits her clientele in their homes.
She buys the merchandise and supplies she needs from various distributors at low prices, which is financially convenient.
With this loan she'll purchase an ultrasound machine for cleaning pets' teeth.
One of Cynthia's goals is to set up a veterinary clinic along with her fellow workers. That way she'll increase her earnings in order to grow and set up a veterinary hospital.
Cynthia lives with her mother. Her personal and professional dream is to set up a veterinary clinic.
She's very glad and thankful for the opportunity she's been given by Fondo Esperanza, since it will allow her to invest in her business. As for the communal bank she belongs to, she reports that they have very good communication. On the other hand, the trainings have helped her to learn new sales and accounting strategies.
Independencia is one of the 34 townships that comprise the city of Santiago (the capital of Chile), located in the middle-north area. It surfaced in the late 19th century as a traditional area of town. Its main axis is Independencia Avenue, through which passed the ancient Inca Trail, the north entrance to the city of Santiago. Given its large indigenous population, Independencia is home to Chile's Indigenous Cultural Center. It also has important historical buildings, such as six historical monuments of Chile.

loans.use: to purchase an ultrasound machine for cleaning pets' teeth.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana, 40, is a mother of 5 children whose ages are between 18 and 5, all of them are attending school. She owns a kiosk business selling daily necessities such as instant noodles, shampoo, detergent, salt, mosquito coils, candy, and snacks. Although Suzana’s income is small to provide for her daily needs, she has to be satisfied with what she can achieve.  

Suzana really wanted to improve the business but unfortunately she did not have the capital to do so. She then went to the TLM office and requested a loan around IDR. 3,000,000. The loan enabled her to add more stock such as sugar, coffee, instant noodles, soap, detergent, oil, eggs, etc. She now hopes that the business can improve her family’s income and enable her to fulfill the children's schooling expenses. In addition, she hopes that she can save a small amount of the profit to refurbish her house.

loans.use: to add more stock such as sugar, coffee, instant noodles, soap, detergent, oil, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Ika

texts.en:
Ika is a 40 year old married woman. She has been blessed with 4 children and all of them are attending school. To make money, Ika runs a kiosk business. She sells daily basic necessities such as bath soap, detergent, cooking oil, instant noodles, eggs, candy, snacks, etc.  The income generated from the business enables her to cover the family needs and the children’s schooling fees. 

Ika realized that as time goes on the educational expenses of the children are increasing as well as the everyday needs of the family. This situation led her to establish a cattle fattening business. She would like to buy 4 young cattle to be fattened and sold; therefore she is requesting a loan from TLM of IDR. 7,500,000. She is expecting that she could implement her dream because of the loan assistance given by TLM.

loans.use: to buy 4 young cattle to be fattened and sold

loans.name: Agustinus

texts.en:
Agustinus, a 29-year-old man who is married to Feronika, a 21-year-old woman, has an 11-month-old baby girl named Alvina.  Agustinus produces income for his family through selling his agricultural products from his farm i.e. water spinach, mustard greens, papaya, cassava leaves, papaya flowers and cassava. 

To add more income, Agustinus plans to run a pig-raising business, as he knows that his farm could provide enough food for the pig. To do so, Agustinus is requesting a loan from TLM of IDR 10,000,000. The loan would help Agustinus to buy four piglets and to build a pigsty.

loans.use: to buy piglets and to build a pigsty.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en: Cirila is 57 years old and a mother of six grown children. She and her husband farm rice in the community of San Miguel, Bohol. She is used to farming since having her family. This has been their source of livelihood. She realized that she could do better with her farming if given financial assistance. She requested a loan to be used to buy seedlings, pesticides and fertilizers. The extra income that she can get from this will be used for her family’s daily consumption and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a married woman from Nocnocan, Talibon. She and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of their income.

Laura is in need of additional capital for her business to buy more materials for fishing such as nets. She believes that this loan could be a great help to her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more materials for fishing such as nets

loans.name: Safari

texts.en:
Safari lives in the Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya. He is single. He deals in the transport industry where he owns a motorcycle, a business he has been operating for three years.
 
He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him and he joined a group with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge he is facing is the seasonal business climate.

Safari is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to buy another motorcycle. The extra income from the loan will help meet his needs.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 31 years old and married to Julius, who is 32 years old. From their marriage, they are blessed with two children: Sandro, 8, is attending elementary school grade 3 and Jeanette, 5. Anastasia has been running a furniture business since 2005. Her husband has skills to create such wood items as window sills, doors, cabinets and beds, while Anastasia assists him in marketing and selling the products. 

At the moment, Anastasia and her husband have a better chance of improving their business as they received an order to produce window sills and door frames for school and office construction projects. However, they didn’t have enough capital to purchase wood in bulk for the raw materials. Therefore, Anastasia requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 6,000,000. She would like to utilize the loan to purchase more wood.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for her furniture business.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en: Victoriano is 52 years old and from the town of San Miguel, Bohol.  He is married with seven children ranging in age from 6 to 17.  Farming has been his source of income for his family for 31 years now. He wants to give his kids a better future. The very reason why he is working hard on his farming business and requests a loan is to improve his yield. The loan will be used to buy fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides and a sprayer. His profit will be use to support his children’s schooling and for future savings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides and a sprayer.

loans.name: Felita

texts.en: Felita is 38 years old and married with four children. Her eldest is 12 and her youngest is 6. She and her family lives in San Miguel, Bohol. Felita farms rice so she can provide for her children. She has high hopes for them and she wants them to be successful someday. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and hopes that she can have a good harvest in the future. Felita dreams of seeing her children become professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth, 39, is married and lives at Compound #3 with her husband. Their two children, ages 2 and 8, are in school. Elizabeth completed her education in the 6th grade. Her husband is a businessman. For the past four years, she has been managing her retail store where she sells bread, butter, sardines, slippers, hair grease, body cream, biscuits, candy, hair combs, bath soap and many other items. She makes a profit everyday because she has what her customers need. With the profit, she buy more goods and helps her husband with the expenses of the home. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sardines, bread, body cream, bath soap, and slippers for the business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more sardines, bread, body cream, bath soap, and slippers for the business.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es: Jairo de 36 años de edad, se dedica a la producción de grecas industriales, cocinas de acero, pasamanos y todo lo relacionado con la metalmecánica, desde hace 14 años de cuando inició su experiencia en el año 1998 emprendiendo un negocio,  después de haberse capacitado en el SENA “Servicio Nacional de aprendizaje” y decidir emprender su propia aventura generadora de ingresos de la cual vivir y sacar adelante a su familia. Hoy su negocio ha crecido y  sus compras así como sus ventas, las realizan de contado y a crédito y utiliza catálogos y trabaja por referenciacion de otros clientes. En la actualidad Jairo está aplicando a su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual compró materia prima en mayor volumen  y logró descuentos importantes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará remaches, brocas, láminas galvanizadas etc. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local de mayor tamaño y poder generar otros puestos de trabajo, tener su propia casa y el negocio en un mismo punto. Su mayor desafío es mejorar sus inventarios y tener más capital para poder cumplir los compromisos adquiridos y futuros de su clientela y esta es la razón por la cual se esfuerza cada día más.
texts.en:
Jairo is 36 years old and works in the production industrial fretworks, steel kitchens, banisters, and anything related to metalworking. Fourteen years ago he started his business in the year 1998, after having qualified with the “SENA- Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje” (SENA National Service of Learning),  to undertake his own enterprise to earn income to live and get his family ahead.  Today his business has grown in his purchases and sales. The sales are cash and credit. He uses catalogs and works through references from his clients. 

Currently, Jairo is applying for a second loan through “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo” (Foundation Mario Santo Domingo). He used the first loan to purchase material in large volume for important discounts. Currently, he is applying for a Kiva credit with which he will purchase clinches, reels, galvanized sheets etc.

His future goal is to have a larger store and be able to create other work, have his own home, and have his business at the same point. His major challenge is to improve his inventory and have more capital to complete his current and future commitments to his clients. For this reason he works harder everyday.

loans.use: purchase clinches, reels, galvanized sheets

loans.name: Valaa

texts.en:
Valaa is a 21-year-old micro entrepreneur who opened a cosmetics salon in Shfaram. Since the age of 15, she has worked as a cosmetics assistant. Valaa is a quiet, determined professional who is committed to moving forward. When she graduated from high school, Valaa took cosmetics and hair styling training courses and then she began providing cosmetic treatments to clients. Valaa wants to expand her business to include a hair salon. Her beauty and hair salon will still service her existing clients and has significant potential to reach new clients as well.

Valaa needed this loan to assist with rental costs, salon equipment and a permanent makeup device.

Valaa wants to continue her professional training and one day open a full-scale beauty spa.

loans.use: To pay for rental costs, salon equipment and a permanent makeup device.

loans.name: Grasindo

texts.en:
Grasindo is 34 years old and married to Jendelina, 39 years old. They have two children: Suzan, 7, is in the second grade of elementary school, and Pedro, 5. Grasindo is originally from East Timor. He moved to his current residence 10 years ago. 

To make a living, Grasindo works as a building laborer and motor taxi driver. He utilizes his neighbor’s motorcycle to run the business. The income generated from his motor taxi business is divided fairly with the motorcycle owner. Grasindo really wants to buy a second motorcycle at a low price but his lack of capital has prevented him from implementing his plan. He then heard about TLM and got interested in joining the lending program. Grasindo requested a loan amounting to IDR 5,000,000. He would like to spend the loan on a second hand motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a second hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Ma.fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is a 59-year-old married woman and a mother of six grown up children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for several years now. This is their primary source of income.

Ma. Fe works hard to support her husband. She is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets. This loan could be a great help in improving their way of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more agricultural products such as bananas, cassava, vegetables, peanuts, coconuts etc.

loans.name: Tukwatanize Nyamondo Group

texts.en: Tabaro is a married man aged 50 living in Kagadi, Uganda. He was initially involved in brick laying and after accumulating enough capital he ventured into the local brew business where he has since reaped tangible benefits. Inadequate capital is affecting the business while his dreams are to expand his business to other areas within the district and educate his six children up to the University. He is a member of the above mentioned group where each member guarantees the others to access a loan. Tabaro is requesting the loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Ma.melona

texts.en:
Ma. Melona is a 33-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a "tuba" (coconut wine) vending business for several years now. She is also engaged in a seaweed farming business together with her husband.

Ma. Melona is asking for a loan to buy more "tuba" (coconut wine) to sell. In the future, Ma. Melona dreams of making her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more "tuba" (coconut wine) to sell

loans.name: Victor Ramon

texts.es: Víctor tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el municipio de la Lima, Cortes junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos. Anteriormente Víctor trabajaba en una maquila y al quedar sin empleo decidió emprender su propio negocio. El compra tortillas de maíz al por mayor en una tortillería y las revende a otro precio ya embolsado, este negocio le genera buenas ganancias. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante utilizando una Motocicleta como medio de transporte para distribuir de casa en casa las tortillas. Vende por la mañana al medio día y en la tarde. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y es para comprar más producto para vender y ampliar la cobertura de clientes. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio, mejorar los ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Victor, age 39, lives with his wife and two children in the Lima municipality of Cortes.  Victor previously worked at a factory.  Upon being left without employment, he decided to undertake his own business.  

He buys corn tortillas wholesale at a tortilla business and resells them packaged for another price.  This business generates good income for him.  He sells in an itinerant manner.  He uses a motorcycle as his means of transportation in order to distribute the tortillas door to door.  He sells in the morning until midday and in the afternoon.

The loan he is requesting is for 10,000 lempiras.  He will use it to buy more product to sell and expand his customer coverage.  His goal is to make his business grow, to improve his income, and to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn tortillas wholesale to resell.

loans.name: Munkhzul

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhzul is 27 years old. She lives with her husband and a 6- and 4-year-old boy and girl in her wooden house, which is located in a boundary area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

She works as a games mistress in a private school, and her husband has been working as a public bus driver in a transportation company for six years. Her elder son studies at a government secondary school and the younger one goes to kindergarten. 

Four years ago, her family received a housing loan to buy a house. By this past August, they had paid back the loan. Now, Munkhzul is asking for a 3,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) loan to buy a used car for carrying her children to their school and kindergarten. Also, she said that she has a plan to run a taxi business in her spare time between home and school. By doing this, she can increase her family income. 

In Mongolia during rush hour, finding a taxi can be “mission impossible.” In the future, she is planning to own an apartment with a water and sewer line.

loans.use: To buy a used car for carrying her children to their school and kindergarten and to increase her family income by using the car as a taxi.

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se  llama las vecinas y se integra de tres señoras  que viven muy cerca de la otra por eso le dieron este nombre a su grupo.

  La señora Josefa fue quien se le tomo la entrevista, se caso a la edad de diecisiete años y procreo cuatro hijos que ya está fuera de su responsabilidad, enviudo hace  unos años  y comenta que para ella asido difícil  ya que cuando su  esposo  Fallecido le quedo dos hijos pequeños  en la que da gracias adiós  por haberle dado la fuerza de sacarlos adelante.

  Doña chepita  como le llaman en su  comunidad, se dedica a la  compra de productos de avon, en donde vende perfumes, desodorantes, tintes, entre otros en donde lleva trabajando  quince años y le va bien, así también ella no solo se dedica a eso también vende dulces de coco, nuégado, tamales, hoja de guineo, Tamales de bola ya que comenta que si no hay de uno hay de otra actividad  para tener sus ingresos.
 
  Se siente muy contenta ya que con esta actividad y el préstamo   su actividad esta trabajando  my bien y sus ingreso son mejores cada día.
 
  Las señoras que se integran en este grupo son: María Elba  quien invertirá en la compra de materiales para su herrería y la señora Inez invertirá en la compra de pollos.
texts.en:
This group is called the neighbors and is made up of three women that live near each other that is why they gave the group this name.

Josefa is the person interviewed. She was married at 17 years old and she had 4 children that are now no longer her responsibility.  She has been widowed for some years and she comments that it has been difficult when her husband died she was left with two small children. Thanks to God she had the courage to get them ahead. 

Doña chepita, how they call her in her community, works in the sale of Avon products where she sells perfumes, deodorants, dyes, among other things. She has done this work for 15 years and she does well. Not only does she work in this she also sells coconut candies, nougat, tamales, sheets of guinea. She comments that if there is not one activity then there is another to earn income. She feels content with this activity and with the loan her business has been good and her income better everyday. 

The women that compose this group are: Maira Elba who invested in the purchase of materials for her blacksmith shop and Inez will invest in the purchase of chickens.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics from the brand Avon

loans.name: Ma. Glenda

texts.en:
Ma. Glenda is a 41-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 20 years now together with her husband. 

Ma. Glenda is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, straw, nylon, and buckets. In the future, Ma. Glenda hopes to make her business sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, straw, nylon, and buckets

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi, 25, is married and has two children, the older being 4 years old and the younger (the one with her mother on the photograph) is 1 year old. She lives in the rural areas of Samburu, Kenya. 

She’s been working in agriculture for the last five years, and she grows corn, beans, peas, etc. She sells her products in the local market. She’s requesting a 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and planting materials. She hopes to produce a better harvest and earn a higher family income thanks to this investment. Her goal is to support her family and to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and planting materials.

loans.name: El Sol Group

texts.es:
Don Tereso es integrante del grupo "El sol", el cual esta conformado por 12 personas cada una de ella desarrolla una actividad económica diferente. Don Tereso tiene 41 años de edad, solo estudio la primaria y esta casado con doña Eugenia con la cual tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos son niños. Don Tereso platica que durante muchos años se dedicó al trabajo del campo pero como solo había trabajo por temporadas se vio en la 
necesidad de buscar una actividad que pudiera mantener durante todo el año ya que tiene que proveer a su familia. Él platica que en su comunidad se acostumbra a que los señores vendan tortillas en motos y que las lleven a la puerta de las casa. Le pareció un negocio rentable y se compró su moto. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de tortillas. Inicialmente, solo vendía en su comunidad, pero actualmente sale a las localidades aledañas a vender. Dado que ya es conocido, todos los días solo sale a entregar sus pedidos. Tereso quiere invertir su crédito en el mantenimiento de su moto y para comprar tortillas para posteriormente revenderlas. Además, él espera que su negocio continúe progresando y poco a poco ganar mas clientes, ya 
que a futuro le gustaría comprarse una moto mas grande.

Las actividades de los demás integrantes son:

Sacramento: venta de abarrotes
Alvaro: cultivo de maíz
Maria Luisa: venta de abarrotes
Teofila: venta de refrescos
Maria Esther: cria de cerdos 
Mariela: venta de refrescos 
Rebeca: venta de ropa 
Omar: venta de articulos para el hogar(topper)
Dario: servicio de transporte
Paula: venta de tortillas
Maria Antonio: Venta de pollo
texts.en:
Tereso is a member of the “El Sol” Group, which is composed of 12 persons, each of whom pursues a different economic activity. Tereso is 41 years old, only studied through primary school, and is married to Eugenia with whom he has 3 children, 2 of whom are sons.

Tereso says that for many years he worked in the countryside but having found only seasonal work, he needed to look for an activity that he could maintain year round, since he needed to provide for his family. He says that in his community they are accustomed to men selling tortillas from motorbikes, delivering to the doors of houses. It seemed to him a profitable business and he bought his own motorcycle. 

For 3 years now he has been selling tortillas. Initially, he only sold within his community, but at present, he goes out to neighboring localities to sell. Given the fact that he is well known now, every day he just has to deliver orders. 

Tereso wishes to invest his loan in motorcycle maintenance, and to buy tortillas to be resold. Moreover, he hopes that his business will continue progressing and, little by little, to gain more customers, since in the future, he would like to buy a larger motorcycle.

The activities of the other members are as follows:
Sacramento sells groceries
Alvaro cultivates corn
Maria Luisa sells groceries
Teofila sells soft drinks
Maria Esther raises pigs
Mariela sellsl soft drinks
Rebecca sells clothing
Omar sells articles for the home (tupperware)
Dario provides transportation services
Paula sells tortillas
Maria Antonio sells chicken

loans.use: to buy tortillas and maintain a delivery motorcycle.

location.town: Buenos Aires, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Las Conchitas (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “las conchitas,”  se identifica con este nombre ya que las integrantes son del barrio llamado Concepción, en la que celebran en el mes de junio.
A la señora Blanca Luz,  es quien se  le tomo la entrevista,  ella nació en copínala en el mes de agosto en mil novecientos cincuenta y uno  estudio, a hasta el tercero de secundaria en la que a los diecisiete años se caso y procreo  cuatro hijos quienes ya todos están casados.

Ella se dedica a su negocio de comidas, en donde lleva trabajando nueve años y dos meses,  en la que comenta que le va bien ya que ella misma sale a levantar pedidos para vender y entregarle a sus clientes.

  Inicio con esta actividad ya que también le gusta aportar ingresos en su hogar y, así a poyarse  con algunos gastos que se generan en su vida diaria ya que es una mujer sola que solo depende de su negocio.

  Se motivo a esta actividad es para tener su propio dinero ya que su esposo estaba mal de salud y ya no podía trabajar por eso decido dedicar su tiempo en algo que le deje ingresos.
 
  Lo que desea es que con su negocio logre seguir adelante mientras Dios le preste vida y con las ganancias que va teniendo mejorar su local en donde vende.

   Las personas que integran en el grupo son las señoras: Lorena del Carmen invertirá en la compra y venta de refresco y la señora Sandra invertirá en la compra de materiales para su estética.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Conchitas”.  They identify themselves with this name because the members are from the Concepción neighborhood, which they celebrate during the month of June.

Blanca Luz is the one who was interviewed.  She was born in Copínala in the month of August in 1951.  She attended school until the third year of high school.  She got married when she was 17, and she has four children, who are all now married.

She devotes herself to her food business.  She has been working in the business for nine years and two months.  She says that it is going well for her because she, herself, goes out and takes orders to sell and deliver to her customers.

She started this business activity because she also likes to contribute income to her household.  This way she helps with some of the expenses that are generated daily.  She is a single woman, and she depends solely upon her business.

Her motive for this business activity is to have her own money.  Her husband was in bad health, and he could no longer work.  That is why she decided to devote her time to something that left her with income.  What she wishes is to manage to get ahead in her business as long as God gives her life.  She wants to use the income that she is getting to improve the place where she sells.

The people who comprise the group are:  

Lorena del Carmen:  Will invest in buying and selling soft drinks
Sandra:  Will invest in buying materials for her beauty salon

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 34 years old, married and supports a family of six dependents. He has operated a butcher shop for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He is applying for his first loan of KES 10,000, with which he plans to purchase more livestock for slaughter so as to increase the stock of meat for sale in the shop.

He plans to use his anticipated profits to expand his business and his future dream is to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy livestock for slaughter

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 51-year-old widow. She has a food stall business which enables her to cover her family needs. She has four children; two of the children have graduated from school, while the other two are still attending school.
 
Maria operates the business in front of a high school. Her hospitality and kindness make the students happy to come over. Moreover, she sells meatballs, which are the students’ favorite food. She also provides cold beverages at her stall. 

Maria is thinking of enlarging the business place, therefore she requested loan of 12,000,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiah) from TLM. She would like to use the loan to buy building materials and also to add more menu items, like “soto ayam” (made of cabbage mixed with noodles, boiled egg and chicken) and also “mie ayam,” commonly known as chicken noodle. Maria is hoping that she will be more successful in running the business.

loans.use: to add more menu items, like “soto ayam” (cabbage mixed with noodles, boiled egg and chicken) and “mie ayam,” commonly known as chicken noodle.

loans.name: Vicente Guerrero Group

texts.es:
Vicente Guerrero es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 4 mujeres emprendedoras, ella le dieron poner este nombre a su grupo porque es la calle en la que se ubica el lugar de reunión. Paulina es uno de los miembros de este grupo ella tiene la edad de 36 años, es soltera y estudio la universidad, ella nos platica que no le ha sido fácil encontrar un empleo así que decidió emprender su propio negocio y hace un poco mas de 5 años abrió una pequeña tenda de abarrotes en su hogar con el  paso de los años su negocio ha progresado y recientemente construyo un pequeño local en el cual se ubica su negocio actualmente, ella ha ganado muchos clientes y nos dice que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio aparte de ganar su propio dinero es que siempre esta en contacto con la gente y ha hecho buenas amistades. Paulina abre su negocio todos los días de 8:00 AM a 8:00 PM y siempre da un buen trato a sus clientes ya que es lo que ayuda a que vuelvan a comprar con ella, un crédito de Vision Fund le dará la oportunidad de resurtir su negocio comprando jabón, frijol, sopa, arroz, aceite, galletas, dulces, frituras, refrescos y productos enlatados.

ella desea que con esta inversión su negocio deja mas ganancia y si poder surtir con mas productos su tienda 

Mirna venta de zapatos 
Maria del Pilar venta de ropa interior
Vianey venta de abarrotes
texts.en:
Vicente Guerrero is the name of this group made up of four enterprising women. They chose this name for their group because it is the name of the street where they hold their meetings. Paulina is one of the group members. She is 36 years old, is single, and is a university student. According to Paulina, she opened her own business because it was difficult to find some other kind of work. A little over five years ago, she set up a small grocery store from her home. As time passed, her business has grown and she recently built a small shop where her store is located now. Paulina has many clients and she says that what she likes best about her business, besides earning her own money, is that she is constantly in contact with people and she has been able to make good friendships. 

Paulina's store is open every day from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. She always gives her customers a good deal because this helps to ensure repeat purchases. A loan from Vision Fund will give her the opportunity to restock her store, buying soap, beans, soup, rice, oil, cookies, sweets, fried foods, soft drinks, and canned goods. 

Paulina hopes that with this investment in her business, she will increase her earnings and be able to better stock her store.

Mirna sells shoes
Maria del Pilar sells underwear
Vianey sells groceries

loans.use: to buy soap, beans, soup, rice, oil, cookies, sweets, fried foods, soft drinks, and canned goods.

loans.name: Musulmonqul

texts.ru:
Мусулмонкул родился в 1982 году в районе Рудаки. Он женат. Жена Мусулмонкула домохозяйка. Сам Мусулмонкул имеет среднее образование. Он уже год как занимается торговлей. Мусулмонкул открыл продуктовый магазин, где он работает продавцом. 
Мусулмонкул берет кредит для покупки риса, сахара, растительного и сливочного масла.
texts.en:
Musulmonqul was born in 1982 in the Rudaki region of Tajikistan. He's married and has a high school level of education. For the past year, he's worked in his food store as a salesman, while his wife takes care of their household. 

Musulmonqul is asking for a loan in order to purchase rice, sugar vegetable oil and butter.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, vegetable oil and butter.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is a 44-year-old farmer from the town of  Trinidad, Bohol.  She has grown vegetables like eggplant, water spinach and okra with her husband for 12 years now.  She is married with three children ages 18, 21 and 26. She is asking for a  loan to buy fertilizer for her vegetables and to buy more seedlings for other types of vegetables that she can plant in her garden.  

She hopes that someday she can improve her farm for a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Madonna

texts.en:
Madonna is a 22-year-old married woman and has been engaged in the fish-selling business for some time now. This is her source of income for the family expenses. Madonna dreams of expanding her business but lacks the capital to do so. She is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. 

In the future, Madonna wants to explore another venture to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sais Suleve

texts.es:
Sais es una joven e 20 años de edad, madre de un pequeño de un añito al cual quiere muchísimo y al cual saca adelante sola ya que el padre de su pequeño la abandono y debido a ello se ha convertido en padre y madre para su pequeño. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido y por desarrollarse la agricultura y la ganadería. Por las noches después de llegar de trabajar le gusta contarle un cuento a su pequeño para hacerlo dormir y luego le encanta mucho leer algunos libros. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Sais trabaja como ayudante una pequeña tienda de venta de relojes, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Sais esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una cocina para su hogar ya que actualmente solo tiene una de Kerosene y hace algunos mese casi sufre un accidente, por ello con esta mejora tendrá una mejor calidad de vida y sobre todo podrá tener mayor seguridad, así ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Sais is a young 20-year-old woman and the mother of a young one-year-old son whom she loves very much and who she raises alone since his father abandoned him and due to that she has become both the mother and father of her child.

Her home is located in the city of Ica, which is characterized by its warm climate and for developing agriculture and livestock. In the evenings after arriving from work she likes to tell her child stories to help him sleep and then she really loves to read some books.

Due to her limited financial resources she could only study up until the fifth grade of secondary school but she would have liked to have a university degree.

Day-to-day, Sais works as a helper in a small store that sells watches. She works around nine hours a day and believes her work is going well for her because she is very nice with the clients and above all because she is responsible and very eager to get ahead.

Sais is very thankful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help they have offered her, she can buy a stove for her home since currently she only has a Kerosene stove and a few months ago she almost had an accident. For that reason, with this improvement she will have a better quality of life and most importantly she can have better security. She will continue fighting to be able to make her biggest dream come true: "To provide her son a good education and to have her own business."

loans.use: to buy a stove

loans.name: Flor De Limon (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo “flor de limón” lleva dos ciclos en esta Microfinanciera y se integra de tres señoras quienes hablan  la lengua zoque y vive en una comunidad  llamada san Isidro.

   Doña Paulina, es quien se le entrevisto,  ella tiene treinta y seis años de edad,  nació en el pueblo de ocotepec, estudio solo la primaria  y se caso con el señor  Alberto a la edad de quince años, ellos tuvieron cuatro hijos que aún están a  su  responsabilidad.

  La señora  invirtió el préstamo anterior en la compra de  pollos de granja, pero no le dio muy buen resultado, por eso ahora piensa invertir el préstamos iniciando un negocio de comidas económicas y así pueda trabajar el préstamo  con más ganas.

  Su motivo a esta actividad es gracias a su  mamá quien la ha estado animando y diciendo que trabaje en una actividad que le deje un mejor ingresó, así también ella para animarse le prestara un lugarcito en donde pueda vender las comidas.

  El sueño de la señora Paulina, es poder seguir trabajando y ahorrar, para comprar materiales y poder techar su casa en donde vive con su familia.

 Quienes se integran en el grupo el limón son: la señora Marcelina quien invertirá en la compra de plástico y la señora  Florida invertirá el grupo en la compra y venta de ropas.
texts.en: The "Flor de Limón" group in on its second loan cycle with this microfinance organization and is made up of three women who speak the Zoque language and live in a community called San Isidro. Ms. Paulina, who completed the interview, is 36 years-old and was born in the village of Ocotepec. She only completed elementary school and got married to Alberto when she was 15 years-old. They have four children, who are still dependent on them. Paulina invested her last loan in raising poultry, but that didn't earn her a good enough return. That's why she's now planning to invest this loan in a snack food enterprise, and thus be able to put the investment to better use. She was inspired to go into this line of business by her mother, who has been urging her to commit to a trade that can earn her a better income and has offered her a small spot from where she can start selling her foods. Paulina's dream is to be able to go on working and save up to buy materials for putting a roof on her family's house. The other members of the group are Ms. Marcelina, who will invest in some plastic goods, and Mr. Florida who will invest in buying and selling clothing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food items.

loans.name: Florence T.

texts.en: Florence has been running a shop where she sells many items, such as rice, oil, butter, and batteries, in the area of Buchanan where she lives with her three children and husband. Her husband is a taxi driver. She says she is very happy about her business for many reasons: it supports her family and relatives. She was able to buy a piece of land to build her house, send her children to school, and bought a spot to build another shop on in the near future. She started this business in 2000 by selling cassava by the bag, with her husband. She has requested 110,000 LRD to purchase more goods for her business. She is a high school graduate, 30 years old, and her dream is to see herself as an international businesswoman and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 29  años de edad,  es casado y tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar, cuenta con  casa propia.  Vive junto a su familia en Lambayeque, zona que tiene un moderado movimiento comercial, pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Miguel vive en la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.  La actividad que desarrolla el titular es la venta de crianza y  comercialización  de animales, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, el negocio está situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.   

Miguel ha solicitado un préstamo de 2500 nuevos soles será para invertir en compra de planchas de eternit y tijerales, esto para la renovación de su techo y compra de pavos medianos para su engorde.  Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización.

Cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto por actividades relacionadas al jornal en agricultura.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 29, is married with four school-aged children and owns his own home. He and his family live in Lambayeque, an area with moderate commercial activity, belonging to the province of the same name and about twenty minutes outside the city of Chiclayo. Miguel lives in the rural part of Lambayeque and enjoys plumbing and electricity service in a small community of about 200 families. 

Miguel's business is raising and selling livestock, which he's been doing for 10 years, working out of his home. He learned this trade from his parents and knows it perfectly. Miguel has applied for a loan of 2,500 nuevos soles [PEN] to invest in some sheets of corrugated sheet metal and joists to repair his roof and buy ducks to raise. While his business does face some competition, there's also plenty of room in the market for him to make sales. He also makes some side income doing day labor in the agriculture industry.

loans.use: to invest in some sheets of corrugated sheet metal and joists to repair his roof and buy ducks to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Nemesiana

texts.en: Nemesiana hails from San Miguel, Bohol. She is 55 years old and married, with two children aged 16 and 20. She has been a farmer for 10 years now, growing rice and bananas for an income. She wanted to increase her income for her family’s benefit. She applied for a loan to be used for expenses related to tilling the land in preparation for planting season, fertilizers and seedlings and pesticides. Any additional income will go to her family’s daily consumption and her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and pesticides and pay labor fees.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y vive con su esposo em casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a 1 hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.  Cuenta con buenas referencias personales

Luz se dedica desde hace más de 10 años a la comercialización de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños.  Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de manjarblanco y rosquitas en su mismo domicilio.  El esposo de Luz es trabajador de la empresa agroindustrial de Cayaltí.  Asimismo brinda el servicio de transporte, contando con su propia mototaxi.  Ambos apoyan con los gastos del hogar.

Luz necesita comprar más ropa para su posterior comercialización.  Por lo que ha solicitado un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en: Luz, age 41, is married and lives with her husband in their own home in the Cayaltí district, located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque Province. She has great personal references. Luz has been working for over 10 years selling women's, men's and children's clothing. At the same time, she sells caramel and doughnuts from her home. Luz's husband works in the agriculture company located in Cayaltí. He also runs a transport service, with his own moto-taxi. They both contribute to their household expenses. Luz needs to buy more clothing to sell and so she's seeking a loan of 1,200 nuevos soles [PEN] from Edpyme Alternativa [Liva field partner] to meet her objectives.

loans.use: to buy clothing for sale.

loans.name: Maritha

texts.en:
Maritha is a married woman and a mother of a 10-year-old child, from Getafe, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in the fish-vending business for more than 20 years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.
Maritha dreams of expanding her business. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights and buckets for her husband's fishing venture.
In the future, Maritha wants to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, and buckets

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en: Cirila runs a small sari-sari (variety) store in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Cirila is 50 years old and married, with two adult children. Her husband works as a painter while she attends to her store. Cirila would like to help by making a success of her business. She is requesting a loan to buy items like detergent, brown sugar and soft drinks. Her loan will allow her to increase sales at her business and start earning more for her family. In the future, she dreams of earning sufficient income to expand her inventory.

loans.use: to buy detergent, brown sugar and soft drinks

loans.name: Jose Medardo

texts.es: José de  52 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años.  El cultiva los principales granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles y maíz. Cada año repite esta actividad ya que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida. Es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora. Vive en condiciones muy humildes junto con su familia, pero esta situación no lo desanima si no que le da fuerzas para continuar luchando por una calidad de vida diferente. Trabaja muy duro para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos  diferente a la agricultura. Es por esta razón solicitar un préstamo a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra del abono necesario para fertilizar la tierra ya que es la época para realizar la siembra de los diferentes granos. Con mucha confianza en Dios y en su trabajo espera tener una cosecha abundante de la cual pueda vender una parte y dejar otra parte para el consumo. Espera cumplir su sueño de dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José is 52 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and children. He has been a farmer for many years. He grows basic grains such as rice, beans and corn. Each year he repeats this activity in the way that he has learned, in order to earn a living. He is a hardworking, responsible and enterprising person. He lives in humble conditions with his family. His living situation does not discourage him. It gives him the energy to continue to struggle for a better life. He works really hard to bring bread each day to his home, as he doesn’t have any other source of income. This is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL. He will use the money to buy fertilizer to fertilize his land. This is the time he plants his crops. With faith in God and with his work he hopes to have an abundant harvest of which he will sell a part and keep the rest for his family’s consumption. He hopes to reach his dream of providing a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to fertilize his land.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is a married woman with eight children, four of whom are still in school. She owns a cafe in her home where she sells a variety of foods and beverages. In addition to this, she also runs a car wash, where she has hired two gentlemen. Khadija is requesting this loan to buy a water pump to expand her car wash business. She hopes to have good returns from this investment.

loans.use: to buy a water pump

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan 20 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto.  Él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos en especial maíz y tiene una pequeña cosecha de tomate.  De esta forma brinda lo necesario a su familia.  Después de cultivar la cosecha pone  a la venta cierta parte de los granos básicos para poder suplir el resto de necesidades, siendo esta  es su principal fuente de ingresos. Muchas personas dan buenas referencias de él ya que es un hombre trabajador, responsable y honesto. Cabe destacar que lleva los estudios a la par siendo un bachiller aspirando pronto a ser un gran profesional. Juan desea comprar los insumos básicos y es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito para la compra de: semillas, abonos, venenos para plagas, etc.  Para seguir cultivando los granos básicos que le permiten ir sobreviviendo cada día .Espera y confía en Dios todo poderoso que obtendrá resultados positivos y logrará su sueño de brindar a su querida familia mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en: Juan is 20 years old. He lives on a house on his property. He grows basic grains such as corn. He also has a small crop of tomatoes. This is how he provides the necessities for his family. After harvesting his crops, he sells some of the grains so that he can provide for his needs, as this is his primary source of income. A lot of people give good references for Juan. He is a hardworking, responsible and honest man. He still is studying in school in order to get his high school diploma. He hopes to be a professional. He would like to buy basic supplies and that is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL. He will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, etc. in order to continue to grow his basic grains. This farming allows him to make ends meet every day. He has faith in God the powerful to help him have a positive life. He struggles to give his loving family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena es una madre de familia que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo de dos años de edad en su casa ubicada en el caserío Bodegones, una zona rural que pertenece a la zona de Lambayeque, el caserío se ubica a unos 45 minutos  aproximadamente, allí también realiza su labor de crianza y venta de animales.

Filomena cría y vende animales menores por  mas de diez años, adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura, contando con un terreno de cultivo en donde, junto a su esposo, siembran diversos productos de panllevar, así como algunos granos como maíz. Estas actividades les permiten obtener diversos ingresos los cuales utiliza en el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Filomena se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de alimento para sus animales, de modo que su negocio pueda salir adelante.

Ella es una mujer bastante honesta y trabajadora, goza de buenas referencias personales por parte de sus vecinos, ella agradece de antemano a las personas que le ayuden con este préstamo.
texts.en:
Filomena is a mother. She lives with her husband and her two-year-old son in her house in the hamlet of Bodegones, which is a rural area belonging to the Lambayeque district and which is approximately 45 minutes away. It is in Bodegones that she also carries out her work of breeding and selling animals.

Filomena has bred and sold young animals for more than ten years. In addition, she makes a living from agriculture, having a piece of crop land which, together with her husband, she sows with various staple crops, as well as some grains such as maize. These activities allow them to obtain income from various sources to support the family finances.

Filomena is requesting a loan of 2500 PEN to invest in the purchase of food for her animals, so that her business can prosper.

She is an honest and hard-working woman with good personal references from her neighbours. She thanks in advance the people who will help her with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase food for her animals so that her business can prosper.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 33 years old and from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and has two young children. Evangeline operates a sari-sari (convenience) store business in her town for an income. This business has been in operation for two years, earning her 2000 PHP per month. She sells basic household needs such as soft drinks, snacks, rice, toiletries and seasoning. She is asking for a loan to buy more items for her customers to choose from, like  seasoning, canned goods, detergent, sugar and soft drinks. She would like to buy a piglet, too, so she can have a hog raising business. Her income will then provide for her family's basic needs. She hopes to make a bigger store some day.

loans.use: to buy a piglet to raise and inventory for her store, such as seasoning, canned goods, detergent, sugar and soft drinks.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of a 13-year-old daughter from Talibon, Bohol. She has engaged in the farming business for more than ten years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Myrna works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for the plants and fishing nets. In the future, Myrna wants to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the plants and fishing nets

loans.name: Yury Sarela

texts.es:
Yuri tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de su tía. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Guaraguaos Bajo perteneciente al Distrito de Tambogrande. Clienta vive en la parte  rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

Yuri se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral (pavos y gallinas), las cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal las comercializa en el mercado local. Cuenta con 02 años de experiencia en este negocio. Actualmente trabaja en un fundo agrícola de mango, en donde le pagan quincenalmente. Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos.

Yuri desea que sus aves se desarrollen óptimamente para después venderlas, es por ello que ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para lograr su objetivo, con lo cual comprará alimento balanceado para sus aves.
texts.en:
Yuri is 21 years old, single and childless. She lives in her aunt’s house. The house is located in Caserío Guanraguaos Bajos, which is in the Tambogrande District. She lives in a rural part of this district but she has electricity.
Yuri raises turkeys and chickens. When they reach a good weight and size she sells them in the local market. She has been doing this for the past two years. She also works for a mango farm and they pay her every fifteen days. With her earnings she pays for her expenses. 
Yuri would like her birds to develop well so that she can sell them. This is why she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 new soles, in order to reach her objective. With this loan she will buy balanced food for her birds.

loans.use: to buy balanced food for her animals.

loans.name: Uzziah

texts.en: Uzziah used the previous loan to buy coffee to resell. He is a 39-year-old married man and is a father to six children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a coffee trader and has been in the coffee business for eleven years. His major hardship is inadequate capital. He says sometimes there is a lot of coffee available to buy and high demand, but capital is the limiting factor. His personal goals are educating his children and buying a car, while his business goal is to buy more land, for growing coffee. Uzziah is requesting the loan to buy coffee to resell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to resell.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience runs a shop in Buchanan where she sells lots of items like alcoholic drinks (beer, Big Apple, etc.), soft drinks, candles, batteries, and more. She started this business with help from her sister, and learned the trade from her mother. Presently the problem she faced with is less income. 

Patience is requesting a loan to buy more goods to sell in her shop. She enjoys her business because it improves the her life and the lives of her children.  She is a high school graduate, 32 years old, and married with two children, ages five and ten. Both of her children are in school and live at home. Her dreams are to expand her business even more, continue to send her children to school and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger is 34 years old and lives in Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with three children ages one, three and six. Roger uses his motorcycle to earn an income for his family. He transports passengers with his 'habal-habal' (a motorcycle used to transport passengers in remote places). Roger has been in this business for eight years now. He also farms rice for additional income. He is asking for a loan to pay for gasoline and the vulcate fee for his tires, as well as to buy fertilizer and rice. In the future, he is determined to send his children to school so they can have a better future.

loans.use: to pay for gasoline and vulcate fee, and to buy fertilizer and rice.

loans.name: Shaelish

texts.en:
Shaelish is 41 years old, married, and supports a family of four dependents. She has been running a retail shop for the past six years, earning a monthly income of 45,000 KES.

She is applying for her first loan, in the amount of 20,000 KES. She plans to employ a person to assist her in the business, because the demand of her customers is very high.

She plans to use her anticipated profits to restock the store.  Her dream for the future is to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to employ an additional person to staff her store.

loans.name: Valle Bonito Group

texts.es:
Valle Bonito así se llama este grupo, el cual se integra de seis mujeres y un hombre, le pusieron este nombre ya que es para identificar el grupo.

La señora María de los Ángeles, nació  en la ribera llano grande, tiene la edad de 50 años, estudio hasta el sexto de primaria, ya que decidió trabajar para apoyar a su padres con los ingresos de la casa, así conoció a don Óscar con quien se caso  y procreo tres hijos quienes dos ya están casados y uno aún está  a su responsabilidad.
 
Ella es ama de casa y esta trabajando el préstamo en la compra y venta de de pollos de granja, para luego venderlo  en pie y destazado, lleva dos años con éste negocio y le va bien, ya que sus ingresos son mejores y así  de las ganancias  que obtiene compra mas pollos para que sus clientes tenga una mejor atención.

Se inspiro en esta actividad   para apoyase y tener de donde sacar ingresos y con ello apoyar a su  esposo quien trabaja en el campo, sembrando maíz y frijol.
 
Lo que más desea de su negocio es poder seguir trabajando e ir agrandando su negocio.
 
Quienes integran el grupo son: las señoras  Rosaría quien invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para panes, la señora Fulmer invertirá en la compra y venta e ganados, doña Dalia invertirá en la compra y venta de quesos, la señora  Blanca Iriani  en la compra de y venta de pollos, don Cleider invertirá en la compra de ganado y la señora Maribel en la elaboración de quesos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Beautiful Valley”. It is made up of six women and one man. They gave the group this name in order to identify it.
Mrs. Maria of the Angels was born on the edge of a large plain. She is fifty years old. She has completed the sixth grade. She decided to work in order to help her parents with household expenses. She met and married Mr. Óscar. They have three children. Two are married and one is still dependent on them. María is a housewife and is also working buying and selling chickens. She sells the chickens door to door. She has been doing this business for two years and it is going well.
