Her earnings are getting better and with them she buys more chickens so that her customers needs are met. 
She decided to do this activity in order to support herself and have some spending money. With this business she can help her husband who works in the fields growing corn and beans. She wants to continue working and growing her business. 
The members of the group include Mrs. Rosaría who would like to buy ingredients to make bread, Mrs. Fulmer who buys and sells cattle, Mrs. Dalia who buys and sells cheese, Blanca Iriani who buys and sells chickens, Mr. Cleider who buys cattle and Mrs. Maribel who makes cheese.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of farm chickens.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 31 years old with three children and lives in Masindi-Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family rests solely on her. Her dream is to see her children graduate with degrees. 

She sells clothes as her source of income and also has rental house with four tenants. Her business booms during festive seasons such as Christmas, graduation and Easter. With the profits earned she has been able to pay school fees and maintain the rental houses. Her business desire is to own a housing estate and to modernize her clothing boutique. Stella is requesting this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old, married, and blessed with one child whom he supports. He has been operating a retail shop for the past six years, getting a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

He has applied for a loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD, with which he plans to pay for the cost of transporting stock that he purchased, to his shop.

The anticipated profits will be plowed back into the business, for future expansion. His dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of transporting the purchased stock to his shop

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Progreso" está integrado por 12 mujeres cada una de ellas tiene una actividad económica diferente la cual desarrollan con la intención de brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida, ellas son: Laura venta de lencería, Dulce María venta de ropa, Rita venta de carne de cerdo, Susana venta de mole, Martina venta de tamales, Ruperta servicio de molino de maíz y venta de masa, Virginia venta de tamales, Isabel venta de cosméticos y calzado, Araceli venta de antojitos, Lizbeth lencería y cosméticos, Marlu venta de calzado, Sindy venta de dulces 

La señora Susana tiene la edad de 45 años, estudio la secundaria, esta casada con el señor Alberto que trabaja de operador, ellos tienen 2 hijos. Ella nos dice que desde hace 7 años inicio con su negocio de venta de pasta de mole porque quiere apoyar a su esposo con los gasto del hogar y dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, también nos comenta que decidió iniciar con su negocio porque la situación económica es muy dura y "no hay dinero que alcance". Doña Susana realiza sus ventas de pasta de mole el cual le enseño a elaborar su madre y cometa que le sale muy rico, es por eso que ella decidió empezar a venderlo. Doña susana se levanta muy temprano para elaborar su mole y sale a ofrecer casa por casa con sus amigas o vecinas. Además, comenta que en ocasiones sus clientas ya llegan a buscar el mole a su casa, lo cual la llena de orgullo pues sabe que les gusta su mole y a ella le dan mas ganas de seguir trabajando y se siente muy orgullosa. Ella necesita este crédito para la compra de variedad de chiles, chocolate, cacahuate, plátanos, tortillas, pan, aceite, manteca, ajonjolí, ingredientes necesarios para preparar la pasta. Doña Susana espera que con esta inversión su negocio prospere y pueda ofrecerle a sus hijos un mejor patrimonio.
texts.en:
There are twelve women in the group called “Progress”. Each one has a different job. They are all working in order to provide their families with a better quality of life. These women are: Laura who sells milk, Sweet Maria who sells clothes, Rita who sells pork, Susana who sells mole sauce, Martina who sells tamales, Ruperta who grinds corn and sells cornmeal, Virginia who sells tamales, Isabel who sells cosmetics and shoes, Marlu who sells shoes and Sindy who sells sweets. 
Susana is 45 years old. She has studied in secondary school. She is married to Alberto, who works as a driver and they have two children. For the past seven years she has been selling mole sauce. She wanted to help her husband with their household expenses and provide a better quality of life for her children. She also decided to begin this business as their economic situation was very difficult and their wasn’t enough money to get ahead. Mrs. Susana’s mother taught her how to make mole sauce. It is delicious and she decided to start a business selling it. Mrs. Susana gets up very early in order to make her mole and she sells it door to door to her friends and neighbors. Sometimes her customers come to her house to buy her sauce. This gives her a lot of pride as it tells her they like her mole. This gives her more energy to continue working and she feels proud. She needs this loan in order to buy a variety of chilies, chocolate, peanuts, plantains, tortillas, bread, oil, fat and sesame seeds. These are all the ingredients she needs to prepare her mole sauce. Mrs. Susana hopes that with this credit her business will proper and that she can offer her children a better life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of chilies, chocolate, peanuts, plantains, tortillas, bread, oil, fat and sesame seeds for her mole sauce.

loans.name: Jesman

texts.en:
Jesman is a 38-year-old man who is married to Aryance, a 49-year-old lady. They are blessed with four children: 
•	Ade Irma, who is 16 years old and in the 2nd grade of Senior High school
•	Moldi, who is 13 years old and in the 6th grade of elementary school
•	Aldo, who is 10 years old and attending the 4th grade of elementary school and
•	Rivaldo, who is 6 years old and attending the 1st grade of elementary school.

As his homeland provides him available resources to produce palm tree sugar, Jesman became interested in running this type of business when he was teenager. Besides producing sugar, Jesman also buys it from another distributor and then resells it on another island.  Unfortunately, Jesman could not continue the business as he had very limited capital to support its operation. Therefore he has requested a loan from TLM for IDR 6,500,000 to buy liquid palm sugar and to expand his business by buying young cattle to be fattened.  He is optimistic that the business would have a favorable effect on his family.

loans.use: to buy liquid palm sugar and to expand his business by buying young cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla is a 33-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a fishing business since her husband is a fisherman. Perla works hard to help her husband meet the needs of the family – especially the schooling of her children. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials such as nets, lead weights, hooks and others. Perla hopes to make her business a success and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as nets, lead weights, hooks and others

loans.name: Licel

texts.en:
Licel is a 29-year-old from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married to a farmer and helps her husband by selling home-cooked snacks like rice cake and popsicles in her community. She also assists her husband with rice farming.

Licel is asking for a loan to buy additional supplies like sugar, milk and plastic cellophane. She hopes for this loan to help their businesses and family and provide for her five children, ages 1-10.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk and plastic cellophane

loans.name: María Vilma

texts.es:
María Vilma tiene 33 años de edad, tiene 02 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo. Su vivienda se encuentra situada en la zona rural del distrito de Illimo. La zona cuenta con servicios de luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200 familias.

La actividad que desarrolla es la crianza y venta de animales, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio desde hace 4 años. Su cónyuge se dedica al comercio de granos, verduras y a la agricultura por lo cual su familia también percibe ingresos adicionales para sostenerse económicamente.

María Vilma ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de animales y alimentos para estos puedan alcanzar un óptimo desarrollo y sean vendidos a buen precio, ya que se acerca la campaña navideña y durante esta temporada las ventas se incrementan.

María Vilma es una mujer emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Ella agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyen con este préstamo.
texts.en:
Marîa Vilma is 33 years old and has two dependent children. She lives in her own house with her husband. Her house is located in a rural zone in the Illimo District. The area has electricity and is a small community of about 200 families.
She has been buying and selling animals for the past four years. Her husband sells grain, vegetables and also farms so that the family has additional income for their sustenance. 
Marîa Vilma is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 200 new soles, which she will use to buy animals and the food they need to reach their optimum weight and sell for a good price. It is close to the Christmas season and during this time her sales increase.
Marîa Vilma is an enterprising woman and really wants to succeed. She is thankful for the helping hand of the people that support this loan.

loans.use: to buy animals and food for her animals so that they can reach their optimum weight and sell for a good price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new products to resell, e.g. sugar, coffee, rice, flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Un Nuevo Resplandor Group

texts.es: Arnulfa es una mujer alegre, entusiasta y trabajadora tiene 38 años y es casada con Federico el cual es jornalero y tienen dos hijos uno estudiante de prepa y el otro estudiante de secundaria. Ella pertece a un grupo de crédito en su comunidad llamado Un Nuevo Resplandor, dice que le dieron ese nombre al grupo porque el crédito para ellas es como una ayuda muy importante dice ella “gracias a Visión Fund mi negocio y el de mis compañeras han mejorado ya que tenemos el capital para invertir y ponernos a trabajar para poder sacar una parte para el pago de préstamo y la otra parte para mejorar las condiciones de nuestras familias agradezco a la financiera a nombre de mis compañeras y mío  por ayudarnos”. Platica Arnulfa que se dedica a la elaboración de prendas bordadas desde hace 12 años y que ella empezó haciendo servilletas para ella pero después la gente de su localidad veían lo bonitas que las hacía y lo bien bordadas que estaban y le empezaron hacer encargos y decidió empezar a vender en su localidad y después en diferentes tianguis de las localidades aledañas a su población, también ella se dedica a la cría de guajolotes y borregos. Dice que está pidiendo a Visión Fund un préstamo para comprar material como marquice (tela), aros, agujas, listones, estambre, hilos, ganchos y estambre grueso para hacer unas bufandas, gorras,  tejidas ya que se viene la temporada de invierno y es cuando más vende ese tipo de prendas, dice que desde hace un año hizo las prendas invernales y que le fue muy bien en las ventas ya que hacia los juegos de bufanda, gorro y guantes y le fue bien, dice que sus materiales los compra de diferentes tiendas de una población cercana a la de ella. Las otras cuatro integrantes del grupo se llaman Feliciana, María Marcela y Pascacia ellas invertirán en sus negocios de cultivo de venta de magueyes para aguamiel, material para bordados artesanales, compra de alimentos para cría de borregos y después venderlos.
texts.en:
Amulfa is a happy, enthusiastic and hardworking woman who is 38 years old.  She is married to Federico, who is a day laborer, and they have 2 children.  One of their children is in high school and the other attends middle school.  Amulfa belongs to the communal bank named "Un Nuevo Resplandor" (A New Radiance).  She says that they gave the group this name because the loans have really helped them out a lot.  She says "thanks to the Vision Fund, my business and the businesses of my fellow group members have improved because we have capital to invest and put to work.  This way we can pay off the loan and also improve conditions for our families.  I thank the lender in the name of my companions and myself for helping us."  

Amulfa says that she has been making embroidered garments for 12 years.  She started out making napkins, but later the people in her town were seeing the pretty things she was making, and how well-embroidered they were, and they started making orders with her.  She decided to start to sell in her town, and then later she was selling in the markets in the communities surrounding her town.  In addition, she raises turkeys and sheep.  

Amulfa says that she is requesting a loan from Vision Fund to  buy material such as marquesa fabric, embroidery hoops, needles, ribbons, yarn, thread, hooks and thick yarn to make scarves, hats, and other knitted items for the winter season.  This is when she sells the most of these types of garments.  She says that a year ago, she made winter garments and the sales were very good, especially the sets of scarves, hats and gloves.  She says that she buys her raw materials in different stores in a nearby town.  

The other members of this group are named Feliciana, Maria Marcela, and Pascacia.  They will invest in their businesses cultivating maguey catci to extract "aguamiel" (a beverage), buying supplies to make embroidered handicrafts, and buying animal feed so that they can raise sheep to sell.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as marquesa fabric

loans.name: Renilda

texts.en:
Renilda is a 42-year-old woman and has run a sari-sari (convenience) store for more than 17 years. She sells various goods to the people in their place, called Talibon, Bohol.

Renilda is asking for a loan to buy more stock to resell, such as canned goods, soda, biscuits and snack foods, soap and shampoo. Renilda believes that this loan will allow her to buy more stock and attract more buyers and customers.

Renilda dreams of making her business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, soda, biscuits and snack foods, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Ricardo Julian

texts.es:
Ricardo es tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la distrito de Santiago, caracterizado por el desarrollo de la agricultura ya que podemos encontrar muchas empresas agroexportadoras, las cuales brindan muchos empleos a los pobladores del distrito, Ricardo es un hombre muy trabajador, desde muy pequeño aprendió lo que es trabajar ya que sus padres eran muy humildes y tuvo la necesidad de apoyarlos, por ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto de secundaria, aunque le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera de Contabilidad. Ricardo es padre de 2 hijos, los cuales tiene 17 y 8 años y por quienes trabaja muy duro para poder brindarles una buena calidad de vida.

Día a día Ricardo trabaja vendiendo agua en su distrito así como también en los caseríos cercanos a su distrito, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes al día; el  cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque trabaja con muchas ganas.

Ricardo esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le ha brindado el podrá comprar un toldo para su vehículo, así como también llantas nuevas, lo que le permitirá tener un vehículo en buenas condiciones y seguir trabajando para poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 41 years old. He lives in the Santiago District which is known for its farming and also for its agricultural export businesses. These bring a lot of jobs to the people in the area.
Ricardo is a hardworking man. Ever since he was a child he has worked. His parents were very poor and had to support the family. This is why he was only able to study until secondary school. He would have liked to study accounting. Ricardo is the father of two children, age 17 and 8. He is working very hard to bring them a better quality of life. 
Every day Ricardo sells water in his district and also to the houses in the surrounding districts. He works about ten hours a day and serves about twenty customers a day. He thinks his business is going well because he is friendly to his customers and he works with a lot of enthusiasm.
Ricardo is thankful for the loans from KIVA. Thanks to the help they have given him, he was able to keep his vehicle in working order and to continue struggling to reach his greatest dream, “to give his children a good education”.

loans.use: to buy a sunshade and new tires.

loans.name: Freddy Edgar

texts.es:
Freddy es un hombre muy trabajador, el vive al lado de su esposa con la cual tiene 2 pequeños de 4 y 1 año de edad, a quienes ama mucho y los cuales son su mayor motivación para seguir adelante. La vivienda de Freddy se encuentra en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura y sobre todo sus pobladores son personas muy alegres. En su tiempo libre a Freddy le gusta mucho jugar futbol y sobre todo le encanta disfrutar al lado de su familia uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”.

Día a día Freddy trabaja como chofer en una empresa de transporte de su ciudad, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y porque quiere darle lo mejor a su familia.

Freddy esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para la reparación de su techo como esteras ya que actualmente es de plástico, de esta manera el podrá tener una vivienda mas segura y seguirá trabajando con mucho esfuerzo para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” construir su casa de material noble y darle uan buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Freddy is a hardworking man who lives with his wife and their two young children, ages 4 and 1, who he loves very much. They are his biggest motivation to get ahead. Freddy lives in the city of Ica, which is known for its very warm climate and for its friendly residents. Ica is an agricultural city and the people are very happy there. In his free time, Freddy likes to play soccer and, above all else, he loves to sit down with his family to one of this favorite dishes, the delicious “Arroz con Pollo” (chicken with rice).

Each day, Freddy works as a driver for a transportation company in his city. He works about 9 hours a day. Freddy believes that his work has gone well for him because he is responsible and because he wants to give the best he can to his family. 

Freddy is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to this help they have offered, he will be able to buy materials to repair his roof, as right now it is made out of plastic. This way, he be able to have a safer house and continue to work hard to realize his biggest dream: "to build a house of good materials and give his children a good education."

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en una de las zonas urbano marginales que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande. La zona es un distrito predominantemente agrícola y comercial.

La actividad que desarrolla es la de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi, la cual es propia , trabajándola de día y de noche, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace mas de 3 años. Adicionalmente ayuda a su padre con el mantenimiento de su parcela agrícola en donde cosecha limón y mango. 
 
Debido al continuo uso y al mal estado de los caminos en la zona, su unidad móvil ha empezado a sufrir algunos desperfectos que requieren de urgente reparación, es por ello que el ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan brindar mantenimiento y reparación a su unidad, comprará llantas, cambiará el aceite del motor, renovará accesorios, entre otras cosas. 

Alexander es un joven bastante trabajador y empeñoso, en la zona es bastante conocido y estimado, el agradece de antemano a las personas que le ayuden con este préstamo.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 28 years old, single and childless. He lives in his parent’s home, which is located on the edge of an urban center in the agricultural district of Tambogrande. This district is predominantly agricultural and commercial.
He works transporting cargo and passengers in a motortaxi, which he owns. He works day and night. He has been doing this for the past three years. Also he helps his parents with their agricultural land where they grow lemons and mangos. 
Because of continued use and the bad state of the roads, his vehicle has suffered some damage that needs to be repaired immediately. This is why he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 new soles. This loan will help him repair and maintain his vehicle, buy tires, change the oil, update the accessories among other things. 
Alexander is a hardworking and enterprising young man who lives in a well-known and good area. He is thankful for the helping hand of the people that have helped with this loan.

loans.use: to maintain and repair his vehicle. He will buy tires, change the oil, replace the accessories among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to spend the loan on more goods for his kiosk such as snacks, sugar, coffee, instant noodles, milk, wheat flour and shampoo; and also to buy two Playstation gadgets for his rental business.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lilian used her previous loan to buy fertilizer and potato seeds for farming and it has been profitable.

This is her second loan and she plans to use it to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer. This will enable her to harvest more potatoes, maize and beans. This will help her increase her income, which she will use to expand her farming business.

She hopes to expand her dairy farming business by buying another dairy cow so that she can increase her income and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer

loans.name: Albertha

texts.en: Albertha, 28, lives in Buchanan with her husband and three children, ages  6 to 13, who attend school.  Albertha attended school up to 10th grade. She has been involved in used clothing sales for the past 18 years. She sells ladies blouses and ladies skirts in the general market. She learned to sell from her mother and makes a profit when she sells. With the profits, she buys more goods and repays her loan. She is requesting this loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. Her plan is to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.en:
Silverio is a 55-year-old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He has been in business for more than a year now and it is his only source of income.
Silverio is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights and hooks. He believes that this loan could help him realize his dream of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights and hooks.

loans.name: Yamrid

texts.en: Yamrid, 39, and his wife Wilhelmina, 34, have been blessed with two children from their marriage. Yamrid and his family live in a very remote area with a rocky road and very limited access to public transportation. Yamrid uses this opportunity to earn money as a motor taxi driver. Every day, Yamrid hauls passengers and also agricultural products to be sold in the city. Recently, Yamrid had an idea to buy all these products from his passengers and resell them in the market. It can help the passengers to reduce their transportation cost while helping him earn more income. To get the loan assistance, Yamrid went to TLM and requested a loan of IDR. 5,000,000. He would like to spend that loan on bananas, corn, vegetables, potatoes, peanuts etc. Yamrid believes that the business would be better improved and brings good advantages for his family.

loans.use: to buy bananas, corn, vegetables, potatoes, peanuts, etc.

loans.name: Diaraye

texts.en: Diaraye is 45 years old and lives in Compound #3. She is married with two children ages 18 and 20. They live at home and are in school. Diaraye is hard at work in her provision shop where she sells many items like toothpaste, soap, batteries, milk, rice, oil, etc. She has requested a 100,000 LRD loan to buy more inventory for her shop. She has been running this business since 2009. She enjoys the flow of customers and her daily sales. One problem she is facing is that orders for goods are delayed because of the bad road condition.  She plans to open another shop and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more inventory (soap, batteries, milk, rice, oil, toothpaste, etc) for her shop.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He works as a lumberer, cutting trees for wood. The business has been in operation for six years. He is single. He joined Milango two years ago to access credit for business expansion. 
He is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy a lumbering machine. Besides this business, Allan also runs a wood workshop. The main challenges to both businesses are high transportation costs and some clients not paying on time. 
Allan’s future aspiration is to open a hardware store and believes that he can run the businesses fairly and buy a transportation machine from the additional income obtained from this loan.

loans.use: to buy a lumbering machine.

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en:
Melitona is 58 years old and is from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and her husband works as a welder. Her two children are grown, but she continues to work as a food vendor for an income. She usually sells deep-fried bananas in caramelized sugar in her town. She also raises cattle. 

Melitona is asking for a loan to buy banana, brown sugar and cooking oil and plans to cook more to resell. She hopes to improve her business profits and  work hard so she can continue to pay for a nutritious diet and to save for future use.

loans.use: to buy banana, brown sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana is a 60-year-old married woman who has been engaged in a fish-vending business for more than 10 years now.

Valeriana is asking for a loan to buy more fish and other seafood to sell to the people in her community.

Valeriana has hopes of improving her business and experiencing the fullness of life.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other seafood.

loans.name: Ambo

texts.en:
Ambo, 29, is married to Mira, 25. They have two children: Nissa, 6, in primary school grade 2, and Iqbal, who is 10 months old. Ambo was taught by his mother to be independent. With capital from his parent, Ambo started his kiosk business. His business is located in a strategic place, near to a terminal where many people pass by. 

The challenge for Ambo in running the business is the capacity to renew and add more the business stock to meet the demand of his customers. He is only able to renew the stocks once a week in order to save the transport cost.

Ambo has a plan to sell kerosene as demanded by his customers. To do so, he requested loan of 12,500,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiah) from TLM. He hopes that the loan would help him in improving the business.

loans.use: to sell kerosene as demanded by his customers.

loans.name: Orance

texts.en:
Orance is a 34-year-old lady and is married to Hendrik, a 36-year-old man. From their marriage, they are blessed with three children: Irene, 9, in primary school grade 4; Melani, 7, in primary school grade 1; and Yesyurun, 2.

Orance is a seamstress. She has been a seamstress for five years. Her business grows well as she is the only seamstress in her village. She sews the clothes based on the order of her customers.

At the moment, Orance received many orders from the customers while she only has one machine and she also works by herself. Orance plans to buy one more sewing machine and to employ an assistant to help her run the business. To do so, she requested a loan amounting to IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. She hopes to be able to implement her plan.

loans.use: to buy one more sewing machine.

loans.name: Orpa.

texts.en:
Orpa, 41, is married to Marsianus, 43. They have four children: Desi, 22, is studying in a local university; Yani, 17, in the second grade of senior high school, Arni, 12, in the first grade of junior high school; and Delfi, 9, in the third grade of primary school.

Orpa’s husband is a farmer who cultivates their small farm. To support her husband in meeting their family needs, Orpa works as an agricultural products seller. She purchases the products, i.e. coconut, vegetables and fruits, from the local farmers and resells them at the markets in the city.

Orpa would like to buy more products to sell and therefore requested a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. She hopes to have improvement in her business.

loans.use: to buy more products, i.e. coconut, banana, vegetables and fruits to resell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, 50, lives with her life partner and their 28-year old son, who is currently in college. She sells vegetables and cereals. She has been in business for the past two years; thanks to the good results she has gotten.

The loan she is requesting from the Yehu is to buy more cereals to keep her store well-stocked. This way, she will have enough cereals available to offer her customers and to get better income.

Her dream is to see her son graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy more cereals.

loans.name: Lukas

texts.en:
Lukas is a 53-year-old farmer and is married to Nyai, 47 years old. They are blessed with five children:

• Netti, 24, working as a teacher • Dian, 20, graduated from senior high school • Enny, 15, is in the firstgrade of senior high school • Ayu, 11, is in the sixth grade of elementary school • Poppy, 8, is in the third grade of elementary school

Lukas was born from a farmer family; he has been working as a farmer since he was young. He has a plot of land at the back of his house that he uses to cultivate vegetables, tomatoes and beans. From the harvest, he is able to generate income by selling them at local market once a week. In addition to selling harvest, Lukas also has cattle to be fattened for three to four months before selling them to the buyer. These businesses enable him to pay for his children's education fees.

Lukas would like to expand his business by purchasing one more cattle but unfortunately he does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 5.000.0000. Lukas is expecting that TLM will assist him in improving his business.

loans.use: to buy one more cattle to fatten.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everyone has the desire to better themselves and move forward at some point in their lives. For this reason, this young, 37-year-old woman, who lives together with her family in their own house, has started a business that will help her to make a better future for herself. She makes a living selling fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, chilies, plantains, oranges and more. She has experience in sales which allows her to make a good profit. She also has a home-based kiosk.

Everlyne has gained many customers who prefer to buy from her for the quality, good prices, and above all, the excellent customer service. She is an active and entrepreneurial woman dedicated to her work. She is a fighter who knows that all this effort is a good way to achieve success and leave behind the life of crime. She is happy and peaceful with her business. Everlyne is asking for this loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She is responsible and will pay back her debt. At the same time, she is confident that this loan will give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is noted for his great kindness. He’s an energetic man dedicated to his work who has many goals to reach. He’s always on the lookout for new opportunities that will make it possible for him to attain success. His greatest secret is effort and love of work. He knows that he’ll reach his goal this way. Patrick has a retail shop which has been running since his previous loan cycle. He also sells charcoal; that has increased his monthly income. The previous loan was a great help to him.

Patrick wants to make new investments but he does not have enough capital to do so. This is the reason why he is asking this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma lives in Getatagh village of Syunik region with her husband and two daughters. She works at the local community hall as a secretary. Also, Jemma helps her husband with agriculture. Jemma’s elder daughter, Mariam, studies at Armenian State Pedagogical University. She is in the third course in the Faculty of Arts. Jemma’s younger daughter, Yepraksia, attends school.

The main sources of income for Jemma’s family are cattle breeding and land cultivation, but the profit she gets from the sales of agricultural products is not enough to cover Mariam’s educational costs. Thus, Jemma has applied for this loan of AMD 200000 to pay for her daughter’s tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay for her duaghter's tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 28-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be hard working. He operates a retail business where he sells plastic items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an industrial business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the business area. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy plastic items. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he can buy a car for his family.

loans.use: to buy plastic items to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Verónica is 33 years old, married and has three children who are minors and go to school. She tells us that before starting her business, she studied courses in hairdressing and manicuring. Once she finished those courses, she decided to start a beauty salon in her home. She says that with the help of her husband, she was able to get together some capital and acquire the tools for her work. Thanks to her good attention and friendliness, she was well-received. As a result, she has had a lot of clients up to now. In addition to this, she owns a barber shop where she has hired someone.

She works for her children. It is for them that she always works hard in order to give them what they need to have a dignified life without lacking anything.

Veronica is requesting this loan to buy shampoo, conditioner, creams, nail polish and other necessary supplies for her beauty salon. She hopes to be able to continue working in the salon and she knows that the only way to do this is to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioner, creams, nail polish and other necessary supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tablecloths for resale.

loans.name: Sellina

texts.en:
Sellina is 41 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has four children. She lives with her family in the town of Samburu.

She has owned and managed rental houses for more than 10 years. Sellina came up with the idea, together with her husband, to establish this business because they wanted to improve their home.

At the moment, she wants to renovate some of the rooms in one of her rental houses. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 KES to buy sand and cement.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is 50 years old and lives in the town of Samburu. For the past two years, she has been selling charcoal.  She buys her charcoal from the interior part of town.

She is seeking this loan so that she can buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.  Her underlying goal is to be able to provide her children with everything they need.

loans.use: buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Alphanso

texts.en: Alphanso is 38 years old and lives in Compound #3 with his wife and four children who are 4, 6, 10 and 16 years old. His children are attending school. He is a high school graduate. Since 2005, he has been operating a shop where he sells many items like auto parts, etc. He started this business with his father's help. One problem he faces is transporting the goods to his shop. He is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for his business. He likes the way his business keeps him busy. He plans to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for his business,

loans.name: Mwangeka

texts.en: Mwangeka is a very responsible man. He is a very hardworking man who has had his own business. His business is a store where he sells household products. Thanks to his efforts and determination, what started out as a small kiosk has grown to a bigger store. Mwangeka is asking for a new loan to buy larger quantities of products such as beverages, bread, snacks, flour, detergents, bread, cereals, and all of the products that are asked for the most by his customers. The previous loan had a great positive impact on his business and general standard of living.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of products such as beverages, bread, snacks, flour, detergents, bread, cereals,etc

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a fish monger at Fmko near Takoradi; she buys fresh fish from the market and smokes and fries it for sale. She is standing beside the oven she uses to smoke her fish. She has done this business for three years. She is married to a fisherman and has six children. Efua uses her income to assist her husband in the general up-keep of their family. Efua will use her loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke and fry for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to smoke and fry for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a single parent and lives in the Fmko near Takoradi. Ama sells cosmetics, which she has done for six years. As a single parent, she uses her income to a feed and cloth her child. Ama will use her loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell; with the new profit she wishes to open a cosmetics shop.

loans.use: purchase more costmetics to sell.

loans.name: Ewura Esi

texts.en: Ewura Esi operates a grocery shop. She sells grocery like powdered milk, coffee, powdered pepper, canned tomatoes, canned fish, and others at Fmko near Takoradi. She is married and has four children. Ewuru Esi has been in this business for three years. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy groceries like milk, powdered milk, canned tomatoes, cooking oil, canned fish, and other food items to satisfy her customers. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries like milk, powdered milk, canned tomatoes, cooking oil, canned fish, and other food items to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Mena Aba

texts.en: Mena is a food vender; she sells rice porridge, which she serves with milk and bread.  She is married and has four children. Mena has been in this business for two years now.  She uses her income to support her husband to feed, cloth, and pay her children's school fees.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice and flour to prepare porridge and bread to sell. With the new profit, Mena Aba will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice and flour to prepare porridge and bread to sell.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is a hairdresser at Fmko near Takoradi. She is single and has one child. Gifty has been a hairdresser for 15 years. She uses her income to feed, cloth, and pay her child's school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase hair creams, hair extensions, and a hair dryer for her beauty salon. She hopes to use the new profits to acquire equipment to make work easy.

loans.use: to purchase hair creams, hair extensions, and a hair dryer for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Rihannata

texts.fr:
Mme RIHANNATA est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle se porte bien. Le plus âgé a 36ans et le moins âgé a 21ans. Personne ne va à l’école et elle a 06 personnes en charge.

Mme vend du charbon de bois et aussi des céréales depuis 09ans. Elle s’approvisionne au secteur 30 à Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont partout dans le quartier.

Elle veut s’acheter 10 sacs de charbon et des céréales.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité et  aider son mari pour les dépenses familiales. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité (voyage dans les provinces pour acheter les céréales et le charbon).
texts.en:
Rihannata is married and the mother of four children. She is doing well. The eldest is 36 years old, and the youngest is 21. None are attending school. In total, she has six people to support. 

Rihannata has been selling charcoal and also cereals for ten years. She gets her supplies from 'sector 30' in Ouagadougou. Her customers are essentially from the neighbourhood. 

She wants to buy 10 sacks of charcoal and some cereals. 

With her profits, she wants to strengthen her business, and to help her husband to cover the family expenses. She has plans to grow her business (trips to the outlying areas to purchase cereals and charcoal).

loans.use: s’acheter 10 sacs de charbon et des céréales.

loans.name: Assata

texts.fr:
Madame ASSATA   est âgée de 50 ans,  mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit chez son mari dans une famille nucléaire au quartier administratif de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative au Mali).
Après son mariage, elle commença à faire le petit commerce d’habits avec les travailleurs de l’office du Niger(une entreprise d'état employant des centaines de personnels) jusqu’à l’ouverture d’une boutique de vente de pagnes wax, brodés et chaussures. Elle fait ce commerce depuis plus de 24 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation. Sa force de vente est due à son prix abordable mais surtout à son sens élevé du commerce.  
Dans  le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour satisfaire la  demande de la clientèle, elle a fait recours au crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation depuis 12 mois. Après 1er prêt individuel bien remboursé, elle est  à son 2ème cycle de prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 1 rouleau de pagnes "Hitarget"(une variété de pagne wax), elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso. 
Madame  ASSATA vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA, qui serait  utilisé pour prendre en charge les frais de fournitures,  scolaires et d’entretien des enfants. Son ambition est de   devenir grossiste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Assata is 50 years old, married and the mother of 5 children.  She lives with her husband in a nuclear family in the administrative region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali). 

After getting married, she started selling clothes to the workers of the office of Niger (a state enterprise), until opening a shop selling wax and embroidered pagnes (colourful West African cloth), and shoes. She has been in this business for over 24 years and enjoys an excellent reputation. Her high sales numbers are due to her affordable prices and, in particular, her superior business sense.

In order to increase her capital so that she can satisfy customer demand, Assata has turned to Soro Yiriwaso, with which she has had a relationship for 12 months, for a loan. She is on her second individual loan cycle, after a first individual loan which was properly repaid. She plans to use the loan to buy a roll of "Hitarget" pagnes (a type of wax pagne). She gets her supplies in Burkina Faso. 

Assata makes her sales for cash or credit to a clientèle primarily made up of women. She expects to make a monthly profit of 40 000 francs, which will be used to take care of the children's educational and maintenance costs. Her ambition is to become a wholesaler of the products she already sells.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (colourful West African cloth).

loans.name: Umurimo Isoko Y'iterambere Group

texts.fr:
Sylvain est le membre et le président du groupe Umurimo Isoko y’Iterambere. Le nom du groupe signifie «le travail la source de développements».Il a 54 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 17 an à 34 ans, dont 3 sont scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est 6ième primaire. 
Sylvain est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB et il dit que le crédit antérieur a aidé ses activités de l’agriculture de riz beaucoup et il n'a eu aucune difficulté de remboursement de son crédit. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 
Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie d’utiliser des semences sélectionner. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait construire une grande maison de stock de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit de construire une maison d’habitation, payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Sylvain is a member and president of the "Umurimo Isoko y’Iterambere" group. The name of the group means "work, the source of developments".

Sylvain is 54 years old and married with 6 children aged between 17 and 34 years old, 3 of whom go to school. He himself has 6 years of primary school education. Sylvain is a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB and he says that the last loan really helped with his rice farming activities, and that he had no problem paying it back. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers and pay the manual labourers needed to work on his rice farm.

In order to increase his rice farming business, he plans to use selected seeds. In the coming years, he would like to build a large building in which to store his rice. He plans to use his profits to build a house to live in and pay his children's education expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay the manual labourers who work on his rice farm.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a resident of the province of Mariakani in Kenya. She is a married mother of eight children. She runs a clothes-selling shop, a business that she has been operating for two years. She also sells detergents.

Kadzo learned about Milango through an employee. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is a lack of funds for expansion of her business activities.

Kadzo is applying for a loan of 10,700 KES to purchase some additional stock of clothes for sale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on her living standard. She aspires to open a larger trading stall in the future.

loans.use: To purchase some additional stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mena Nana

texts.en:
Mena Nana is a food vender. She cooks rice and vegetable stew as well as banku (a cornmeal-based staple) for sale. She serves the banku with okra and fish stew. She has operated this business for three years. Mena is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. She and her family live in Funko, near Takoradi.  

Mena Nana uses her income to help her husband pay their children’s school fees. Mena  will  use her loan to purchase bags of rice, maize, fish and other ingredients to prepare her food to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to create a place for her customers to eat.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, maize, fish and other ingredients to prepare her food to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a petty trader. She sells women's and children's dresses and underwear in Funko, near Takoradi.  She has been operating this business for the past eight years now. Elizabeth is single. She uses her income to pay her utility bills.  She needs this loan to enable her to purchase more underwear as well as women's and children's dresses to sell. With the new profits, she plans to acquire a shop for the sale of her dresses.

loans.use: to purchase more underwear as well as women's and children's dresses to sell.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a petty trader. Some of the items she trades are tomatoes, peppers, onions, salt, cassava, plantains and other food items. Sophia has been operating this business for five years now. She is married to a farmer and has three children. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  

Sophia needs this loan to purchase more tomatoes, peppers, onions, salt, cassava, plantains and other food items for sale. With the new profits she earns, Sophia will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, peppers, onions, salt, cassava, plantains and other food items for sale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine Anna lives with her husband and three children in Funko, near Takoradi. She sells firewood, which she has done for some years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their home. 

Josephine will use her loan to purchase more firewood to sell. With the new profits she earns, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Gulru

texts.ru: Гулру жительница города Душанбе. Ей 32 года. Она разведена. У нее один ребенок. Гулру предоставляет услугу, такси. Она работает таксистом. Гулру развозит пассажиров по линии маршрута №3. В этой области она три года. Гулру берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en:
Гулру жительница города Душанбе. Ей 32 года. Она разведена. У нее один ребенок. Гулру предоставляет услугу, такси. Она работает таксистом. Гулру развозит пассажиров по линии маршрута №3. В этой области она три года. Гулру берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля. 

Gulru is 32 years old and a resident of Dushanbe.  She is divorced and has one child.  Gulru provides a taxi service and she works as a driver.  She takes passengers along the line of route #3.  Gulru has been in this line of work for three years.  She would like a loan to make repairs to her car.

loans.use: to make repairs to her car.

loans.name: Mirzoyor

texts.ru: Мирзоёр проживает в районе Рудаки. Ему 48 лет. Он живет с женой. Мирзоёр работает на рынке. Он арендует торговую точку, где продает веники. В этой области Мирзоёр 7 лет. Он берет кредит для закупа веников.
texts.en: Mirzoyor is 48 years old and he lives in the Rudaki region with his wife.  He works in the market, where he rents a stall in which he sells brooms.  Mirzoyor has been in this line of work for seven years.  He is asking for a loan to purchase brooms.

loans.use: to buy brooms.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru:
Бактыгул  52 года, имеет 4 детей. После развала союза Бактыгул получила свою долю колхозной земли, Бактыгул в качестве основного дохода начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, стартовав этот бизнес с суммы 30,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 дойная корова с приплодом, 1 нетель ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 5,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгуль обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Бактыгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы накопить средства на обучение младшего сына, которому сейчас 16 лет. В дальнейшем она планирует купить дом в селе для сына. Чтобы под старость лет  спокойно смотреть за внуками.
texts.en: Baktygul is 52 years old and she has four children.  After the fall of the Soviet Union, Baktygul received her share of her collective farm and began working primarily in raising livestock and farming.  She started this business with 30,000 Som.  Thanks to her hard work, Baktygul now has one dairy cow with a calf and one heifer on her farm.  The monthly income from her business is about 5,000 Som.  In order to develop her business further, Baktygul has turned to "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 50,000 Som (KGS) to purchase livestock she can raise and sell.  She plans to use the proceeds from her loan to increase her head of livestock so she can save for the education of her younger son, who is now 16 years old.  In the future, Baktygul plans to buy a house in the village for her son, so that in her old age she can easily take care her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Mamlekat

texts.ru: Мамлекат 55 лет,вдова, мать двоих взрослых детей. После развала союза Мамлекат получила свою долю колхозной земли. Мамлекат в качестве основного дохода начала заниматься животноводством и растениеводством, стартовав этот бизнес с суммы 30,000 сом.По характеру Мамлекат очень интересный, доброжелательный и ответственный человек. Благодаря упорному труду Мамлекат, ее хозяйство в очень хорошем состоянии.По хозяйство Мамлекат помогает сын, невестка и внуки.Ежемесячная прибыль хозяйства составляет 10000-15000 сом  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мамлекат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы и бычков для откорма и дальнейшей продажи. Доходы от кредита Мамлекат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы накопить средства на улучшение жилищных условий то есть сделать ремонт. В дальнейшем она мечтает купить квартиру в городе Кара-балта.
texts.en: Mamlekat is 55 years old, widowed and the mother of two children.  After the fall of the Soviet Union, she received her share of a collective farm.  As her main source of income, Mamlekat has begun to raise livestock and grow crops, a business she started with 30,000 Som.  She is a very interesting, good-natured and responsible person.  Thanks to her hard work, Mamlekat's farm is now in very good condition.  Her son, daughter-in-law and grandchildren help her with the farm, which generates a monthly income of 10,000-15,000 Som.  To develop her business further, Mamlekat has turned to "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 100,000 Som (KGS) to buy a cow and a bull to feed and resell.  She plans to use the proceeds from the loan to further increase her head of livestock so she can begin saving money to improve her living conditions by making repairs on her farm.  In the future, she dreams of buying an apartment in the city of Kara-Balta.

loans.use: to buy one milk cow and a bull for breeding and resale.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is a hairdresser who owns a beauty salon in Agona, near Takoradi. She is married and has 2 children. Diana has been a hairdresser for 5 years.  She uses her income to support her husband, feed and clothe her children, and pay their school fees. She will use her loan to purchase hair creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer for her beauty salon. She hopes to use the profits she generates to acquire equipment to make her work easier.

loans.use: to purchase hair cream, hair extensions, and a hair dryer for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is a single parent with 1 child. She sells African-print clothes and fabric in Agona, near Takoradi. She has been in this business for 9 years. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her child. Doris will use her loan to purchase a variety of African-print clothes and fabrics to sell. With her new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of African-print clothes and fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Bob  A.

texts.en: Bob A. has been hard at work with his provision shop, where he sells many items. With this loan of 80,000 LRD, he was able to buy more stock (alcoholic drinks, milk, rice, Argo oil, toothpaste, etc.) for his shop, He has been running this business since 2004. He says that he enjoys the flow of his customers and buying supplies. One problem he is facing is that he doesn't have enough income to satisfy his customers' range of tastes. He is 47 years old and lives in Compound #3. Bob is married with three children between 9 and 25 that live at home, and he plans to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his shop.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a food vendor who sells a variety of food. She cooks rice, yam and vegetable stew, and she cooks banku and serves it with okro and fish stew. This she has done for 5 years. She is married and has 2 children. She lives together with her husband at Agona near Takoradi. Her husband is a driver.  Vivian uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

She will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, maize, fish and other ingredients for preparing her food to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to create a place for her customers to eat.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, maize, fish and other ingredients for preparing her food to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a petty trader. She sells panties, ladies' wear, children's dresses and underwear at Agona near Takoradi. She has been in this business for the past 10 years now. She is married. She uses her income to support her husband in paying the utility and accommodation bills. She needs this loan to enable her to purchase more underwear and ladies' and children's dresses to sell. With the new profit, she plans to acquire a shop for the sale of her dresses.

loans.use: to purchase more underwear and ladies' and children's dresses.

loans.name: Monhbat

texts.en:
Monhbat is 32 years old and lives with his wife and his three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Tosontsengel, in the Zavhan province of Mongolia. His wife's name is Bulgan. She is 32 years old and she is unemployed. His three children go to the secondary school. He has been working as a boots manufacturer since 2009. 

He is starting to manufacture traditional winter boots with his wife from now on. It will be a family business and they estimated their approximate profit and it will be enough to cover all family expenses. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase raw materials for his newly started business of manufacturing traditional winter boots. His goal is to expand the business in the future in order to increase his profit and save money for his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his newly started business of manufacturing traditional winter boots.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a 50-year-old resident of Bañadero, Ozamis City. She provides her child's needs from the little amount of 7,500 PHP, which she gains monthly from her own piggery business. She has had the business for 10 years as an aid to the income gained from her husband. However, since 2007 she's been a member of GDMPC, and she has now applied for a loan of 11,500 PHP at GDMPC micro-finance to buy feeding supplies. Mercy wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald, a 31-year-old, is a single entrepreneur in Gango, Ozamis City who makes money raising hogs. He started this business almost 2 years ago, and he earns 4,000 PHP a month. To improve his business, he is borrowing 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, which he joined just recently. He will use this loan to buy feed and build a better shelter for his pigs. He’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business before long.

loans.use: to buy feed and build a better shelter for his pigs.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена – из Мелитополя. Она работает торговцем на одном из крупных местных рынков. Елена продает женскую одежду уже 9 лет. У нее – собственное торговое место. 
Елена обратилась в КИВА за суммой в 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить партию женской одежды под реализацию, а именно – халаты, белье, трикотаж. Она надеется использовать полученные от реализации товара средства для того, чтобы развивать свой бизнес в дальнейшем.
texts.en: Yelena is from Melitopol. She works as a vendor at one the largest local markets. Yelena has been selling women's clothing for the past 9 years and owns her retail location. She has turned to Kiva for a loan of 5,000 hryvnia in order to purchase for resale a new batch of women's clothing, namely robes, undergarments, and hosiery. She hopes to invest her profits from these sales into further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase a shipment of women's clothing for resale

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en: Cresilda of Ozamis City has been raising pigs for more than 10 years and earns about 8,000 PHP per month. She’s 43 years old now, yet continues to hang on with her piggery livelihood to give an adequate life to her 2 children. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2007. In order to enhance her livestock before selling, she is borrowing the amount of 14,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to buy feeding supplies. Cresilda hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is a widow who has 2 children. She is 59 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City. Marciana provides nipa roof-making to earn a living, and she's been in this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns about 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

Recently, Marciana joined GDMPC. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy weaving nipa palm to make roofing materials.  In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy weaving nipa palm to make roofing materials.

loans.name: Bayarnemeh

texts.en:
Bayarnemeh is a 27-year-old widow who lives with her daughter in her own small house. Her daughter goes to secondary school. Bayarnemeh had been managing a dairy products sales business for some years earlier, and now she stopped that business. 

Because of the lack of working capital, she is now requesting 5,000,000 MNT to cover rent and inventory for her newly started clothes, bags and wallet retail business. She estimated that the turnover of clothes, wallets and bags would be quicker than dairy products and also more profitable. She wants to increase her working capital and profits in order to improve her own and her daughter's lives. She also wants to save any excess money for her daughter's education and to buy winter clothes to sell. She is a communicative and honest person.

loans.use: To cover rent and inventory for her newly started clothes, bags and wallet retail business.

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio is from San Roque, Ozamis City. He is 52 years old. He is a widower and has 5 children. To make a living, Dionesio owns & operates a business making & selling snack foods like puto (steamed rice muffins). Rodulfo has been in business for 3 years and earns about 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

This year, Dionesio joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make his products for sale. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Orgilmaa

texts.en: Orgilmaa is a 37-year-old who lives with her husband and 3 children in a ger in Mongolia's Arkhangai province. She was a herdswoman until 2005. She moved to the center of the province and started helping with her sister's business, selling livestock intestines. Orgilmaa gained lot of experience and regular customers; now, she is planning to open her own meat subsidiary products business. Her husband works at a construction company in Ulaanbaatar. Her 3 children study at secondary school. Her standard of living is normal. In the future, she wants to expand her business and open a meat wholesale business. She is requesting 900,000 MNT to buy a large amount of inventory to sell at retail prices during winter. She is a hardworking and modest person.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of inventory for her newly started business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 56-year-old married woman living in Carangan, Ozamis City. She has 3 kids who have assisted her sometimes in the feeding and caring of the animals. The small piggery she is working on at this time commenced 7 years ago. While not the only source of income, Susan earns a total of about PHP 5,000 a month. 

Susan joined GDMPC earlier in 2011 to access financial services offered by the organization. She is applying for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase feeding supplies for piglets. She wants to give the best possible nourishment to them so as not to be hesitant in naming the price when selling them. The profit to generate from this investment is planned for buying more piglets to gain more income and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies for piglets.

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.en:
For over seven years in Catadman, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Purificacion, a 54-year-old married mother of 1 child, has made a living through the operation of a retail store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns about 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1997, Purificacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo and soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo and soaps, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, who is separated, is 41 years old and lives in Carmen Annex, Osamiz City. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the motorcycle transport business as a way of generating extra income of about 5,600 PHP per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for 2 years. 

Erlinda became a member of GDMPC just recently. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP, and intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.  In the future, Erlinda wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr: Henriette est une femme de 39 ans mère de famille, qui vit dans un quartier de la capital. Elle detient une boutique dans un coin de la place où elle vend des épices et autres divers produits depuis 8 ans. Grace à son dynamisme et sa compétence dans ce domaine elle s'est faite une clientèle grandissante qu'elle aimerait continuer de satisfaire. Pour cela elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d'acheter ( du pistache, du piment, du piment, du poivre et bien d'autres ). Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettront de fluxtifer son capital, agrandir sa boutique et enfin d'améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.
texts.en: Henriette is a 29 year old mother who lives in a neighborhood in the capital city. She owns a small shop in a corner of a square where she has been selling spices and other products for the past eight years. In large part thanks to her dynamic personality and her skills in this domain, she has an increasing customer base and would like to continue to satisfy their requests. In order to do so, she is asking for a loan that will allow her to purchase pistachios, spicy peppers, normal pepper and other products to sell. This loan will allow her to increase her profits, which will allow her to expand her store and improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: purchase pistachios, hot peppers, and regular pepper

loans.name: Kernedy Ane

texts.en: Kernedy is a 35-year-old male Cameroonian and he is married. He is a shoemaker in an urban center. This loan will help him to increase his sales since he is going to buy leather and shoe-making production materials at wholesale prices. The revenue generated will increase his output and better his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Every positive person feels the desire to do her best, aspire to be successful and surpass poverty, and Jane is looking for all of this on her road to the future. She has begun with the right foot forward because she has a small charcoal store which is profitable. She has high earnings because of her sales experience. Her business is set up at home and she has attracted many customers who prefer her because of the quality and low prices, as well as her excellent service.

Jane is an enterprising woman, dedicated to her work, struggling to get ahead and very determined. She wants a more prosperous future and every day she works hard toward that goal. She is currently asking for a loan so she can buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Sayuni

texts.en: Sayuni is a 48-year-old married woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She deals veterinary medicine and her major customers are livestock farmers around the area. After finishing her course in veterinary science, she decided to be come self-employed, and with the help of her husband she was able to raise income to start the business. Her major challenges are counterfeit drugs from some companies and high cost of the drugs. This makes it hard to purchase enough to supply the vast market. Her dreams are to educate her children and increase her stock. Sayuni is requesting a loan facility to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy veterinary drugs to sell.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is from Panay, Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Emerita is married and has 5 children. To make a living, she owns & operates a transportation services business. She has been engaged in her business for 6 years and earns about 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Emerita joined GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 45 years of age, married with four children, and lives in Coast Province. Amina's economic activity is selling charcoal, an activity that she carries out in her own home and in one of the local markets. She has always been characterized as a very hard-working woman, dedicated to her business. For the last six months she has been in the business. She started her business with her own small savings and has used the loans she has received from Yehu to expand sales.

The object of the present loan is to invest working capital in purchasing more sacks of charcoal because there is a demand at present and it would allow her to take advantage of sales. 

Amina appreciates the help offered to small merchants by Kiva investors, helping to provide them with dignified work.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Timiditha

texts.en: Timiditha is a married woman from Lila, Bohol. She has seven children. The oldest child is nineteen while the youngest is four. She has engaged in fish vending for seven years. She sells fish. Her husband is a fisherman. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional fish, fishing nets, and containers for fish storage. In the future, Timiditha would like to invest in other ventures to support the family's needs and save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fish, fishing nets, and containers.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is married and a mother of 4 dependents. She is 45 years old and lives in Guba, Clarin. Leonora is a farmer. She plants and sells vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this business for 13 years and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month in this work. 

Leonora has been a member of GDMPC since 2006. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 from GDMPC to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, she hopes to purchase a hectare of land for vegetable production and to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Ny is a 39-year-old married mother of five children. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for fifteen years to better support the family. She can earn about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and manages to save about 13,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Ny’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for two cycles. She fully paid back the past loans which have helped her support her family with enough food and basic necessities. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan with VisionFund of 160,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for constructing a proper latrine, including toilet bowls, tile drainage, etc. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy materials for constructing a proper latrine.

loans.name: Lynneth

texts.en:
Lynneth is a married woman who has 1 child. Lynneth is 31 years old. She lives in Dela Paz, Clarin. She owns and operates farmland, planting & harvesting rice for sale to earn a living, and she's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns about 7,500 PHP doing this type of business. 

Recently, Lynneth joined GDMPC. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer to increase production.  In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase production.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 44-year-old lady who is married to Isaiah and a mother of five children. She does dairy farming in Kangemi and has been doing so for 16 years. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

This will be Elizabeth's third loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy another dairy cow so that she can increase milk production and be able to meet the demand of her customers. In the future she wants to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.fr: Marie Jeanne est une dame âgée de 37 ans, divorcée et mère de 05 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 10 et 20 ans, tous allant à l'école. elle a comme activité un centre d'appel téléphonique qu'elle gère depuis 05 ans dans un quartier de la ville. elle rencontre quelques problèmes de trésorerie en ce moment car elle sort d'un an de maladie. Raison pour laquelle elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des crédits de communication en grande quantité; celui lui permettra d'avoir un peu plus de bénéfice. elle pour ambition de quitter le domicile familial où elle réside avec ses enfants depuis le divorce.
texts.en: Marie Jeanne is a 37 year old woman, divorced, and a mother of 5 children who vary in age from 10 to 20 years old, all of whom attend school. She has been running a stand that serves as a call center for the past 5 years in an area of the city. She is currently facing a challenge of treasury, as she is just recovering from an illness. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase large amounts of communication credits; this will allow her to recoup more profits. In the future, she hopes to leave the family home where she has lived with her children since her divorce.

loans.use: purchase communication credits

loans.name: Phuc

texts.en:
Phuc was born in 1974. She has two children who currently attend secondary school. She and her husband sell beer and other beverages to earn a living. She earns 3,000,000 VND a month from it. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. 

She has been participating in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,066,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy more beer and other beverages to sell. 

She wants to let her children go to school until higher education.

loans.use: to buy more beer and other beverages for resale.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a man of twenty-seven years, married to Beatrice and a father of one child. He sells household items and blankets. He has been in this business for ten years now and gets a monthly income of sixteen thousand shillings.

This will be Geoffrey's first loan with KADET LTD, with which he plans to buy eight blankets for resale. In future he wants to open a shop to sell second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy blankets for resale.

loans.name: Valerio

texts.en:
Valerio is a married man from Corella, Bohol. He is into tuba (coconut wine) vending. He has been in the tuba vending business for ten years. Aside from tuba vending he is also engaged in a charcoal making business. He earns about two thousand PHP a month by doing both businesses. 

Valerio requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more firewood for charcoal making and more tuba and tungog (which is mixed with tuba in order to have a very nice color). Valerio would like to augment his business to save for the improvement of his house.

loans.use: to buy more wood, tuba (coconut wine) and tungog.

loans.name: Teofista

texts.en:
Teofista is 58 years old and married with 9 children. She lives in Dalingap, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of used clothing (ukay-ukay). She has been in this business for 11 years. Doing this type of business, she has a return in the amount of about Php 8,400 a month. 

In 2011, she joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. In the future she plans to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a woman of 41 years, married to Timothy and a mother of three children who are all in school. She sells clothes in Kiambu and has been doing so for four years now. She gets a monthly income of 15,000 shillings.

This will be Dorcas' first loan with KADET LTD; she plans to use the entire loan to buy new clothes for resale. In future she wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mung

texts.en:
