Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is named “Nueva Oportunidad” (New Opportunity) and consists of 15 entrepreneurs who engage in various trades such as selling clothing, managing a vending stall, selling tools, operating a bakery, weaving, providing services, and other activities. All of the members are from the city of Talca.

Elsa is a member of this Communal Bank group. In the photo, she is standing in the back row in the third position from right to left. She is wearing a coffee-colored blouse and has dark brown hair that is pulled back. Elsa has been selling clothes and managing a bakery for five years. She says that she works Monday through Saturday and her distribution schedule is determined by what she has available. Elsa offers her products from her house and she has many customers. The merchandise and supplies that she needs are purchased from supermarkets and shops that sell at low cost, which is financially convenient for her. She will use her loan to buy butter, flour, eggs, oil, and clothing.

One of Elsa’s goals is to continue her businesses and buy an industrial electric oven so that she can generate more income. This will help her achieve a better quality of life. Elsa lives with her two children, a 14-year-old and a 10-month-old. Her dreams for her family and for herself include owning a house so that she can provide for children’s welfare.

Elsa is very pleased and appreciative of the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her. She says that there is good communication within the organization. With regard to the training, Elsa has learned new sales strategies and accounting techniques.

Talca is in the region of Maule and is located in the central part of the country. It is the administrative, economic, and cultural center of the region and is one of the most important cities in the Chilean Central Valley. One curious reference to Talca that is used in Chile is the phrase, “Talca, Paris, and London”. Some say that the phrase was originally attributed to an Englishman who said, “Talca feels like London” because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city during winter, just like in the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy butter, flour, eggs, and oil as well as clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a farmer, aged 30 years, in Kisii County in Kenya.  She lives with her husband and their two children, who are both in school. She has been in farming for six years, producing maize, beans, and Napier grass, which she sells at the local market.

She is requesting a 52,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow, which will help her venture into the dairy business and will provide extra income for her.  This will enable her to improve her livelihood and to educate her children. Teresa aspires to have six good-quality cows in the next five years.

Unpredictable weather conditions, pests and diseases are some of the challenges she is facing in farming. Teresa is thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for its financial support.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a farmer, aged 30, in Kisii County in Kenya. He lives with his wife and two children; only one is in school. Vincent has been farming for five years, producing maize, beans, vegetables and Napier grass, which he sells locally. He also runs a barber shop as an additional source of income.

He is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy a dairy cow, which will provide him with extra income from its milk production.  This will help him improve his living standard and enable him to pay school fees for his children. Vincent aspires to have his own car that will assist him in transporting his farm produce, within the next five years.

Unavailability of a ready market, and little capital for business expansion, are his major challenges in farming. Vincent thanks Juhudi Kilimo for financing him and hopes it will continue with its good work in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 24 years old and is married with three children from 2 to 9 years old. Her business is well organized, and she sells various goods such as lotions, soap, umbrellas and plastic shoes. Grace works from 7 a.m to 8 p.m every day of the week. She has six years of experience in this business and currently employs one person to help her.
 
Grace has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company to buy various goods such as lotions, soap, umbrellas and plastic shoes for resale. With the profit from this loan, she will be able to buy food for her family and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as lotions, soap, umbrellas and plastic shoes for resale.

loans.name: Cinthia Monica

texts.es:
Cinthia tiene 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad generosa con un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Cinthia es una joven muy trabajadora, desde muy pequeña aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente ya que sus padres son personas de pocos recursos económicos y debido a ello tuvo la necesidad de trabajar para poder apoyarlos. 

Día a día Cinthia trabaja en un pequeño restaurante como mesera, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar con los gastos del hogar; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable y responsable.

Cinthia esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como arreglar su techo ya que es de esteras, con lo cual podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Cinthia is 21 years old and lives in the city of Ica, a generous city with a warm and inviting climate.  Here farming is prevalent, especially the growing of cotton, grapes, asparagus and others.  Cinthia is a very hard working young woman.  At a very young age she has learned to earn her bread by the sweat of her brow, since her parents have few financial resources and for this reason she has had to work to help them.

Day in and day out Cinthia works in a small restaurant as a waitress.  She works about 9 hours a day and with her income she can help with the household expenses.  She believes that she is doing well at her work because she is kind and responsible.

Cinthia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help that they provided her she will be able to make improvements to her home, such as fixing the the grass reed roof.  This way she will be able to provide a better quality of life to her family and continue to struggle to achieve her big dream of attending a university.

loans.use: to fix the roof.

loans.name: Zanabi

texts.en:
Zanabie is 46 years old, married with five children, and takes care of four relatives. She sells sugar cane and operates from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except weekends. Zanabie currently employs two people to help her and has five years of experience in this business.

Zanabie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more sugar cane for resale. She plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs, pay school fees for her children, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar cane for resale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a 35-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be a faithful, focused and goal-oriented woman. She operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a competitive business area and her primary customers are the local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients to prepare meals to sell. Her business goal is to run a five-star hotel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 26 years old and a dairy and pig farmer. She is married to John, who is a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with two children, aged six and three years. She has been in dairy farming as her primary business and pig rearing as her secondary business, for the past three years.  She earns a monthly income of 14,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Caroline will use the new loan to buy pig feed, fertilizer and seedlings. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children and improve the living standard of her family. Her hopes and dreams are to be a large scale dairy and pig farmer.

loans.use: To buy pig feed, fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 60 years old and married to Rosemary, a business lady. They are blessed with four grown children. He has been raising pigs for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 9,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET customer. Francis will use the loan to buy pig feed. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to own a pig farm and venture into other businesses as opportunities arise.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Mayerlin

texts.es: Mayerlin  con su anterior credikiva compró cosméticos, productos capilares y artículos que llegaron con descuentos en sus catálogos; con esta compra logró cumplir los pedidos de sus clientes y hoy está muy entusiasmada en hacer otro credikiva, con el cual comprará artículos cosméticos y bisutería en genera, porque ha tomado en su preventa muchos pedidos, para dar respuesta durante el último trimestre del año, época en la cual se aumentan sus ventas y hacen que su inversión sea  muy exitosa. Su mensaje a los finaciadorsde Kiva es el siguiente: “Estoy muy agradecida por el apoyo que le dieron a mi negocio, espero que me continúen apoyando. “
texts.en: With the previous Kiva loan, Mayerlin purchased cosmetics, hair products and items that arrive with discounts from her catalogs. This purchase allowed her to fill her customers' orders and she is now very excited to be obtaining another Kiva loan.  She will buy cosmetics, and jewelry, as she has placed many orders to be delivered in the last quarter of the year, which is the period when her sales increase and make her investment successful.  Her message to the Kiva financial backers is " I am very grateful for the support that you gave me and my business, and I hope that you will continue helping me."

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and pieces of jewelry.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 35 years old and is married with three children. She sells various goods such as soap, lotions and sugar in a general store she operates from 6 a.m until 8 p.m every day except on Sunday. Olive has 10 years of experience in this business and she currently employs one person to help her.

Olive has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods for resale. She plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs, to save money for her future and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as soap, lotions and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman. She has four children and all are attending a primary school. Mishi operates a kiosk that serves the neighborhood. She has the urge to get ahead just like any other entrepreneur. 

She has worked in this business for two years. Mishi's other source of income includes income from her husband. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mishi will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock such as cooking oil, bags of sugar, bundles of maize and wheat flour. 

Mishi aspires to be a wholesaler in the future. She hopes to have good profits and provide a decent life to her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as cooking oil, bags of sugar, bundles of maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man with 10 children ranging in age from 2 to 38 years. He describes himself as faithful. He operates a retail store where he sells plastic items such as basins, buckets, containers, etc. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. Samuel's business is located within a competitive business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy plastic items. His business goal is to improve his business within 5 years and he hopes that in the future, he will run a bigger retail shop. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy plastic items

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 32 years old, married to Jacinta and a father of two children. He buys household items like food pots, vacuum bottles and net curtains in bulk and sells retail. He has been in this business for seven years and gets a monthly income of 16,000 KES.

This will be Daniel's second loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy blankets and food pots for resale. In the future, he wants to open a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy blankets and food pots for resale

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is a married woman. She has five children who are all enrolled in school. Her husband works as a businessman. Mwanakombo operates a clothes selling business. She not only stocks clothes, but also other types of beauty products and cosmetics. She's worked in this business for eight years. Her primary customers are the general public. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Mwanakombo will use the 80,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buying more bales of clothes for sale. She joined Yehu to access capital to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Georgette

texts.en:
Georgette is 31 years old and is married. Her business is well organized, and she sells cooking oil in the market. Georgette works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. every day except on Sunday. She has five years of experience in this business and she currently employs four people to help her. 

Georgette has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company in order to buy a large quantities of cooking oil for resale. With the profit from this loan, she will be able to renovate her house and to save for her future.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Mchengwa

texts.en:
Mchengwa is a married woman. She has six children. Only one is in school, since the others are grown up. 

Mchengwa operates a meat-goat selling business. She's worked in this business for five years. Her primary customers are the butcher people. She describes her greatest business challenge to be theft of her goats and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mchengwa will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase more goats for sale and expand the business. She aspires to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for sale and expand the business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to cultivate large quantities of sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 50 years old and is married with four children aged between 18 and 30 years old. She sells secondhand clothes from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except on Sunday. She has one year in this business and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Bernadette has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more secondhand clothes for resale. She plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs, to save money for her future and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes for resale

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en: Kwekwe is a married woman and a mother of six children, all of whom are enrolled in school. She operates a vegetable stall and sells from home. She's worked in this business for two years. Thanks to her efforts, she can cater to the small household expenses and her husband is happy for her. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transport and perishability. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Kwekwe will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to her stock of vegetables. She aspires to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to add to her stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 35 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and her four children in a rural village in Tiribe, Kenya. For two years Rehema has worked selling fresh water.

Currently she has applied for a loan in the amount of 30,000 KES, which she will use to repair broken water pipes that cause leakage. She hopes that by doing so she will increase her sales and her income, which she intends to use for improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to repair broken water pipes that cause leakage.

loans.name: Bishara

texts.en: Bishara is a married mother of four children who are all enrolled in school. She operates a grocery business. She's worked in this business for two years. His primary customers are passersby. Biasha's other source of income comes from her spouse. She describes her greatest business challenge to be the  transportation of her goods from the market and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to add to her stock by buying more oranges, vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy more oranges, vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.name: Belkis De Los Angeles

texts.es: La joven Belkis de 21 años de edad, actualmente no está trabajando, es estudiante de licenciatura en mercadotecnia, sus padres le ayudan con los gastos universitario, ahora que ya se acerca el final de su carrera que es su gran sueño, ella solicita apoyo de financiamiento para poder pagar el curso de titulación, para obtener un buen empleo y retribuir a sus padres el sacrificio que han hecho en sacarla adelante con una profesión.
texts.en: Belkis is 21 years old. Thought not currently working, she is completing an undergraduate degree in marketing and her parents help her with the cost of tuition. Now that she is nearing the end of her studies, which is a big dream of hers, she is seeking a loan to pay for her licensing so that she can secure gainful employment and repay her parents for the sacrifice that they have made in pushing her ahead on the path to this profession.

loans.use: to pay for her licensing coursework.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 32 years old, married to Joseph and blessed with five children who are all in school.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. She operates her pig-raising business in Kiambu town. She has been in this business for the last three years and her monthly income is KES 26,000.

Susan wants to use the money to purchase pig feed and medicine. She will use the income to buy more pigs to raise. She desires to be a prosperous business woman.

loans.use: To purchase feed and medicine for the pigs.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 34 years old and married with two children ages 3 and 11. Vestine also takes care of four relatives. She owns a welding business that she operates from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day of the week except Sunday. She currently employs one person to help her and has five years of experience in this work. 

Vestine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her welding business by buying machines and other materials for gaining more profit. She plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy her family's basic needs and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her welding business.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en: Mlongo is 49-year-old married woman and has five children; she lives with her family in a rural community of Tiribe. She started selling mats at the market seven years ago. She is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy more mats to completely stock her business. She is satisfied with the development of her sales and her clientele because the profits earned allow her and her family to subsist. She aims at opening a retail shop in future.

loans.use: to buy more mats to completely stock her business.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe lives with her family in the house she owns. She works selling makuti (palm fronds) used for thatching. In addition, she also sells coconuts. Both commodities are sold at the market. She is very driven and hardworking. She is an admirable woman because in spite of her age she keeps working. She doesn't get tired of doing her work because the most important thing in life to her is earning her daily bread with dignity, her own two hands, and the sweat of her brow so that she can provide the best for her children. She tells us that she faces many challenges since she is a widow. However, she is very determined to succeed.

Kwekwe is asking for a loan to buy more coconuts and makuti to sell. She is fully confident that she will obtain good profits that will allow her to improve her quality of life as well as her family's.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts and makuti to sell.

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en:
Erdenebayar is 30 years old and lives with his wife and 4-year-old daughter in his wooden house in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. Since 2004, he has worked as an assistant of drilling machinery in a local mining company. His daughter goes to kindergarten near his home. At the moment his wife doesn’t have a job; she looks after their daughter. In winter, his house loses its heat through the walls and he must burn more charcoal to warm the house. 
He thinks burning too much charcoal is not rational by economic and ecologic standards. Therefore, Erdenebayar is requesting a 2,800,000 MNT loan to brick up the walls of his house with brick and fiberglass insulation to prevent the heat loss. He will do this job by himself. By doing this he can create a warm atmosphere for his family by saving his money and environment.

loans.use: to insulate his house walls in order to save money and the environment

loans.name: Erdenetuul

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenetuul is 54 years old and lives with her husband and a 23-year-old son in a rented apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For the last 10 years she has been renting a supermarket. Her son is a student and will graduate in coming spring. Two years ago her husband had a stroke and as a result, half of his body was paralyzed. Erdenetuul constantly cares for her husband while managing her supermarket. Since last spring, her husband has gotten better and can walk, speak, and do things on his own due to extensive medical treatment. 

By having a chance to spend more time for her business, she is planning to increase her working capital and put all her efforts to her business to develop and to catch up with what she lost during the last 2 years. The loan Erdenetuul is taking will be used to diversify the range of goods, quantity and increase her family income. By doing this her family will be provided with a good living condition. In future she is planning to have own private house.

loans.use: To diversify the range and quantity of goods in her market

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarsaikhan is 38 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in his wooden house in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. This city was built in the1970s, leaning on the large copper deposit which is called Erdenet. Since 2000, Bayarsaikhan has been working as a blaster in a local mining company. His children are 16 and 7 and attend local schools. His wife runs a taxi business using their car. 
He bought his house in 2008 with money he earned since 2002. The global economic crisis let him a buy house because all real estate prices fell. Before the winter he is planning to thicken his house walls by brick and fiberglass insulation and to replace his wooden windows with double-glazed new ones to burn less charcoal and wood. By doing this his family will cut the usage of charcoal which has being called the primary source of air pollution. The loan Bayarsaikhan is taking will be used to complete this work in order to improve the energy-efficiency of his house.

loans.use: to brick up his house with brick and fiberglass insulation and install double-glazed windows in order to improve the energy-efficiency of his house

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is forty years old, married to James, and blessed with four children, who are all in school. Ann operates her business in Kabete in the outskirts of Nairobi. She supplies meat to hotels. She has been in this business for the past two years, and her monthly income is 20,000 KES.

This will be Ann's first loan with KADET LTD. She wants to purchase more meat and increase the amount she supplies to the hotels. She anticipates using the profits to expand her business, by looking for institutions that have invited bids from suppliers of meat.

In the future, she wants to give her children the best education, and also to expand her business and have more customers.

loans.use: To buy meat that she will supply to hotels

loans.name: Otgontuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Otgontuya is 44 years old lives with her husband and 2 children (ages 17 and 13) in an old small wooden house in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. Their house is located in a boundary area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. 
She has worked as a cleaner for 2 years and her husband works as a guard in a local private company. Her salary is $120 per month and her husband earns $200. Even though they have a low income, they live a life of full happiness. Otgontuya explains that her only wish is to provide her children with a good education. Due to their lack of money and its old age, her house is in a bad condition and requires significant repair. Her family is planning to make some changes including adding wall insulation, painting, and replacing wallpaper. The loan Otgontuya is taking will be used to make improvements in her house to improve their living condition and save the environment.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her house

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a 38-year-old married Kenyan woman. She lives with her husband and seven children. She owns a small general store where she sells all kinds of dairy and day-to-day products in addition to soft drinks and many other products. She has three years of experience in this line of operation.

Today, Mwanaisha is asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Yehu to purchase the necessary home products like flour, sugar, detergents, etc. and also rent a bigger store. In that way she will be able to diversify her items and increase her revenues and thus better her family’s way of living. One of her greatest dreams is to educate her children and see them achieve good positions.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary home products like flour, sugar, detergents, etc. and also rent a bigger store.

loans.name: Badamsambuu

texts.en: Mr. Badamsambuu is 42 years old and lives with his wife and 4 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is the one who earns income for his family because his wife doesn’t have a job--she looks after their 4-year-old child at home. His other three children are in school. Badamsambuu has worked as a truck driver in a private freight forwarding company for several years and in his spare time he runs a taxi business using his car. These days he is very busy because he is building a new house on his plot of land. The house-building process is on-going with 60% completion. Before the winter comes he is trying to complete and move in to  the house. Badamsambuu is asking for a 4,000,000 MNT loan to complete his new house. The loan he is taking will be used to install double-glazed windows, the roof and doors, to do plasterwork to the outside of the house, and to thicken the walls. This will allow his family to have a new spacious warm house with less energy loss and overcome the cold days of winter; it will bring them happiness every single day.

loans.use: to install double-glazed windows, roof and doors, to do plaster work on the outside of the house, and to thicken the house walls

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en: Mr.Altangerel is 54 years old. He lives with his 52-year-old wife and their son in his old small wooden house in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. His house is located in a boundary area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. He is a person with physical challenges and receives $250 as a disability pension from the government. His wife doesn’t have job and his son is a student who studies at a local university (in his 3rd year). Last year, his son became the best student of his university and he is very happy and proud of his son’s success. Altangerel is asking for a 1,500,000 MNT loan to pay his son’s tuition fees and to buy necessary items for his son’s education. He will repay the loan in 24 months.

loans.use: to pay his son’s tuition fees and to buy necessary items for his son’s education

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмира родилась в селе Катран, ей 46 лет, вдова.На иждивении у Эльмиры один сын ему 17 лет, который помогает ей в хозяйстве.  Эльмира проявляет себя как очень расчетливый, умный человек. Помимо этого Эльмира умеет вести свое дело хорошо.Основным источником дохода семьи является животноводство. Дополнительным источником является пенсия по инвалидности. После распада Советского Союза семья Эльмиры занялась животноводством. Животноводство в те трудные времена перестройки помогло прокормить семью.Свой бизнес она ведет в течении 20 лет. Начальный капитал бизнеса Эльмира составлял 10,000 KGS. С того времени семья старалась улучшать свои жилищные условия и увеличивать поголовье скота. На сегодняшний день ежемесячный заработок семьи составляет 10,000 -15,000 сом (KGS) и в хозяйстве имеется 3 голов корывы и 2 теленка. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Эльмира обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота по более низкой цене. В планах у Эльмиры улучшение благосостояния семьи и увеличение поголовье скота.
texts.en: Elmira was born in the Katran village.  She is 46 years old and a widow.  Elmira has one 17 year-old son, who helps her with the household.  She shows herself as a calculated and smart person.  Besides this, Elmira can run her business well.  Animal husbandry is the primary source of income for the family.  Her disability pension serves as an additional source of income.  After the breakup of the Soviet Union, Elmira's family got involved in animal husbandry.  This business helped feed the family during those difficult years of perestroika.  She has been running her business for 20 years.  Elmira's starting capital amounted to 10,000 KGS.  Since that time, the family has tried to improve its living conditions and increase livestock headcount. Today, the family's monthly income amounts to 10,000-15,000 som (KGS), and the business contains three cows and two calves.  In order to further develop her business, Elmira requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional livestock at a lower price.  Elmira's plans are to improve the family's welfare and increase livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock at a lower price

loans.name: Tserendulam

texts.en:
Tserendulam is 46 years old. She lives with her daughter and mother in a rented house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as an accountant in private company since 2011. Her daughter is 25 years old and works in a government-related organization and her mother is pensioner. Two of her children live independently. Ten years ago, she divorced her husband and she raised her 3 children by herself. Now, Tserendulam is building a new house for her family and the building process is on-going and is 70% complete. Installation of windows and roof parts and the completion of the interior and exterior remain to be completed. 
Tserendulam is asking for a 4,000,000 MNT loan to complete her house. She indicates that every material used in her house is planned and chosen under careful research to stop heat loss and limit utility expenses. Through this effort, she will use energy-saving materials such as fiberglass insulation, block, double-glazed windows, etc.

loans.use: to buy energy saving material to complete her house and stop the heat loss

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a 41-year-old Kenyan woman who lives with her husband and five children. With the cooperation of her husband, she is able to satisfy her family needs and offer them a fair way of living. 
She runs a small business selling coconuts at the market. She has been in this business for the last three years. Saumu is asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Yehu to purchase more coconuts to sell. By increasing her inventory, she will be able to increase her revenues and improve her family’s way of living.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal items such as mattocks, chains, hinges etc

loans.name: Erkeiym

texts.ru: Эркейым родилась в селе Эркин, ей 51 год, вдова, она выростила 4-х детей, старший сын уехал на заработки в РФ. 2 дочери замужем, младшая дочка работает в Оше.  Эркейым получила средне-специальное образование, проявляет себя как очень добросовестный, порядочный человек. Помимо этого Эркейым умеет организовать свое дело на высоком уровне.Основным источником дохода семьи является животноводство. После распада Советского Союза семья Эркейым занялась животноводством. Животноводство в те трудные времена перестройки помогло прокормить семью. Начальный капитал бизнеса Эркейым составлял практически 0 сом. С того времени семья старалась улучшать свои жилищные условия и увеличивать поголовье скота. На сегодняшний день ежемесячный заработок семьи составляет 10,000сом (KGS) и в хозяйстве имеется 2 голов корывы. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Эркейым обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота по более низкой цене. В планах у Эркейым улучшение благосостояния семьи, а в будущем планирует приобрести земельный участок.
texts.en: Erkeiym was born in the Erkin village.  She is 51 years old, a widow and raised four children.  Her oldest son left to work in the Russian Federation, two daughters are married, and the youngest daughter works in Osh.  Erkeiym obtained a secondary-specialized education and shows herself as a very conscientious and decent person.  Besides this, Erkeiym is able to organize her business at a high level.  Animal husbandry is the primary source of income for the family.  After the breakup of the Soviet Union, Erkeiym's family got involved in animal husbandry.  This business helped feed the family even during those difficult years of perestroika.  Erkeiym's starting capital amounted to practically 0 som.  Since that time, the family has tried to improve its living conditions and increase livestock headcount.  Today, the family's monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS), and the business contains two cows.  In order to further expand her business, Erkeiym requested a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional livestock at a lower price.  Erkeiym's plans are to improve the family's welfare and to purchase a land plot in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock at a lower price

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional clothes for his retail business

loans.name: Yarid Luz

texts.es: Yarid de 35 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad, área metropolitana de la ciudad de Barranquilla; ella es comerciante y estilista de belleza  y está casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos    de 2 y 4 años. En su negocio tiene 2 años de experiencia vendiendo productos cosméticos, perfumería y aplicando tratamientos de belleza; con esta actividad ha generado ingresos para apoyar el bienestar de su familia. Yarid pasó de ser empleada a emprender su propio negocio, una vez decidió ser independiente ofreciendo servicios de belleza  y productos derivados de este oficio, dirigido a consumidores finales. Sus ventas las realiza de contado, diariamente y también a crédito, a una clientela conformada entre amigos, vecinos y referidos por estos. Su meta mas adelante es tener instalaciones independientes y de mayor tamaño, pero su mayor desafío para cumplirla a corto plazo, es que su capital de trabajo no es suficiente  para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual ,comprará cosméticos, calzado, perfumería, productos de belleza  como tintes, esmaltes etc. Mientras todo esto ocurre Yerid se esmera trabajando con el fin de convertir sus sueños en realidad, apoyándose en primera instancia en este   financiamiento, con el que prevee tener éxito, porque ocurre en una época de mucho movimiento comercial, donde la clientela tiene dinero disponible por efecto de primas y bonificaciones laborales y a ella usualmente le va muy bien en esta temporada..
texts.en:
Yarid, 35, is married and has two young children, ages 2 and 4. She is a merchant and a beauty stylist who lives in the town of Soledad, in the metropolitan area of the city of Barranquilla. She has 2 years experience selling cosmetics and perfumes, and applying beauty treatments. With her business she has earned the income to support the well-being of her family. 

Yarid went from being employed to starting her own business once she decided to be independent, offering consumer beauty products and services. Her sales are made daily, in cash and also by credit, to a clientele made up of friends, neighbors and referrals. Her goal is to later have larger, independent facilities, but her biggest challenge in the short term is not having enough working capital to achieve it.

This is why she is requesting a loan from credikiva, with which she will buy cosmetics, shoes, perfumes, beauty products like dyes, nail polish, etc. Along the way, Yarid strives to turn her dreams into reality, relying in the first place on this financing, which she foresees as a success because it comes at a time of a lot of commercial activity. The customers have money to spend because of premiums and bonuses from work, and she usually does very well during this season.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shoes, perfumes, beauty products.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabett

texts.es: Sandra de 27 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su familia. Ella se dedica a la cosecha y venta de granos básicos, desde hace mucho tiempo. Es una mujer humilde, trabajadora y muy emprendedora. Ella habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su familia. Uno de sus sueños es que su familia pueda tener mejores condiciones de vida en el futuro ya que para ella la familia lo es todo y hace lo que este a su alcance para lograrlo. Son estas razones por las que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en  la compra de insumos básicos como: insecticida, pesticidas, semillas mejoras de maíz y frijol. Con el fin de cubrir una mayor demanda de parte de sus clientes. Es una mujer muy optimista y confía en que Dios estará de su parte para lograr su sueño.
texts.en:
Sandra is 27 years old. She and her family live in a home of their own. Sandra has been growing and selling basic grains for a long time. She is a humble, hardworking, and enterprising woman. Sandra and her family live under very modest conditions. One of her dreams is to see her family have better living conditions in the future. Her family means everything to her, so she will do whatever it takes to accomplish this goal.

For this reason, Sandra has decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral. She will invest in the purchase of basic supplies such as insecticides, pesticides, and improved corn and bean seeds. In the end, she hopes to meet the great demand from her customers. Sandra is a very optimistic woman and is confident that God will help her fulfill her dream.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, pesticides, and improved seeds (corn and beans).

loans.name: Jorge Carlos

texts.es: Jorge de 54 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad, área metropolitana de la ciudad de Barranquilla, allí se dedica ala venta de productos fritos y de comidas rápidas en general como papas rellenas, empanadas, arepas, pasteles y jugos elaborados con frutas naturales de la región. Como mango, piña, papaya, melón, maracuyá, mora, limón, naranja, mandarina, zapote níspero etc. Su negocio inició desde al año 2008 vendiendo pocas cosas entre sus vecinos, pero gradualmente aumentó su demanda de alimentos y así fue agregando todos los productos que hoy ofrece y con los cuales le ayudan al sostenimiento de su hogar. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará insumos como frutas, para elaborar papas rellenas, empanadas entre otros productos que deleitan a sus clientes,  a quienes quiere siempre servirle adecuadamente y con mucha calidad para que sigan siendo fieles.   Su meta es posicionarse en el mercado y crecer paso a paso, mediante sus grandes esfuerzos y el apoyo de sus crediKiva.
texts.en:
Jorge, fifty-four, lives in the municipality of Soledad, which belongs to the metropolitan area of the city of Barranquilla. He sells fried food and fast food in general, like stuffed potatoes, empanadas, corn cakes, pies and smoothies prepared with fruits from the region, such as mango, pineapple, papaya, melon, passion fruit, blackberry, lime, orange, tangerine, sapote and sapodilla.

He started selling few things among his neighbors in 2008. When the demand started to increase, he started to offer more products. This is how he provides a living for his family.

He is now requesting a Credikiva at Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for the first time. He will buy different supplies, like fruits and other ingredients needed for the preparation of the stuffed potatoes, the empanadas and of other products that his customers enjoy so much. He likes to provide a good, high-quality service in order to keep his customers’ loyalty. His goal is to position his business and to grow step by step, with his hard work and with the help of his Credikiva.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as fruits and other ingredients needed for preparing stuffed potatoes, empanadas, etc.

loans.name: Katerin Lizseth

texts.es:
Katerin es una joven de 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, Katerin vive al lado de sus padres a los cuales apoya mucho con el fruto de su trabajo, debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria; Katerin trabaja en un fundo de su ciudad como personal de limpieza, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día ; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo honrada.

Katerin esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su gran ayuda ella podrá realizar los tramites para matricularse en su instituto y poder realizar el pago de su ciclo de estudios, de esta manera ella podrá seguir adelante y poder luchar para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener una carrera y poder tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Katerin is a 21 year old young woman who lives in the city of Ica, which is characterized as having a very warm and welcoming climate. Katerin lives with her parents whom she helps greatly with the fruit of her labor. Due to scarce economic resources she was only able to study until the fifth grade in secondary school.

Katerin works nine hours a day on an estate in her city as part of the cleaning staff. She feels she does well on her job because she is very responsible and above all, honest.

Katerin is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to take the steps necessary to enroll in an institute and pay for a term of studies. Thus she will be able to continue getting ahead and struggling to make her dream a reality: that of having a career and owning her own house

loans.use: to pay the enrollment costs for a term of studies.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 45 years old and lives in the town of Pakwach in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school.

For the past 17 years, Robert has been working hard to manage his small business, where he sells clothes and household items. To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds would be used to buy more second-hand clothes and household items like plates for his business expansion. By increasing his inventory, Robert expects that the loan proceeds will enable him to generate greater profits. In the future, if needed, Robert hopes to be able to secure another loan.

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand his business operations by purchasing additional inventory (second-hand clothing and household items)

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 37 years old and lives in the town of Pakwach in the Arua region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

For the past three years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her small retail shop, where she rents out space to sell household items. To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds would be used to buy more household items for re-sale purposes. By increasing her inventory, Harriet expects the loan proceeds to help her generate greater profits and pay her children's education fees. In the future, Harriet hopes to be able to continue to increase inventory in her store.

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Harriet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand her business operations by purchasing additional household items

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Anecita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Anecita is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional utensils and ingredients for her food business.

Anecita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Minura

texts.ru: Минюра 33 года, не замужем. Заёмщик имеет средне специальное образование. В данный момент она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Основным источником дохода  является откорм, разведение и перепродажа скота. Дополнительным источником дохода Минюры является реализация молока и молочных продуктов с дома. По характеру Минюра очень активный и трудолюбивый человек.Нельзя не отметить и доброту Минюры, её жизненая позиция это помогать если есть возможность. Соседи отметили, что отказа Минюры они никогда не слышали. Она начала свой бизнес много лет назад с 5000 сом. Минюра благодаря её целеустремленности и спокойствию смогла пережить все трудности и достичь не малых результатов.Ежемесячный доход  составляет 10000 сом. Минюра обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) для приобретения МРС. В будущем Минюра собирается увеличить поголовье скота и улучшить условия жизни. Её цель в жизни, это создать семью, вырастить и воспитать детей. Дать детям хорошее образование в школе и в дальнейшем иметь возможность обучить их в университете. В ближащих планах у Минюры, как она поделилась, это покупка автомобиля.
texts.en: Minura is 33 years old and not married.  She has a secondary-specialized education.  At the present time, she is involved in farming and animal husbandry.  Fattening up, breeding and resale of livestock is her primary source of income.  Sales of milk and dairy products from home is Minura's additional source of income.  Minura is a very active and hardworking person.  Her kindness also has to be mentioned; her position in life is to help whenever possible.  Her neighbors noted that they have never heard a rejection from Minura.  She started her business many years ago with 5000 som.  Thanks to her sense of purpose and calmness, Minura was able to live through all of the difficulties and achieve good results.  Her monthly income amounts to 10,000 som.  Minura requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy small livestock.  In the future, Minura plans to increase livestock headcount and improve living conditions.  Her goal in life is to have a family, raise children and to provide the children with a good school education and then have an ability to educate them at a university.  Minura's immediate plan, as she shared with us, is to purchase a car.

loans.use: to buy 26 sheep for subsequent resale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 43 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school.

For the past five years, Peter has been working hard to manage his small business, where he sells clothes, shoes and utensils. To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds would be used to buy more items like clothes and shoes for the business. By increasing his inventory, Peter expects that the loan proceeds will help him generate greater profits and keep the business running smoothly. In the future, Peter hopes to be able to create a bigger business.

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand his business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., clothes and shoes)

loans.name: Donnabelle

texts.en:
Donnabelle is 42 years old and married with three children. For 11 years she has been in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Donnabelle requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed 17 times from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

Donnabelle is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 45-year-old, married woman living in Masindi, Uganda. Eleven years ago she decided to venture into farming to tap into the lucrative agricultural sector, which is the backbone of Uganda. She also sells clothes as an additional source of income. With these business operations, she has been able to buy land and to build a house.

Like most farmers, she faces business challenges such as price fluctuations and unpredictable seasonal weather changes. Nevertheless, she dreams of ensuring that her children become educated and expanding her farming activities. To that end, Harriet is requesting a loan to buy seedlings for planting and to pay workers to till the garden.

loans.use: to expand her farming operations by purchasing seedlings and paying for tilling services

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 44 years old and a widow with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cristina has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for two years. She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 58 years old and a widow with five children. For 20 years, she has been in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. 

Divina requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has previously borrowed 22 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Divina would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: David Cesar

texts.es:
David es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, David no ha podido estudiar la carrera de Administración de Empresas, pero sueño con poder hacerlo pronto, en sus ratos libre le gusta seguir trabajando y en algunas ocasiones su mamá cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para engreírlo.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, David puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable y trabajador.
David se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de prendas de vestir, tanto como polos, camisas, pantalones, blusas, entre otros; de esta manera David contará con la mercadería necesaria para abastecer mejor su negocio, con ello David espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder ampliar su negocio y en un futuro no muy lejano, espera poder tener su propio local de ventas.
texts.en:
David is a single, 22 year old man, who lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Ica. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who is eager to succeed. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and due to the need to work to help his parents, David has not been able to study business administration, however he dreams of being able to do so soon. In his spare time he enjoys continuing to work and on some occasions his mother cooks a very delicious “arroz con pollo” to spoil him.

On his own initiative and with a great deal of effort and dedication, David started a small business selling clothes for men, women and children. He starts working very early in the morning everyday and works approximately 8 hours a day. He believes he is doing well because he is very responsible and hardworking.

David is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to purchase clothing, such as polo shirts, tops, pants and blouses, among other items, so that he will have the merchandise necessary to better stock his business. Thus, he expects to be able to improve his sales and increase his income, which will help him to expand his business so that  he will be able to own his own shop in the not too distant future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as polo shirts, tops, pants, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Enkhchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhchimeg, 32, lives with her husband, three children, and mother-in-law in a 35 sq. meter, one-room apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Enkchimeg has been working as a manager in a beauty salon for two years. Her husband rents a supermarket, which he manages with his mother, and her children go to school. 

Enhchimeg is seeking a loan to improve her family's living conditions. Their apartment is small, was built in the Soviet era, and needs some repair. In particular, there is not enough room for the children. Enkhchimeg and her husband are planning to reconstruct the kitchen and make it a children's room. They also want to replace the old rusty water lines with new PVC and to replace the electric lines with safer ones to prevent fires.

loans.use: to improve her apartment to meet her family's needs.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru: Рахима 65 лет, муж Рахимы скоропостижно скончался. Рахима родила и воспитала 3 детей. Сейчас в месте с Рахимой живет один младший сын. Старший сын женат а дочка замужем. Заёмщик имеет среднее образование. После окончаний школы вышла замуж. После распада колхоза, получив свой участок земли она начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Бизнесом занимается давно, около 20 лет. Начала она свой бизнес с 60,000 KGS. В данный момент семья продолжает заниматься полеводством и животноводством, у них есть 1 корова. Дополнительным источником дохода Рахима является реализация молока с дома.Ежемесячный доход семьи составляет около 10,000 KGS. По характеру Рахима очень активный и трудолюбивый человек. После смерти мужа оставшись один на один со всеми проблемами, Рахима благодаря её целеустремленности и спокойствию смогла все пережить. Рахима обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для приобретения скота.Она планирует купить 3 голов коров. В будущем Рахима собирается увеличить поголовье скота и улучшить условия жизни. Её цель в жизни, это женить сына и воспитывать внуков.
texts.en: Rahima is 65 years old.  Her husband suddenly passed away.  Rahima gave birth to and raised three children.  Currently, her youngest son lives with Rahima.  Her oldest son is married and so is her daughter.  Rahima has a secondary education.  She got married after finishing school.  After the breakup of a collective farm, she got her plot of land and got involved in farming and animal husbandry.  She has been involved in business for a long time - about 20 years.  She started her business with 60,000 KGS.  Currently, the family continues to be involved in farming and animal husbandry and have one cow.  Selling milk from home is Rahima's secondary source of income.  The family's monthly income amounts to about 10,000 KGS.  Rahima is a very active and hardworking person.  Following her husband's death and being left alone with all problems, Rahima was able to live through it all, thanks to her sense of purpose and calmness.  Rahima requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  She plans to buy three cows.  In the future, Rahima plans to increase livestock headcount and improve living conditions.  Her goal in life is to marry off her son and raise grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Ziynat

texts.ru:
Зийнат 62 года, замужем.Они с мужем на пенсии, вдвоем  воспитали 5  детей. Двое детей живут вместе с Зийнат и активно помогают ей в хозяйстве.Вместе с супругом занимаются животновдством более 40 лет.По своему характеру Зийнат показала себя как очень целеустремленный и спокойный человек. Они начали свой бизнес с 2,500 сом, в 1970 году. У заемщицы имеется 20 голов овец. Ежемесячный доход Зийнат составляет 10,000 сом. Её Тверная уверенность в завтрешнем дне и очень оптимистичный характер позволяет расширить бизнес и ставить для себя новые вершины для преодоления.
Зийнат обратилась в «Бай Тушум и партнеры», ей необходимо  100,000 сом, на взятые деньги он хочет увеличить поголовье мелкоого скота. В планах Зийнат развить свой бизнес, увеличить поголовье скота и улучшить условия жизни. В ближащее время она планирует женить своего младшего сына.
texts.en:
Ziynat is 62 years old and is married.  She and her husband are retired and raised 5 children.  Two children live with Ziynat and actively help her on the farm.  She has been raising livestock with her spouse for more then 40 years.  Ziynat is a goal oriented and calm person.  They started their business with 2,500 som in 1970.  The borrower has 20 sheep.  Ziynat's monthly income is 10,000 som.  Her firm confidence in tomorrow and her very optimistic character allows her to expand her business and put up new peaks for herself to overcome.

Ziynat turned to Bai Tushum and Partners, she needs 100,000 som; she would like to use the borrowed money to increase her livestock headcount.  Ziynat's plans include expanding her business, increasing her livestock headcount and improving her living conditions.  In the near future she plans to have her youngest son get married.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for breeding and resale

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen was born in 1942. She has three children who have gotten married. Her husband sells beverages for a living. Sen has a grocery store to earn a living. She has done her job for 2 years. Her income is about 2,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 4,000,000 VND per month. 
	
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to sell noodles, candies and biscuits in her grocery store. She always wants to enlarge her store and save enough money for her retirement.

loans.use: to sell noodles, candies and biscuits in her grocery store.

loans.name: Zebonisso

texts.ru: Зебониссо открыла магазин в районе Файзабад. У нее магазин со смешанным ассортиментом товара. Торговлей Зебониссо занимается три года. Она берет очередной кредит для покупки сезонной детской одежды, чтобы увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en: Zebonisso opened a store in the Fayzabad area.  Her store has a variety of products.  Zebonisso has been involved in sales for three years.  She is taking out another loan to purchase seasonal children's clothing, in order to increase her turnover.

loans.use: to buy seasonal children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира 44 года, замужем. У них с Мужем есть один сын. Муж и сын помогают Гульмире в ведении бизнеса. Сейчас Гульмира занимается торговлей продуктами питания, со своего небольшого магазинчика. Свой бизнес она начала с 20,000 сом в 1993 году. Ежемесячный доход Гульмиры составляет около 15,000- 20,000 сом. По характеру человек очень честный и целеустремленный. После распада СССР, Гульмира и её муж остались в трудном положении, колхозы распались и началась повсеместная приватизцаия. Все что она добилась, она добилась благодаря её трудолюбию. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на закуп продуктов питания с целью дальнейшей реализации. На вырученные средства Гульмира собирается улучшить свои жилищные условия. В своих планах она рассказала, что хотела бы увеличить товарооборот и в будущем отремонтировать квартиру.
texts.en: Gulmira is 44 years old, married.  She and her husband have one son.  Her husband and son help Gulmira with running the business.  Currently, she is involved in selling food products at her small store.  She started her business with 20,000 som in 1993.  Gulmira's monthly income amounts to about 15,000-20,000 som.  She is a very honest and goal-oriented person.  After the breakup of the USSR, Gulmira and her husband were left in a difficult predicament, as collective farms fell apart and widespread privatization started.  Everything that she has achieved was achieved thanks to her love of hard work.  In order to further expand her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase food products for subsequent resale.  Gulmira plans to use the resulting income to improve her living conditions.  She said that her plans are to increase product turnover and repair her apartment in the future.

loans.use: to purchase food products for subsequent resale

loans.name: Luz Divina

texts.es: Luz de 46 años de edad vive en el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana d ela ciudad, con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 4 a 18 años. Allí se dedica a la venta de ranchos, víveres, refrescos y bebidas, en una tienda ubicada en su domicilio. Esta actividad la aprendió desde hace 7 años cuando trabajaba en otro negocio similar y desde principios de este año decidió independizarse y emprenderla. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y en proporciones que su clientela tiene la capacidad de comprar de acuerdo con los ingresos familiares. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, para comprar en mayor volumen y tener un inventario siempre disponible de productos que mas rotan como los víveres. Aunque Luz ha tenido otros negocios como la venta de mercancía decidió hace 7 meses emprender su tienda porque identificó la necesidad en el mercado de clientes y para responder a todas las actividades propias de una ama de casa, como la de atender su hogar y además generar ingresos que beneficien a su familia. Su mayor desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo, para lograr sus propósitos de crecimiento empresarial como ella quiere, pero ella con su persistencia muy seguramente lo conseguirá.
texts.en:
Luz, 46 years old, lives in a metropolitan area of the city of Malambo with her husband and four children, ages 4 to 18 years old. She sells food, supplies, sodas and drinks in a store located in her home. She learned how to run the business seven years ago when she was working in another similar establishment. At the beginning of this year, she decided to open her own store. She makes cash sales and sell portions that her customers are able to purchase according to their family's income.

Currently Luz is applying for a loan in order to buy products which have a quick turnover, such as supplies, in volume so that she will always have an inventory available.

Although Luz has had other businesses selling merchandise, she decided seven months ago to open this store because she identified a need customers had for a market and also her own need to address her duties as a housewife, such as taking care of her home, while also generating an income that would help her family. Her greatest challenge is acquiring sufficient working capital so that she can achieve the business growth she wants, however with her persistence she will surely do so.

loans.use: to purchase supplies in greater volume.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Gemma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Gemma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 52 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is in school.

Leonora is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell.

Leonora has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Leonora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Chiqui

texts.en:
Chiqui is 30 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Chiqui runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like shampoo, soap, sugar, milk, cream, etc.

Chiqui has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Chiqui would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like shampoo, soap, sugar, milk, cream, etc.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 56 years old, married, and has three children. Merlita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Merlita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Merlita has been farming rice for 11 years now. She has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her farming activities. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase coffee plants to renew her farm.

loans.name: Mujiba

texts.ru: Мучиба жительница города Исфара. Она разведена. Ей 45 лет. У нее двое детей. Сын Мучибы занимается частным извозом. Сама Мучиба занимается торговлей. Она более двенадцати лет занимается торговлей сухофруктов. Мучиба берет кредит для покупки кураги.
texts.en: Mujiba is a resident of the city of Isfara.  She is divorced.  She is 45 years old.  She has two children.  Mujiba's son is a cab driver.  Mujiba works in sales.  She has sold dried fruits for more then twelve years.  Mujiba is taking out a loan to buy dried apricots.

loans.use: to purchase dried apricots

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung was born in 1953. She has two children. Her 15-year-old son is a carpenter. Her daughter has gotten married. Her husband is retired. His pension is 2,500,000 VND. 

Dung makes tofu to sell in the market to earn a living. She has done her job for 30 years. Her income is about 2,500,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to make tofu and raise pigs to sell. 

She always wants to earn more money for her family’s income.

loans.use: to make tofu and raise pigs to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline, 34, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Roldan, a publicator, and is the mother of three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Evangeline operates a food processing business. She has a factory a few steps from her house where they manufacture the meat products. She earns by selling her goods to her neighbors and to suppliers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional processed and frozen meat products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Evangeline hopes to be able to expand soon, as she dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of frozen foods needed in her business.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La Señora María Luisa posee un negocio de venta de tortillas en su casa de habitación ubicada en ciudad de León. Es madre soltera de seis hijos de los cuales solo uno está a su cargo. Inicia su negocio con un pequeño capital producto de ahorros, ella realiza esta desde hace treinta y dos años labor para la mantención de su hijo.

La señora inicia diariamente la elaboración de tortillas a las 10 am a 12 pm y por la tarde de 4 pm a 6 pm las cuales son vendidas en su casa de habitación.   

El  crédito que esta solicita a Ceprodel será utilizado para comprar por mayor el producto a utilizar para la elaboración de tortilla y  nacatamales tales como  Maíz,  Leña, cal y así obtener mayores ganancia la que le permitirá realizar su sueños como es de continuar incrementando una  pequeña pulpería que tiene además de la tortillería, para lograr un mejor nivel de vida de ella  y su hijo quien estudia en la universidad.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa has a business selling tortillas out of her house in León. She is a single mother of six children of which only one is in her charge. She started her business with a small capital from her savings. She has done this work for 32 years to support her child.

She starts making tortillas everyday from 10 am to 12 pm, and from 4 to 6 in the afternoon, she sells them our of her home. 

The loan she is requesting from Ceprodel will be used to buy wholesale products for making tortillas and tamales (such as corn, firewood, lime) and make a higher profit which will allow her to realize her dreams, like to continue building a small store that has more than tortillas, to achieve a better standard of living for herself and her son who is studying at university.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood wholesale.

loans.name: Martha Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Martha patricia  posee un cafetin ubicado en una de las universidades  de la ciudad de León desde hace doce años, ella realiza esta labor  para apoyar a su esposo en  la mantención de su familia.

La señora Martha patricia se traslada a su puesto de trabajo desde las 6.30 am. Para exhibir sus productos, así como la elaboración de comida ligera como sándwich, tacos y una variedad de ricos platillos para los estudiantes que llegan a la universidad a aprender el pan del saber.

 Actualmente está solicita un crédito, el cual invertirá directamente en la compra de gaseosas, jugos, agua purificada. Al obtener dicho crédito espera mejorar sus ganancias y  surtir su negocio con productos variados de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida propia y la de su familia.

La señora Martha patricia  está muy agradecida con Ceprodel y Kiva ya que le ha ayudado a crecer en su negocio y poder salir adelante con su familia brindándole una mejor educación y formación a su hija. Sus sueños son que su negocio continúe creciendo.
texts.en:
Martha Patricia has owned a snack bar located in one of León’s universities for 12 years.  She does this work to help her husband support the family.  Martha Patricia heads off to her work place at 6:30am to display her products as well as to prepare light food like sandwiches, tacos and a variety of delicious dishes for the students who come to the university to absorb knowledge.

She’s currently asking for a loan that she’ll use directly to buy soft-drinks, juices, purified water.  By receiving this loan she hopes her profits will increase and to better stock her business with a variety of products to improve her and her family’s quality of life this way.

Martha Patricia is very grateful to Ceprodel and to Kiva because they are helping her business grow and helping her to get ahead with her family providing better education and training for her daughter.  Her dream is that the business continues growing.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, juices, purified water, bread and candy.

loans.name: Gladys Ernestina

texts.es:
La Señora Gladys  posee un negocio de venta de comida, en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León desde hace quince años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia. 

La Señor se traslada de su casa de habitación a las 7:30 am. Abre su negocio a las 8:00 am  inicia a preparar los deliciosos platillos y finaliza a las 8:00 pm. Sus clientes son  comerciantes del mercado y personas que viajan a diferentes departamento y comarca aledañas. 

solicita  a Ceprodel un credito, será utilizado para comprar por mayor  Arroz, frijoles, aceite, pollo, carne de res,  así ofrecerle a su clientela una variedad de platillos a precio más bajo, donde obtendrá mayores ingresos y así lograr a tener un mejor nivel de vida, ya que su sueños son de mejorar cada día mas su vivienda . 

Se siente agradecida con Ceprodel y Kiva ya que con los créditos recibidos anteriormente ha logrado a mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Gladys has had a food stand in one of León’s markets for 15 years; she does this work in order to support her family.  She heads out from home at 7:30am and opens her business at 8am.  She starts to prepare the delicious dishes and ends work at 8pm.  Her customers are merchants in the market and people who travel to various departments and nearby districts.

She’s asking Ceprodel for a loan that she’ll use to buy rice, beans, oil, chicken and beef to offer her customers a variety of dishes at a lower price thus earning higher income and attaining a better standard of living since her dream is to keep making home improvements every day.  She’s grateful to Ceprodel and to Kiva because her previous loans have made it possible for her to improve her business’ condition.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, chicken, beef and firewood.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.  Conchita has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Conchita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es: Casilda de 35 años de edad se dedica al comercio de ropa femenina y de calzado, los cuales promociona entre vecinos y clientes que la conocen desde hace 2 años, cuando inició su negocio.
